description:
Hidden gem! This tiki bar is really spacious and there's a lot of decor - aquariums, regularly timed volcano eruptions, cute lights etc. I came on a Saturday night and it had great vibes - enough people to keep the atmosphere fun, but it wasn't too crowded.

The drinks are also great. Their prices are average for tiki bars but the drinks are pretty strong so that was nice. I'll definitely be back to try some other drinks!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Pagan Idol was a nice stop for a night out with my girlfriends.  We were there late late Saturday night, and it was pretty quiet.  The decor is adorable, tiki torches and little submarine windows on the walls that make it look like you're under water. 

Probably the coolest part about this place is the volcano eruptions in the second half of the bar.  It was really cool to see. They also have giant shareable drinks, lit on fire.  A real fun time for everyone!

The bartenders were nice and make delicious drinks. I would definitely stop by again next time I'm in the city.
author: Jenn D.

description:
This was quite an experience for my first tiki bar adventure! I was giddy with excitement as we walked into pagan idol this particular Thursday evening. Our group walked off the streets of SF and straight into a wooden ship. We passed by a pretty aquarium and intimate 2 top tables and up a few stairs to the back room. 

We were able to grab a few drink menus to ponder are pagan libations. I decided on the banana life because it sounded utterly delicious. Rum, banana liquor, grapefruit, lime and fassionola. "What is that, anyway?" I asked the Hawaiian shirt clad sir behind the bar. It's a syrup that is made up of tropical fruits and is a staple in great tiki drinks. Sounds good, good sir. Serve it up! I watched as he created the masterpiece and garnished it with a banana leaf and plantain chips. It. Was. Everything! Not too much of any one particular flavor, and while I was a little nervous it might be super sweet it was a nice, refreshing drink that didn't make me overthink the sugar content. But let's be honest, at a tiki bar no one is counting calories!

One bit of warning for my friends who are hanging out in the back room: cling tightly to your drinks. There will be a loud burst of sound and fog to resemble that of a volcano erupting. I almost lost my drink as I was not expecting it! But once my heart returned to normal rhythm I could fully appreciate the effort and beauty of the dramatics.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Welp, I think I officially love tiki bars. Can I say that after having gone to 1 tiki bar? 

This was the perfect place to spend my last night in San Francisco. The drinks were all delicious, the space was awesome and the vibes were great from the minute you walk in. It's broken up into two rooms, the back definitely being the wackier of the two with aquariums, smoke machines and volcanos. The front room is a little cozier with plenty of seating. They have a huge menu with some pretty yummy looking drinks but I was afraid of waking up with a sugar induced headache. I asked the waiter what he recommended and opted for the classic daiquiri. It was definitely the least fun looking out of my groups, coming in a classy glass as opposed to a fish bowl, but I absolutely loved it. 

I was here with a group of about 7 and there was plenty of room to sit or stand. The music was great but not too loud so we could still hold a conversation. I can't wait to be back in the city and come back to my favorite (only) tiki bar.
author: Katarina L.

description:
Pagan Idol is a tiki paradise!!

We stopped by PI in search of an umbrella topped cocktail, and stumbled upon the jackpot. 

The restaurant/bar gives off some cool tiki vibes with aquariums, erupting volcanos, and themed cocktails. There's a ton of seating both in the front and the back, plus several tiki huts that can be reserved for your party in advance!

This is definitely a place you need to visit more than once in order to explore the menu. With tons of yummy creations on the menu I was slightly overwhelmed while choosing my drink. 

I ended up ordering Banana Life after sampling a friends. This cocktail was delicious with grapefruit, lime, and Dominican rum all made into a slushy! 
 
If you're feeling a little ballsy, you can also order the Pagans Choice, where your bartender will choose your next cocktail for you!
author: Hayley H.

description:
Historically speaking, I am not a rum drinker, but I will make an exception for a super rad tiki bar on my last night in San Fransisco. This place is on point. Fleek? What do the kids say?

Anyway, two drinks were most certainly enough for me. Pagan Love and Pagan Potion were my forms of worship that evening. Holy smokes, so delicious. Tiki drinks usually look good, but these drinks blew me out of the water. Pagan Love, enjoyed first, was rum, lime, orange, guava, papaya, and funk bass lines. That's right, delicious they were, those funk bass lines. The sweetness and citrus was balanced perfectly. As far as the Pagan Potion goes, it has me at Chartreuse. It was herbal and coconut-y... Freaking delicious. 

I never figured out the rhyme or reason, but every so often a really loud fog blasted out from the ceiling. I get fog...tiki bars... What I didn't get was that it was so loud when it turned on it could make everyone at the bar spill their drinks from being startled. It was hilarious, but might make more work for them in the end. May be worth investing in a quieter fog machine so you don't have a bunch of drunk folks spilling sugar-y drinks everywhere. Regardless, the quirkiness of it locked in that fifth star. Worship on, my friends!
author: Max R.

description:
Came here on a happy hour. Very happy to see some old friends. The drinks are very strong and super pretty. I'm not a tiki person. This is a tiki bar. When I think about tiki, I think about Tahiti, and I don't recall umbrella drinks while there, just lots of Tahitian vanilla flavored things. A friend had explained to me about the subculture of tiki bars, and how so many are so into it. I don't get it. But I do get why it's very festive and people get excited about fruity drinks. I get excited about making human connections so I go to wherever my friends wanted to go and this is where they wanted to come. We had a couple of rounds of name sake drinks with pretty flowers and little umbrellas. Then another friend showed up and he ordered the same drink as mine. 

The crowd is your usual financial district peeps, mostly young, mostly are discussing about their careers or flirting with one another. At 5 pm the back space opens up and you can hang out and feel the fog coming in, very atmospheric. 

I had to cut my visit short as I had another date and he was waiting for me outside. I hugged my friends goodbye, leaving my barely touched drink to them to polish off. I can tell that the evening was just starting for my friends!
author: Victoria E.

description:
My first tiki bar experience so I can't really compare it to much but eff it I had a really good time. I was in the area having a team dinner, and we decided to continue the good times at Pagan Idol. Super cool vibes as soon as you walk in, including a friendly greeting from the dude checking IDs that night. Awesome decor all around. There's a lower bar area in the front, walk up a few steps to another bar with a bunch more seating in the back. We started at the upper bar where we ordered drinks and then eventually settled at the tables in the lower bar area, chit-chatting and chilling while enjoying our bevvies. They're big so I legit sipped on one the entire time we were there, and it was plenty. 

Definitely will be back.
author: Jon S.
Wesley S.

description: This is the boozy lovechild of Disney's Enchanted Tiki Room and The Rainforest Cafe. Strong-ass drinks and generous pours (although, when in a tiki bar, order a damn sugar and rum soaked cocktail, ok?). Three levels of seating with unique atmospheres in each, it allows for uncrowded space and also has lovely dark nooks and crannies that you can retreat into like a hermit crab, should you choose. Great stained glass, Kraken blown glass, digital Life Aquatic portholes, aquariums and tiki idols that roar and spew fog every half hour or so (had enough cocktails that I actually can't accurately tell you the intervals lol). Solid experience.
author: Aubrie R.

description: It was pretty crowded on a Thursday night! There are limited seats. The ambiance is dark and tiki themed which is cute! It's a little too dark inside for my liking though. They have a lot of themed drinks. I don't like their paper straws though because they get soggy.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
I honestly don't know what to make of Pagan Idol. 

Pagan Idol has a tiki bar themed concept and it is kitschy over-the-top island to the max. There is a cave grotto, there is a starry night sky, there is every vaguely island themed piece of decor available, including Kraken light sconces. 

You can order drinks in bowls and split them with a group. We got the Scorpion Bowl and the Frozen Potion bowl for three. The Frozen Potion was delicious. The Scorpion Bowl was fairly spicy.

The most expensive menu item is $125, and it is a drink that comes on fire and serves 8-10. If you order this drink, smoke and lights come on, and a loudspeaker says something unintelligible to celebrate your choice. 

This place is really committed to the theme, and it shows.
author: Jenée S.

description:
I don't like it quite as much as smugglers cove, which is the obvious comp, mostly because it's a bit too rowdy for my taste when I'm paying this much for drinks. I like rowdy bars as much as the next guy, but when I'm paying top dollar for pretty excellent tiki drinks, I'd also like to be able to hear people 3 feet away from me without them shouting.

Also, it's easy to forget when you're at a tiki bar, but you don't have to just get tiki drinks. If you know you'll regret that third mai tai, it's ok to get a modelo. Or just get the third mai tai and lean into the hangover. idk. but you don't have to.
author: Misha T.

description:
Cute tiki bar with strong drinks! You have been warned.

I came here to meet a friend up for drinks before dinner and got their pineapple daiquiri. Oh boy... I definitely felt that daiquiri eventhough it didn't really taste that strong. The prices here are quite reasonable for what you get. They have a lot of fun items on the menu. Highly would recommend this place if you like sweet fruity drinks that are potent at the same time.

It is quite dark in here but you get used to it after awhile. The ambiance is nice and they have some gimmicky things they do every now and then to hype it up so it can get a bit loud. I will definitely be back to try out their other drinks next time I am in SF.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I had a lot of fun here and it was unexpected because I'm not a huge fan of tiki themed bars. Once upon a time I thought tiki was tacky, but not anymore earthlings!

I had the Pagan Love concoction and it was deliciously strong. All of the drinks were well priced and well embellished with flowers.

The inside is what you would expect. Tiki themed everything and quite hot and humid inside which emulates the island feel. I went on a Thursday evening after work and the crowd was alright, not too stuffy and there was space to walk and even ample seating. 

The speakers spit out hurricane noises which I thought was hilarious.
author: Connie M.

description: I'm not a bar kind of girl. In fact, I try to avoid drinking alcohol since I'm not a fan of the taste (I think I am allergic now). However, Pagan Idol has a great ambiance and I had good company which made it more fun. Downstairs is Gingers which is interesting and is an adventure of its own. As for Pagan Idol's drinks, I got a mocktail, and it was good. The bartender told me it was a bit of grenadine, lemonade, and ginger syrup. I liked it way more than I thought I would. Pagan Idol is a cute tiki bar with cool decor, and with a cool group, this can be lots of fun.
author: Alice W.

description:
Yelp led me here and the free Burlesque show convinced me to stay! Super cool Tiki bar with amazing decor and very funky vibes. The bartenders are awesome and make some pretty delicious beverages so I strongly suggest you try them out!
There was a Burlesque show in the back area of the bar that was simply fantastic! The performers were stunning and their acts captivating. Definitely going back next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Leah M.

description: Definitely a newer tiki establishment. Bigger inside than it looks. The decor is pretty awesome. They have two bars (smart). Wasn't too crowded or hard to get a drink. Great drinks. Ordered the Pineapple Express- not on the menu anymore, but they still made it. Almost like a dolewhip, if it was strictly for adults, and not frozen and less sweetness.
author: Giena L.

description: When it comes to Tiki bars San Fran isn't shirt of choices. But this is one of the better options in the entire city. With a back deck area that is the highlight of the bar. Scenery and ambiance are really the only true way to gauge these bars, because it's pretty hard to mess up drinks that are all pretty much 3/4 juices and a couple rums!
author: Richard B.

description:
Interesting bar! I felt like I was in Hawaii or another tropical island. Take your coworkers here for happy hour and you won't be disappointed -- except for the food selections! I was sad that they didn't have snacks or fries, but the drinks here are quite exquisite. I didn't even know such a place existed in SF!

Head all the way to the back of the bar and you'll be in for a treat! Their back room bar is amazing. Every one of the drinks are creative and presented beautifully. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I must not have checked in here, because there is absolutely no way I would have seen this check-in and opted not to write a review. 

At the time of my visit (in February of last year), I was dating this guy who thought he could out-surprise me in picking restaurants and bars for us to check out. 

I don't remember where we had dinner, but afterwards he took me to this bar that was...eh...it was alright. He was having an okay time, but I didn't want the night to end on a *cough*boring*cough* note, so I hit up the Yelpiverse for some nearby suggestions.

Whaddayaknow, Pagan Idol popped up in the first few search results, and we were out of that lame, I mean, normal bar within five minutes. 

Tiki bars can be hit or miss. There's only one tiki bar in San Jose that I'm aware of, and without naming it here, I will simply write that it is wholly mediocre. The drinks there are just uninspired and weak. This is not the case at Pagan Idol.

While trying to avoid sounding cheesy or cliche, I have to be honest--walking into Pagan Idol is like being teleported to another world (or how I imagine that would be). A world that looks like a pimped out tiki bar. 

I don't really know how to describe the bar interior, as writing that it looks like a tiki bar is too vague and doesn't do this place justice. Just look at the pictures and know it's dark and oddly romantic.

I dig it when bartenders love their job, and I dig it when bars offer special drinks that are tasty, and preferably are affordable. Pagan Idol satisfies most of these...and luckily, the drinks aren't too expensive. 

My date was so impressed with this place, he wanted to try one of their wild $30-$40 "group" drinks with me, so we got the Rum Monkey. It's a tropical-tasting concoction, in whatever way you consider "tropical" to taste. I liked the banana flavor, in particular. The Rum Monkey can serve two regular drinkers, three light drinkers, or one heavy drinker (me). 

Whenever I see my Yelp friends or the foodie instagrammers I follow checking out Pagan Idol, I feel a tinge of happiness for their discovery of such a San Francisco gem.

There are a lot of bars to check out in SF, so one such as this might be easy to overlook. Do yourself a favor and make time to check out Pagan Idol.
author: Colby D.

description:
You come here to worship the rum!

Bartender was cool.  The menu was a little daunting to choose from as a first time pagan, so I just told him to make me a drink that was strong but not too sweet, and that's exactly what I got.  He took the time to explain what was in it and I then ventured into the brighter back room.

Now this room was a bit wilder.  The theme was changed from the front room.  This area was a bit wilder.  It had an island village feel with a brighter bar and a smoke machine keeping things "volcanoey."

People were running around like it was a playground.  Plenty of space to sit or stand and just a fun vibe all over.  I'll pay my respects to the idol next time I'm back this way.
author: John M.

description: Really cool high end tiki bar. The drinks are awesome, and the atmosphere is fun, dark, and Polynesian inspired. Don't go here if you're looking for more of an. Uncle's tiki bar basement vibe.
author: Kristi S.

description: It's a small hole in the wall bar that you would never expect. We came pretty early where there was just the bar. The atmosphere and ambiance were calm and relaxing. It wasn't too loud so having a casual conversation with friends was manageable. Past a certain point, they open up the back which is a lot bigger and cozier to fit bigger parties. My friends and I ordered a rum bowl and it was definitely more than enough for us. The drink was a bit strong but it is just more bang for your buck. They have a wide variety of drinks to your liking if you are picky, but I will definitely come back again to try some different drinks
author: Melvin W.

description:
Alright, one of the coolest tiki bar designs or what?

The Birds of Paradise ($14) was good!  Strong and plentiful.  Loved the whip so much!  It was the best part of the drink honestly.  This is a well-presented drink with a good amount of alcohol.

My friend enjoyed her banana life drink and it had a dried banana!  This was also a strong drink with too much ice.

One thing that needs to be replaced is the paper straw that they serve the drinks with because after a while, it didn't hold up anymore!  I was trying to get more of that delicious whip.  They could also do with a little less ice please.  Although the menu has a nice design, the descriptions are vague so I had no idea what was in some of them.

This is a really cool tiki bar to check out if you're in the area.  The place is much bigger than we thought it would be.  There was a cool fish tank at the front and the decor of the place made us feel underwater.  The skulls on the stairs and the periodic smoking eruption effect was pretty cool.  A line forms outside on some evenings and a table can be difficult to grab but we were able to snag one as soon as another group left.  Although the drinks are on the pricier side, they are very strong and well-crafted.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
These drinks are quite pricey on the surface, but if you choose well (or come on an empty stomach after work like I did) you'll be rewarded with quite the buzz. The Daywalker and the Jungle Bird made for a simultaneously fruity and boozy one-two punch. So much so that I had to sit a while fumbling just a bit aimlessly with my Yelp app to try to find some cheap eats nearby to help soak up all the booze.

Service is friendly and engaging, and overall the vibe was casual and laid-back. Despite the fact that it's a downtown tiki bar, it doesn't necessarily mean that it draws too many douchey types. If you're still somewhat sober, do check out the eclectic decor too, in particular all the fish tanks. Thanks Yelpers for another good find!
author: Vincent L.

description: Whenever I visit a city I always look for tiki bars.  S.F. has so many to choose from I went on a mini tiki crawl.  Pagan Idol was my first stop.  I went right when they opened.  This was good because it was not to busy and I easily got a seat at the bar.  The downside was that the back room was not open and it was still daylight so I think some of the ambiance was lost.  I ordered a Banana Life.  It was excellent.  My bartender was friendly and personable.  I will def come back next time I am in town and get the full experience.
author: Heather N.

description:
So this is my favourite tiki bar in the city. Never really hangout in the front section area, almost always go straight to the back. If you go sometime directly after work it's a lot more busy than going later through the work week. Weekends are also pretty busy from what I remember. 

When it is very busy, you're going to have to get lucky to find either a standing area near the barrels, or a booth. The spot I like to chill is right by the pond up on the mini stage. 

The drinks are also all very tasty, and I think I've only had one drink that I wouldn't get again. You can swap your cup out for a frozen pineapple as a glass, but I don't really think it's worth it. Drinks are decently expensive, but on par with other tiki bars so it is more of a treat than a regular thing. Can also take some time to get a drink if there are a lot of people ahead of you. 

Fully recommend getting one of the bowls to share with friends. I forget which one is was, but they come out and do some fire tricks as part of the bowl presentation which is cool. 

Menu was "recently" changed, but I've only been once since then so I can't comment.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Look for the drinks with the skulls on the menu! They're limited to 2 per person for a reason :)
Most of us got the Daywalker, and it was pretty strong. I wonder how my night would've turned out if I got 2 there, but we each got 1 and then bounced to the next bar.
Cool little aquarium at the front, awesome decor that makes you feel like you're inside a boat, and you get a free little plastic sword with your drink!
author: Michael K.

description: Hands down best bar in San Francisco. Perfect ambiance and decor (THEY HAVE A REAL LIVE PUFFER FISH!!!!!), delicious drinks, passion fruit whipped cream. The Bird of Paradise is worth the trek alone. It's also actually spacious enough to accommodate a reasonable sized group so you can go there with your friends unlike several other tiki bars in the city.
author: Catherine S.

description: My friends and I were planning a trip to the Tonga Room and we were told by a few bartenders and young people living in San Francisco that Pagan Idol was a much better tiki bar and we should go there too. So now, having experienced them both on the same night, I didn't think either one was better, I think they are different experiences. Pagan Idol seems to attract a much younger demographic than the Tonga Room and has a hipster vibe. Pagan Idol has semi private tiki huts that you can reserve and they have fresh flowers floating in the tiki drinks. The Tonga Room has food, Pagan Idol does not. Pagan Idol has some sort of eruption with lights and smoke that you have to be near to see. The Tonga Room has thunder, lightning, rain, and the bar and restaurant wrap around a huge pool of water. You can see all of that from most anywhere in the establishment. The Pagan Idol does not appear to have servers; we had to go wait at the bar to order cocktails and we were provided table service at the Tonga Room. I must admit after all of the hype about Pagan Idol I was disappointed, but keep in mind I am not a member of Pagan Idol's targeted young demographic. The young folks we sat with in one of tiki huts are regulars and brought cans of Pringles to eat due to the lack of food availability, so if you're planning a night there, you might want to bring along some snacks.
author: Merry C.

description: Love this tiki bar! Such a cute spot, got there around 6:45 on Saturday, there was room in the front area to sit but then the back room open at 7. They do a cute announcement when they open the doors and wow this bar is spacious! Unlike another tiki bar that is very intimate, this space is exactly my style, ample seating and room to move. There is a huge tiki statue, a waterfall and little booths you can reserve and an entire bar in the second room. The best out of the drinks we got which were all good, but the thai tea was far superior. There is like a passionfruit whipped cream or something, oh man so good. I saw a guy drinking red stripe at the bar so they got the beer for those not into the tiki drinks. The bartenders and door man were all so friendly too. There was also free tequila shots from a business that night so that wasn't bad at all! Would totally be back! Great place for a birthday or group get together.
author: Victoria J.

description: Pago Idol is a small tropical paradise in the middle of SF!  The decor is kitschy-awesome and totally sets the mood.  I love the "storms" that occur every so often to enhance the ambiance.  The bartenders are fun and truly appear to enjoy their jobs.  Drinks are fancy-pants with all the fun accessories, making them fun to hold, drink, dance with, etc!  The only slight problem I have is that the drinks are so damn sweet.... I feel like the day after visiting Pagan Idol gives me a sugar hangover rather than the booze (maybe?)  Luckily, the menu helps guide patrons to different levels of sweetness and I vow to pay more attention to it next time!  This bar is certainly a winner in my book and among my friends.
author: Andrea H.

description: This Tiki bar is nice with some cool decor, but I wouldn't come here often. It seems to attract a lot of tourists, tech people who come in with backpacks, and clusters of people who shout at each other. The drinks are pretty good though, and some come with cool garnishes! I won't visit here anytime soon, but maybe if my friends are in the mood of going to a Tiki bar and don't want to stand in line to get into the Tonga room.
author: Christina W.

description:
Pagan Idol is a pretty cool tiki bar concept in a sea of generic bars in the Financial District.  They commit pretty hard to the tiki bar concept with the most noticeable aspect being the stone head that leaks fog and ominous sounds every once in a while.

The bartenders wear sharp Hawaiian shirts and hats and the drinks are appropriately themed.  There's two bars and the joint is pretty big and spacious.  It's created by the people who brought you the Devil's Acre which is also great but this is one of my favorite bars because it's different and unique.

You can buy the tiki cups at the joint for $7 a pop.  It's pretty fun.
author: Mark C.

description:
Stopped by pagan idol for a coworkers 21st birthday -- we wanted to take her to a 'unique' bar close to the financial district, and that's exactly what pagan idol is. It's a fun tiki bar with a good amount of space and two different 'levels'. They have awesome tiki decor and a waterfall feature that releases fog every 20 minutes or so, which is fun. The drinks are what you would expect - overpriced, fruity and tasty! The bartenders know what they're doing - the birthday girl had a whiskey sour with egg whites - I got a taste and it was damn good.

If you're looking for a unique bar in fidi- this ones fun. Expect overpriced fish bowls that will sneak up on you quick!
author: Tyler C.

description:
Pagan Idol is the younger cooler version of the Tonga Room. The vibes here are a lot more chill and laid back. Decorations are great and it feels like you're on vacation in here if you get a nice seat. The bar tenders are fun and their drinks have great presentations. A lot of the drinks have special mugs that you can take home with you but it'll cost you. Also a lot of other tables got their main drink, and they do this little show for you when you get it, but it can be quite distracting and loud to people who are trying to have conversations in other parts of the bar.

However, their drinks are pretty good. You can taste the alcohol, but at the same time, they're sweet enough that you could drink that drink the whole night. Got the rum chi chi and I loved it. They could try to use better straws or at least you'll have to drink your drink really fast. My straw started dying on me after about 20 minutes. Would definitely come back.
author: Tatiana T.

description: Gotta love me some pagan idol. Lots of rum options, price point is reasonable for SF, fun environment for sure - smoke machines, enthusiastic staff, lots of rooms for dancing, sitting, and hanging with friends. Location is great for downtown location. Also close to lots of other places. Went twice in one weekend. Can't wait to be back!
author: Kimia D.

description:
A Tiki Bar with great drinks? Pagan Idol is located in a very unassuming row of bars in the Financial District. I remember watching an episode of The Layover where Anthony Bourdain (rest his soul) was in The Tonga Room and thought this is a really cool bar. I don't know much about the tiki bar scene here in the city though. 

Enter Pagan Idol where the corridor is like being inside a ship with port holes that allow you to see the ocean life. That is a real aquarium with fish and wooden tiki men floating inside in case you're wondering. There is a regularly scheduled tropical thunderstorm and rainfall inside. You too can experience it without having to pack your bags and fly. 

I'm not sure what frozen concoction I drank but it definitely included rum in a beautifully decorated cup, an umbrella, and an orchid. It definitely passes my litmus test of what a tiki bar should feel like.
author: Tim G.

description:
One of the best tiki bars in San Francisco. Excellent cocktails, in an eclectic ambiance. The space is large, separated into three different areas. Upon entering you feel as if you walked onto a pirate ship. The high wooden ceilings are curved, and adorned with blown glass octopus sconces. Set into the walls are animated portholes displaying ocean scenes, and a large fish tank holds beautiful tropical fish and even a puffer fish! Decor is eclectic, ranging from a vintage ships wheel to a stained glass peacock. In the room beyond is a second bar, with a more traditional tiki vibe-glass floats, carved wooden statues, and colorful lighting. Further inside is a spacious room suited to larger parties, with tiki huts and a volcano feature.

The bartenders here are talented industry professionals, well versed in crafting classic tiki cocktails. The menu includes around 15 beverage options ranging from well known standards like the Mai Tai to fun twists and multi-person bowl drinks. I got the Sparkle and Froth ($19), which is one of the best tiki cocktails I have ever had. Exquisitely balanced layers of pineapple, lime, and spices, packed with a powerful punch of three different varieties of rum. The price initially seemed high, but this is a VERY strong drink (limit of 2 per guest!). My boyfriend got the Rum Chi Chi ($13), which was also delicious, and served in a cute coconut mug. Coconut, spices, and dark rum are blended into a frothy sweet treat that tasted like ice cream. I highly recommend Pagan Idol and will definitely return in the future.
author: Alyssa F.

description:
Pagan Idol is a really fun bar to go to with friends especially if any of them are into tiki bars or Hawaiian themed bars. The drinks are super creative and VERY potent. They may not taste like they are strong but have a couple and it will hit you! There are a ton of variety with the drinks so I am sure anyone you take can find something they will like, the drinks are super fun and the garnishes and toppings will surprise you. 

The one downside is that the bar is pretty small and it gets super busy. So if the bar is really busy then it might take a while to get a drink since the cocktails are pretty intricate.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Cool bar with a cool concept and interesting drinks. I've only been there twice. It wasn't too loud or overly crowded though it can get a little busy during a weekend night. My only peeve is that it doesn't have any music (the first time I went there was some kind of tribal drum beat in the background but I wouldn't count that as music). I wish they played some light music. But I suppose it doesn't exactly go with the theme and its not really a music/dance kind of place. Its nice for having a good chat over drinks with some friends.

PS: If you want to feel fancy and have your drink in a coconut or pineapple, be sure to tell the bartender. You have to pay extra for it.
author: Lasya B.

description: Pagan Idol is a fun, unique tiki bar. While the drinks are on the pricey side, they're delicious and typically pretty strong. My favorite is the Bird of Paradise. The decor is on point and eye catching throughout the entire bar. Even the ceiling has twinkle lights! If this place ever starts doing a happy hour I'd definitely stop by frequently, but for now it's a great "treat yourself" bar.
author: Jessie K.

description:
Pagan Idol is a fun little tiki bar spot that...actually is a lot bigger than it first seems.

+The decor is awesome with the appropriate tiki decor. My friend gave a little bit of a shriek when the tiki god started 'speaking' with added light and fog effects (just as a heads-up). The music is a tad loud to make conversations a little more difficult but otherwise, a great hangout area. 
+Let's talk drinks. The menu is awesome with a map of the drinks and a variety of collectible and crazy drink containers all-around. Average pricing seems to be around $12-$15 (depending on the size of the drink). I got the port royal which was solid and great to sip on. My friend got a cider (not a huge beer/cider variety but not surprising). 
+This place is really deceiving and bigger than it appears. Make sure to move towards the back of the area if the front seems overly busy. 

+/- Bars/seating can be a little strange. Make sure to ask before you sit down whether the available bar is open.
author: John W.

description:
PROS: 

- Delicious drinks
- Cool decor, felt like I was at Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland
- Hip place to be 
- Not too loud

CONS: 

- Why TF is it so damn stuffy and hot inside?!?!!?
- Some douchey drunk norcal people
- Paper straws deteriorate after about 10 minutes
author: Chong Y.

description: The decor inside is stunning!  Dark, warm, sexy.  The bartenders are friendly and I loved my drink, Sparkle and Frost, in their signature lono tiki mug!  We sat at the front bar and it felt like we were on a voyage with the port holes and nautical-themed decor.  Then, when we arrived at our destination, they sounded a horn and a back door opened up to a huge back room!  There was a bigger bar and tiki idols... the same dim lighting but more of a tropical feel.  I only wish we'd had more time to stay and try more cocktails.
author: Aileen M.

description:
The ambiance of the place is so cool. There is a fog machine towards the back which makes for some cool pics if there aren't any customers sitting in front of it.

Drinks are reasonably priced for a tiki bar and the staff are AMAZING. Really busy when I went but they multitasked customers to perfection. 

If you are near the place pop I. For a drink and a cool pic.
author: Art D.

description:
Well I have this thing with me and every time I go to San Francisco. I have made it a personal mission of mine to get to know "The City" a bit better. So in getting to know SF better I have decided that I have to visit a new restaurant or social setting each and every time I set foot off the "Bay Area Rapid Transit" I been seeing a lot of my fellow "Yelpers" raving about the "Pagan Idol" as of late and after passing by it may times along my.."SF Shenanigans" I figured that it was about time that I make my guest appearance..

Thursday August 31, 2017
Location: Pagan Idol, San Francisco Ca
People: 1 Adult

Story: 
"The Pagan Idol" had been on my "Yelpdar" for some time now. I have a think about themed bars now. I seemed to have been to quite a few as of late and IDK if that is a coincidence or not but....I do like "Pina Coladas and Dancing in the Rain" so this place was from what the "Yelpdom" has reviewed is a good departure from my usual "Motto" (See Headline) so I knew that I had to drop by and see for myself. 

Service/Hospitality:
Well after taking a few snaps and going through them to make sure that I have the right one. I took out my ID and approached the door and was greeted by the very cool bouncer. He checked my ID and then complimented my on my overall look for the evening and then I made my way inside the bar. Of course when I went it was pretty happening inside, it was around happy hour and post work for a lot of people so I'm assuming that is why service at the bar wasn't all the way on point for me, but then again I saw people get served the same drink made better than what I received. But all that is for another part of this review, overall the service was "Okay" to say the least, the door guy was great, the crowd was seeming to get to some of the bartenders. But at least I finally got to get me a drink.

Drink/Atmosphere:
Well after being cut a few times and waiting about 15 min or so (To be expected) for a drink, I decided to go with a "Pina Colada" $13.00 to go along with spirit of the establishment. I have to say that I've had better, well at least I saw them make other peoples better than what I got (Friends Maybe) The drink was watered down, and unlike any "Pina Colada" that I've had. They didn't even even fill all my cup with the mixture. I honestly had a better one at "Bamboo Hut" on Broadway but the atmosphere is a bit better here at "Pagan Idol" a pretty diverse and hip crowd makes up what goes here and the very "swanky" decor is what seems to make up what this establishment is about. I have to say I was more impressed by the atmosphere more than my drink. 

Overall:
"Pagan Idol" is a pretty cool place and it sits right in a busy heavily trafficked area between the Soma and North Beach Areas. I can understand why this place has the following it does, it's festive and different. This bar is more than just a bar, it's pretty unique and seems to have a pretty good following even word of mouth. Aside from this "Meh" experience here, I do see myself going back "One More Time" it's not too far off from where I like to hang out and I do feel like some of the other menu offering are intriguing. So maybe next time I will just try a Mai Thai.
author: Tre S.

description: They let me in, then apparently there was a private event so I was not allowed to stay. Not posted on their site. Only posted on Facebook a few hours ago long after we planned our afternoon / evening. 0 stars if I could.
author: Brandon J.

description: Solid joint. Tasty drinks and cool vibe! Great drinks with wonderfully presented garnish.
author: Brandon D.

description:
Not only is this spot so much fun in general, but it's the perfect place to bring people visiting the city for something unique and super memorable. 

Go to dinner across the street in any of the cute restaurants in Belden Alley and then hop right over here afterwards. 

We made a reservation through the Yelp app on a Thursday night. At first I wasn't going to, but am so glad we did because it got us a really nice private table in one of the back cabanas- PRO TIP: request one of those!!

We ordered the $60 drink bowl for 4 of us. We doubted its legitimacy and I will never do that again- we got DRUNK. Danger is the ingredient listed and I would have to agree on that one. So good though!! PRO TIP: order a Topo Chico with it and pour some in to dilute it a bit- making it a great spritzer. 

They also have burlesque on some nights. Go go go!!! You'll love it!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Came here for my birthday celebration with my girlfriends and loved it!

It's so much fun here! The interior is decorated with an island theme and every so often there's a fog machine/voice of the island gods that plays over the loud speaker.

We got there around 10:15 on a Saturday night and there was no wait, and though many tables were already taken, we had no trouble finding a spot in the corner.

Getting drinks was pretty easy since they had 2 bars. We didn't have to wait more than a couple minutes to get to the front. The bartenders are super awesome! I told them about my cinnamon allergy and they customized a drink for our group to share. 

We had 2 drinks: the rum chi chi (like a pina colada w/bananas... I wouldn't recommend if you don't like frothy drinks) and the bird of paradise (my fave! Basically a blended margarita with an island twist)

They don't really play music here, there's just some tropical sounds/birds in the background, so you shouldn't come here expecting to dance. 

Idk if they're trying to make it feel like a tropical island, but it was really warm in here.

I think this is a good place to hang out/share a couple of drinks for 2-3 ppl before going out for a night of dancing.
author: Tia O.

description:
Poppin' tiki bar in FiDi. There are some fun drinks there, and the bartenders know what they're doing. It can get pretty crowded, but if you find a stool along the wall, you can watch fake fish swim in their fake ship windows. Or if you're not into that, there's a fish tank of real fish, including one sad pufferfish. 

There are some drinks made for sharing, so bring your honey and have a tall glass of Bird of Paradise topped with spiced whipped cream and fancy inedible flowers.
author: Sophie W.

description: Love the cocktails and ambiance... it's great for happy hour or a date. There is a crap ton of options. It's pretty big for a group.
author: Nathan D.

description: Cute and themed tikki bar!! Very well decked out with great bar tenders and amazing cocktails!
author: Ruchi M.

description: Great ambiance and yummy drinks. We ordered pina coladas and they were just right not too sweet.
author: Jeanne R.

description:
Ummm - yeah this place is pretty dope.  It's a super cool/fun tiki themed bar.  The decor is amazingly beautiful and cool.  There's octopus legs coming out of walls, there's a volcano, huge tiki statues, volcano that actually goes off, stars that light up on the ceiling.  It's intense.  

Def note: there is a front AND a back room.  The back room is not always open, I believe it opens later, but it's worth it.  

I've been here for drinks, as well as held an event here.  Both were great experiences.  The drinks come in cool mugs/cups, they have fun names, and I love that they use Dominican rum in some of their cocktails.  If you have a group - get a bowl and let them light that bad boy on fire!

I definitely recommend this spot if you are looking for something fun and unique.  

My feedback to Pagan Idol is for the event I held there -- the drinks were great, so we had a lot of them...BUT there's no food allowed!  So things got real fun real quick.  I just really wish we were allowed to have food because we are dealing with hard liquor here and I was trying to eat banana chips out of everyone's drinks.
author: Michelle S.

description: Pagan Idol is a really fun bar to go out at. But don't do it too often unless your wallet is fat! As for the design of the place, it is like a ship with an actual aquarium at the entrance. The bartenders are dressed in sailor outfits or tropical button downs, which adds a nice touch. The owners clearly put a lot of effort into constructing and decorating the place because I felt like I was on an exotic ship! After having a look at the menu, I realized I could only come here occasionally... most cocktails are around $14 and beers are around $7. The annoying thing about the cocktails is that most of them have rum in it, so if you aren't a fan of rum, your options are very limited. The booths look cool to sit at! Overall, a fun but expensive place to pregame at, then go out to the club!
author: Louis Suo L.

description: Cool Tiki bar that serves up tropical drinks which is great especially in this weather. The waiters wear beach house. Same owner as another favorite, Rickhouse. The front room is small but open up the bigger back room later in the evening.
author: Sunil R.

description: Love the drinks and atmosphere, but over all the staff are the most top notch sweet hearts. It's amazing watching them mix drinks and work their magic. Almost had a bad ending when my party split up to leave and use the bathroom. When we remembered to trade in our purchased mug for a clean one to take home it had disappeared from our table. The rest of the empty cups were still there. The bartenders remembered us and saved the day! Don't let your nice tiki mugs go unwatched! Even if it's a slow night.
author: Aura M.

description: Came here last night with friends and loveddddd the interior. The drinks were definitely on the very strong side- I ordered bird of paradise and man it had quite a sour kick to it. Everyone's drinks were quite strong so if you're looking to feel the alchy fast this is definitely the place for you! I would definitely go back.
author: Prasiddha H.

description:
Full on tiki-themed bar - this place is totally kitschy and I loved it. 

You enter the bar feeling like you're inside some kind of Polynesia-bound pirate ship and then sometime shortly after opening a gong sounds, fog descends, the back doors swing back and the space opens up to be about 3 times the size complete with straw tiki huts, a second bar, and an LCD waterfall. Plenty of space to enjoy with their great iterations on all your tiki favorites, including lots of group drinks in retro glassware.  

If you're lucky you'll even get to check out the puffer fish in the front aquarium :)
author: Kara S.

description:
If you're on a date, get here early, go to the back, and snuggle up in one of the few tables around the edges of the room.

Every so often, you'll hear the crack of thunder and lightning, and you'll feel like you're stranded on that tropical island with your SOS sign and a passing ship in the foreground ignoring you. It doesn't matter...you're happy, and you don't have to check your email every hour. 

Order her one of those strong rum drinks, order one for you, and enjoy. Better yet, order one of those fishbowls and share.
author: Ron L.

description:
OVERALL: My bf and I love cocktail bars and have been meaning to check out Pagan Idol for a while - this did not disappoint! 
 
THE WAIT: None on a Saturday at 9pm. They were busy but not crowded. 
 
DÉCOR: This place was gorgeous and we loved all the detail. The first room looks like the inside of the ship - there was a fishtank with a blowfish at the entrance, and the windows had screens with ocean views. The next room had more of an island vibe, with an entire volcano island that smoked. You gotta come back several times and sit in different rooms to get the full experience.
 
THE DRINKS: 
* Witch Doctor, left ($20) - 4 stars
Nicely balanced, great smoothie texture.
 
* Banana Life, right ($12) - 3.5 stars
I originally ordered this but switched with my boyfriend to drink the Witch Doctor - this was a bit strong.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Very friendly bouncer and bartender(s). Drinks are strong but expensive (average for SF standards) ~$12-15 per drink. Convenient location if you're looking for something close to BART. Cute decor, feels like you're away, with the cutest blowfish in the aquarium. Good amount of seating space, this is a first/second date haven, especially on weekdays.
author: Ellen C.

description: Cute tiki bar, drinks are sweet and fun atmosphere. You have to go up to the counter to order and there's often little seating, but it's a fun place to hang out. The ambiance is nice and i LOVE that it's not too loud so you don't have to scream to be heard. All bartenders have been friendly and accommodating. Definitely will be back!
author: Sharon C.

description:
Definitely has a theme bar atmosphere and is really nice if you're into tiki bars. Their drinks menu is a foldout like high school folders and drinks names are inventive. The drinks are good and strong, that is if you're into sweeter and fruitier cocktails.

I prefer the classic drinks nowadays - or variations of the classics - so Pagan Idol is not in my drinking-establishments rotation, but I would return.

Note I've been here on a rainy Saturday late night when it's packed so it can get pretty loud. Then, went again on another Saturday clear and mild late evening but the place was not packed. There was more space and it didn't feel stuffy, so go early evening to beat the crowds.
author: Peter L.

description:
Off The Hook !!! Pagan Idol is Hidden Gem . Be Sure you have your  ID , The Door Guys  were Checking them when I went on Saturday night  .  The Minute I walked through the Door I was Teleported to a Polynesian Island . It was So Cool . 

The Décor is Great the Aquarium in the Front Bar Area is pretty cool. There is a Great Stained Glass Window over the Front Bar.  The Big Tiki Statues and all the Polynesian Weapons on the Wall Wow !!! 

What I liked was the Back Room Bar Area - The Captains Quarters . There's   Plenty of Room To Stretch Out. There are  Grass Huts and Big Wood Log Seats and some of the Areas In the Back Bar are reserve able . 
 
The Drinks are Pricey - $10 - $15 . Hey its SF and your going to pay Tourist Prices .  My Drink of Choice was the Bird of Paradise . I had few of these and was feeling good. 

Pagan Idol would be a good place to bring a Date. Its a Nice and Dark Intimate place.

If you ride Bart Pagan Idol is about a 5 Minute walk from the Montgomery Bart Station.

Servers are Dressed in Polynesian  Shirts .  

Pagan Idol is a Baller On A Budget Approved Establishment !!!
 .
author: Eugene L.

description: Honestly, I preferred this tiki bar over the world reknown, Smugglers Cove. Drinks are equally fantastic, however better bar atmosphere. I recommend coming when they first open (6pm) and wait for the pleasant surprise at 7pm when they ring that bell! (YOU'RE GONNA HAVE TO SHOW UP TO FIND OUT WHAT HAPPENS NEXT). I'm sure reading the rest of the reviews, you'll find out whats up! But Anywho, my drinks were fantastic, and I love the atmosphere as I felt like I was on the Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland. Definitely recommend checking this place out!
author: Sonia B.

description: Get the birds of paradise if you like tequila. For rum, get a $30 scorpion bowl to share with friends!
author: Kendall C.

description:
We love to tiki!

Great bar program. Great bar tending. Great ambiance. Great decor. 

Music??? I was expecting something that would add to the theme. That was a bit of a disappointment. But not a deal breaker! It's not a bro bar like Smuggler's. At least, not on the weeknight. 

This is a must visit bar if you're in the Bay Area!
author: Lea S.

description:
Battle of the Tiki's part deaux... and next in line is the oh so popular Pagan Idol! And how did it fair? It left a great lasting impression! 3.5 out of 5 stars to be exact, but bumping it up to 4 because of the wonderful atmosphere!

After attending a super fun UYE at Azucar lounge,
A group of friends and I decided to continue the party with some Tiki love. I had never heard of this place before, but when you hang with a bunch of experienced Yelpers, you tend to discover a lot of new places along the way. Initially, we stopped by Pagan Idol first, but us foodies had to fill our bellies with some grub before we continued the night. We decided to make a pit stop for pizza before we went to the bar. When we came back to Pagan Idol we were shocked to see the long line that formed in just a matter of 20 minutes. I myself am not the most patient, and I really don't like waiting in line at places that I've never been to before. However if people are willing to wait to get into a bar, the place has to be doing something right. 

We waited for a little while and finally made it into the bar. Was it worth the wait? Yes it was indeed! When you enter, you will be slapped right in the face with an abundance of Polynesian style decor! Tiki statues, a glowing fish tank, a volcano assimilation, sky high ceilings with ropes hanging from the top and a fun Cabana-like wooden structure encompass the room. At first glance, it appears that the bar is very small due to the narrowness of the room. But go ahead and trek it into the back room where there is ANOTHER bar and prepare to be impressed! This place is actually pretty spacious for a Tiki bar. 

We decided to stay near the front and we were able to snag a few tables as people were leaving. The nitpicks? Well... since this place is super busy, you will have to wait a while for your drinks, so be patient. You can definitely keep yourself entertained while watching the bartenders work their magic. Another nitpick... the blended drinks here aren't really blended. They load them up with ice and then fill your glass up afterward. I love my Tiki drinks blended to a smooth consistency and I was a little disappointed to see that they don't do this here. It could have just been the drinks they we ordered,  but while I was watching the bartender, I noticed that this became a theme with many of the drinks that she made. 

I will say that my Jungle Bird drink tasted wonderful! Super sweet and fruity and topped with a heaping mass of whipped cream just the way I like it! A few other drinks that our group got included: Bird of Paradise, The rum monkey scorpion bowl, and the Pineapple Express. Everyone seemed to really enjoy their drinks, so there was no fuss when it came to that. As far as price points go, you should look to spend between $12-$15 for a specialty drink or $25-$50 for a scorpion bowl. Yikes! A little pricey but it's a Tiki bar in the city, so it's to be expected. 

Perhaps what is the most appealing element of this bar are the chill vibes and comforting atmosphere that it emits. Everyone here seemed to really be having a good time and it definitely showed.  No judgements and no frills; just a good time with good drinks and great people. So, would I come back to Pagan Idol? Welp, the return date has already been set! Can't wait to come back!
author: Shayla B.

description: Our group made a reservation and it was great because we got one of the cabana tables in the back. I think I only had two drinks from here and they were pretty strong. Overall the place is fun and well decorated to keep up with the Tiki theme of the bar. I thought the bartenders were pretty nice. I just recommend to not order too many drinks too fast unless that's the kind of night you are looking for.
author: Julie L.

description:
Aloha!

Since I'm living in Sacramento for a while, I upon a discovery for this paradise Tiki bar located at Bush Street in San Francisco, CA! It's called, "Pagan Idol." This smooth-sailing theme bar brings the customers to experience the taste and refreshing flavors of incredible cocktails of the islands of Hawaii! The atmosphere is very calming and relaxing as I welcomed there. The concept is much similar to some local Tiki bars across the United States like the Jungle Bird in Sacramento. The interior designs are flawless and elegant giving it a submarine feel at the front side while at the Volcano side at the back side of the room is much roomier and edgier to space up 20+ people! Da kine!

The bartenders here are doing an excellent job for making the customers like me a remarkable and tremendous service! No cons at all!

Now onto the drinks! On 3/11/2017, me, Dennis T and Gabrielle A were ordering some drinks right from the menu. I picked House Daiquiri while Dennis picked the Jungle Bird and Gabrielle picked the Bird of Paradise. As a result, these cocktail drinks were phenomenal! The House Daiquiri was such a fine drink giving the best mixtures of rum, lime juice, sugar and a bought of happiness. Not bad. For the Jungle Bird and Bird of Paradise, they were also absolutely wonderful! Much flavorful and bolder to drink. A sigh of relief!

Parking at Pagan Idol can be a risk to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking nor the parking garage if it's available. Alternatively, you can also ride a bike, walk, car pool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, Pagan Idol is the coolest and the most unbelievable Tiki bar that I've ever visited in years thanks to Dennis T's recommendations idea. Perfect for friends, family and co-workers gathering all night long! A well received visit! Mahalo! My rating: 5 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
I know I've made fun of tiki bars and people drinking Mai Tai, but when someone ordered me one at Pagan Idol one evening...I was hooked! I've tried many Mai Tai before, but this one was definitely different and tasty.

1) Open as early as 4pm. 
2) Great space. Front room and back room. 
3) Cute decor, especially the fish tank.
4) Fun and hip ambiance.
5) Good people watching.
6) Fantastic concoction.
7) Awesome bartenders.

I am a fan of Pagan Idol. It's a great place to grab a casual drink with your friends or your date. 

I hope you give this tiki bar a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Came here after work and it was super cute! There wasn't a super long line or overly crowded inside which is a big thumbs up!  so most of the drinks on their menu are blended/tropical cocktails. My main concerns for cocktails at any bar is the alcohol content, as most of the time is hard to event taste the alcohols! Another thumbs up  oh yah I tasted and felt it afterwards. Speaking of tropics the bar is decorated as if it's a tropical tiki bar. There's some pretty cool special effects like smoke or thunder etc. overall very cute, would definitely come again
author: Nina Y.

description:
One of my friends had been talking about how much he wanted to go to Pagan Idol, so a group of us came over one evening. They take the tiki theme to the MAX from head to toe in this place, so just be prepared! It comes complete with the mystical rain à la Rainforest Café and fog like something out of Legends of the Hidden Temple. It's pretty dark in here, so I'd recommend ordering from the bar, where you can actually see what you're ordering. 

They have a variety of fun cocktails as well as a few bowls, which is a nice addition for groups. We shared a Jamaican Scorpion Bowl and a Rum Monkey. Both were good, although the Rum Monkey was sort of icy and super frothy, so we had a mound of froth when we had finished--but it makes sense because the drink contains an egg and cream!

Drinks range mostly around $12-20, which is par for the course. They do have a $10 margarita but umm who comes to a tiki bar to order a margarita?? 

Fun place that I'd be happy to come back to!
author: Willie R.

description:
Drinks are good*, and standard cocktail prices for San Francisco.  The decor is more "tiki" than that other SF place that masquerades as a tiki bar (cough *Smugglers Cove* cough). The real trick is figuring out when to be here when there are no FiDi d-bags taking over the joint - they're mean and surly, and that makes the bartenders mean and surly.

Sadly that means I frequent other Tiki bars in the Bay Area if it's not a Monday RIGHT after work when a convention is NOT in town... wait, I guess I don't frequent this place often, then...not with so many other legit Tiki options around.

Too bad, really.  Those drinks are good*.

*When they're mean and surly, they don't make good off-menu tiki drinks.  I've had the worst Painkiller I've ever had here surrounded by d-bags during DreamForce, but on a slow day I had to have a private moment with my Three Dots and a Dash, it was so good.
author: Iris N.

description:
REVIEWER # 237

My friends and I were really lucky on a Saturday night around 10PM. We arrived at Pagan Idol for our first time and we were second in line...10 minutes later....there was a line all the way in front of Starbucks! Yikes!

QUICK TIP: Arrive early to avoid the long lines! (SMILES)

Now...I have been hearing all about Pagan Idol and was happy when my friends chose this location to have some drinks. Once I got past the security who was checking ID's, I finally was able to walk in to the most talked about Tiki Bar in San Francisco! My first impression walking in was: "Dang, this place is small with a remarkable Hawaii type of look". The inside has a kitschy Polynesian theme to it! I really love it!

Although the inside looks small I was surprised to know that there was more room in the back of the first bar. There is a sitting area at the entrance, with the coolest little wooden tables. When looking closely you will notice that each table features a wood carving of an island group! There is also a very cozy bar with a couple stools so you can sit and watch the bartenders decorate the drinks! As you explore further in the back, there's a larger, busier bar in the next area. Tropical decor and idols and mood lighting abound. Past that large bar area, there's plenty more tables and sitting areas. (This place is surprisingly huge once you really walk around. 

Luckily, people were leaving while my group and I was walking in so we were able to grab some stools right in front of the bartenders. 

I have to admit that it was a joy watching the bartenders make the drink! They really take their time in making delicious and appealing tropical drinks! Every drink that they made looked good! The menu is easy to read and list the ingredients of the drink. 

2ND TIP: It's best to order your drinks all at once so you don't have to keep going up to the bar area. I was able to order all 3 of my drinks at one time! I suggest you order in advance. 

My top favorite drinks you ask? Well, I honestly don't think you can go wrong in ordering drinks when you are here. I am sure all of the drinks are delicious and come even come in cute glasses. I ordered the, "Bird of Paradise" and it was EVERYTHING! I would strongly encourage you to try this! 

Although the drinks were very tasty and surprisingly good even though you don't taste the alcohol (these drinks DO sneak up on you!) I warned you! This is a great night for tourist or people who have never been to a Tiki Bar! If you like tropical, island décor, and fruit and flowers in your drinks then this is the place for you! The night can be an expensive night if you are thinking about ordering more than 3 drinks. Each drink ranges from $10-15 per drink! Ouch! (My can walk out spending $100 easily on drinks)

The atmosphere is really chill! I guarantee you will have a great time. The location is perfect as well, steps away from Chinatown so once you are done drinking make sure to check out Chinatown for some good eats!
author: Porsche C.

description: The decor is really cool and there's a hidden bar at the back that opens an hour after it opens. If you enjoy a night under the stars, then you'll enjoy this gem. The tiki drinks are delicious and I highly recommend getting the Mai Tai. If your lucky, you'll see a hidden Mickey in the secret hidden bar!
author: Harry H.

description: My friend made a reservation one month in advance and we went there on Friday night around 10:30 pm. We went to the bar to get drinks firsr and a server came to the bar and took us to the seating area. Drinks were really potent but definitely worth the price. It wasn't too crowded so the ambiance was perfect for Friday. Highly recommend this place!
author: Anzy K.

description: This place is both nostalgic and hip. When you enter, the front bar looks as if you are inside of an old ship. It even has portholes on the walls that have a "view" of ocean life outside. So clever. At some point in the evening, when the front bar is busy, a bell is rung, and lo and behold! we have arrived on the island. The back bar is then open. There are tiki huts, and a star-lit sky. Really fantastic. The drinks also hold their own attention. Each cocktail is made with care and there is a wide menu to explore. Like most tiki bars, the drinks are not cheap. But it is an experience worth trying. This is a place that I enjoy meeting a friend for a drink, or bringing someone who is visiting.
author: Jason P.

description:
High kitch and pricey drinks ($15 For a mai tai) bit for a fun excursion to take visiting friends to it can't be beat. 

They don't open a minute or a second before opening. Plan for a long line on the weekends. It's a small space and they only let people in as others come out. 

Wait staff is friendly and the drinks are strong!

There is the requisite thunder shower sounds and the booming voice of the gods on a sporadic basis. 

Definitely a fun place to come.
author: Susanne R.

description: Omg this place is fantastic! I love the tropical drinks and the ambiance. Super relax! The bartender is very knowledgeable!  Awesome place so have a drink after work.
author: Glorimar A.

description:
First of all, I'm impressed by the prime real estate that Pagal Idol was able to secure in the middle of SF's Financial District. This tiki bar is WAY bigger than I thought from the outside. Upon getting carded by the bouncer, I walked into Pagal Idol and stood there to admire all the tiki décor, including the little aquarium in the front of the bar.

It was around 9:00 PM on a Friday night, and there was a surprisingly decent amount of seating available for me and my two friends. There's bench seating to the left of the entrance, a few seats at the bar, some narrower barstool seating... And a LOT more seating (and a second bar) in the next room over. There's space for slightly larger groups to sit or stand around. Their website also says that they take reservations, which is perfect for a post-work outing with colleagues or friends.

My friends and I did the typical tiki thing and started off with the Jamaican Scorpion Bowl. It had a little more ice than preferred, but it was a refreshing and super rummy drink. Then we eat got our own drinks... And I had the witch doctor. Oh boy. No lie, I scanned the menu for which cocktail would do its job the best and fastest. The witch doctor did the trick. My friends got the Banana Life and Pineapple Express, which were also tasty. I think I would have been happy with any drink on the menu. 

Pagan Idol is a great place to walk over after work and have a few drinks before having a real night on the town, which is what my friends and I did. The bartenders are a lot of fun, so don't be afraid to strike up a conversation with them. The drinks are kinda pricey, as is expected from a place like this, but it's the perfect way to treat yourself at the end of a long work month. Cheers!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Literally. Best. Tiki. Bar...

If you haven't heard of Future Bars, you need to get on that. They own a bunch of themed bars with super deliciously-made cocktails. Pagan Idol is one of them.

The decor is BEAUTIFUL! Walking in, there's a well-lit aquarium on your left. Then, the bar. As you keep walking, you'll find bathrooms on your left up a few steps. There's also a bar in the back of the venue. But the most interesting part is in the far back passed the bar - there are "stars" on the ceiling and tiki huts on your right for reservations. There's also a super pretty "volcano" area in the corner, which is where our party was. The "volcano" area has a bunch of pretty lights and a fish pond. There's also a smoke machine that makes everything all smokey around the "volcano". I would say it's probably the most well-lit area in the bar.

Anyway, when making reservations, definitely attempt Yelp Reservations first. We were a little late so there were no reservations available that day. So we called a few times - but apparently nobody answers their phones? So I emailed them. Got a call the following day about confirming reservations - lovely surprise! When we walked in, we let the people in the back bar know we had reservations. They cleared out the "volcano" area for us and set up a stool with a "private luau" sign on the deck.

There was PLENTY of space for us and the venue was GORGEOUS! I would definitely choose the "volcano" area over the tiki huts. The drinks were delicious, but the bowls were pretty small for the amount of people we had. When you get bowls of alcohol, you kinda mean for it to be shared with a bunch of people I think. But it also clearly states on the menu that it's meant for less than 6 people.

The service is wonderful as well! The man that led us to our reserved area served the bowls to us and gave us a little fire show. When one of us dropped a credit card at the end of the night, one of the ladies came around with a flashlight to help us look as well. Found it :) Thanks!
author: Athena C.

description:
Love this place Tiki bar! They have delicious drinks and also the environment is super fun! 

I came here for drinks around 8PM on a Saturday, it wasn't very packed yet so we were able to to find seating. Inside they have great decor and the ceiling have lights like stars! I ordered the Bird of Paradise! It was delicious and had the right amount of alcohol and sweetness. BEWARE it definitely creeps up on you just like soju. This place starts getting packed around 10PM and there were a lot of reservations. I recommend making reservations for big groups so you don't have to stand in the crowd!
author: Natalie L.

description:
Reasons to go to Pagan Idol:
 
1. Fun tiki/island theme. Interior looks like a ship with related décor everywhere. Tank has bright tropical fish. Come here if you're looking for something different from the usual bar.
2. Strong drinks. One is more than enough for a lightweight like me. Two will get even a big guy buzzed.
3. Bartenders are nice.
 
Other things to note:
 
1. Can get busy but not terribly crowded like the Tonga Room or Smuggler's Cove.
2. No food to soak up the alcohol.
3. Menu might seem small to those who like a lot of options.
author: Venna L.

description:
I love this place! As you step foot into the bar, you are automatically transported into a new world. They did a great job with the interior decor. It feels like I'm in a wooden ship out at sea on a mysterious voyage to find some treasure, and treasure I did find with these delicious tropical libations! I had the Rum Chi Chi, which had a perfect balance of fruitiness and alcohol. Some tiki lounges skimp out on the alcohol, but Pagan Idol's does it just right. 

I will be sure to come by again when I'm in the area! Great bar to relax at after a nice dinner.
author: Amanda T.

description:
This was my first experience in a tiki bar and, while I didn't stay for too long, it was great! We came here after a team dinner and somehow managed to find a booth that would accommodate the 9 of us on a Wednesday evening. I enjoyed the theme park feel, and the drinks were pretty solid (if overly calorific, but I guess that's unavoidable when drinking cocktails out of exotic containers with flowers in them).

Plus the bouncer was nice, which is always a nice bonus.
author: Sunil S.

description: I've been here twice. This tiki bar is awesome. They did a great job with the ambiance and decor. There's even a corner that's set up like a rainforest. Love it. You step inside and you feel like you're on vacation somewhere tropical. It's very spacious. The downside? Drinks. Lol. Seriously, the drinks are weak. I had one of the fancy tiki drinks and it was 3/4 ice. Looks really pretty, but did not taste like alcohol and way too much ice. Pretty much paid $16 for ice... Poor value, poor product, but cool space. Just go for the ambiance, and order just one drink.
author: Marie D.

description:
I'm a tiki bar enthusiast, so I was excited to check this place out during an overnight in the city (and having visited every tiki bar in the Bay Area thus far). 

They made a great off-the-menu Blue Hawaii and the bartender was cute and charming. Decor is fun and it's a big bar, so I'm sure it can get filled with bros and broettes on certain nights of the week.

We were there around 11:30 on a Saturday night for a night cap and I'm happy to say we had a great seat in the front and there was plenty of room to move about and relax. It is a nice treat to have this in the area!
author: Sarah S.

description: Best tiki bar I've been to in SF. Decor is absolutely beautiful. They still light their drinks on fire, and it doesn't take a long time to order. Wish there was more open seating, but will definitely be back to enjoy the fog released periodically in the back room, and the yummy beverages!
author: Evonne L.

description: Walked over from my hotel while visiting San Francisco.  Very cool interior, with lots to look at.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  Really cool looking and tasty drinks.  I felt a bit ancient and uncool compared to the other customers (I'm 41 ;-), but overall it was a great experience.  Would definitely recommend checking it out.
author: A W.

description:
Getting into this place feels like you're in a really classy but also dive-y submarine. Don't miss the pretty fishes next to the entrance. Head over to the end of the bar, this place is bigger than your regular Rickhouse style bar. 
I loved the vibe. The gin cocktail was special and still great! 
It's got little private-ish spaces at the back if you have a crew of 4-5 folks. Otherwise a fun bar to hang out at!
author: Soundarya C.

description: This place was a walking distance from my old office and my friends and I celebrated my last day here. The drinks are pretty damn strong. Atmosphere is awesome, especially in the back when the "storm" rolls in. It gets pretty packed so the earlier the better. Once again, the drinks are strong. I actually swore off of going to tiki lounges after my last visit because I couldn't handle it. Great for folks who wants to have fun with coworkers or friends but get ready to stand as there aren't a lot of seats when its packed (like almost every bar in the City). All in all, I'll visit again to celebrate with my former coworkers and once my liver can handle it again ahaha
author: A o S.

description: This place is AWESOME. Perfect for first dates, small work parties, and happy hours. The front of the bar opens at 4 pm and feels like you're on a ship. The back of the bar opens up at 5 and has fantastic decor. This tiki bar is TOP NOTCH. The drinks are very strong (and some have a limit of 2 per customer) they are mixed really well, and beautifully presented. The scorpion bowls are perfect for sharing. Highly recommend the Maybe Grog, Bird of Paradise, and Hinano (if you're feeling a beer over a cocktail).
author: Sarah N.

description: If you're looking for unique (sugary), cocktails w tiki inspiration & a fun/lively atmosphere bar then you'll love this place! Lots of open space in the middle- wish they had more high top tables to socialize and place your drinks.
author: Rob M.

description: Pagan Idol is definitely one of my favorite tiki bars in the city. Drinks are delicious and strong. Bartenders are cool and chill. I always have a good time here. The ambiance is phenomenal! Love the dramatic effect and the steam blower! My recommendation is play some hip hop/modern party music. I understand that's not the vibe they're going for but I think it would definitely attract more fun and people.
author: Cecile ..

description:
Great drinks! 
Unfortunately, I got tricked and paid for the drink AND the cup (witch doctor). By the time I paid and asked the Bar tender why I got charged 20$ for a drink, he couldn't refund me- but he did offer me a drink to compensate. 
Cute "tiki/ island" decor, loved the chill vibe of the place. Will definitely stop by again if I'm feeling for fruity drinks and craving that island life!
author: Maria C.

description: I love it. When they reach capacity, they open up the back room, which is really cool. It wasn't too crowded when I went, so we got a great table and stayed for a couple hours.
author: Hayley H.

description:
The coolest Tiki bar ever. I love how much effort was put into the interior decor of this bar. You can really tell that the owner really cared for detail to ensure customers have a true tiki experience. 

The drinks are a bit pricey but definitely worth the experience. Only thing I didnt like was that they give paper straws for drinks instead of plastic ones, which was a bit annoying because they constantly got soggy and I would have to go to the bar to get a new straw.

There is a lot of seating but it gets packed pretty fast, and then it gets hard to find a place to sit. Luckily I came a little early and beat the crowd, but I can imagine it being difficult to find seating.

It is quite loud inside, with lots of random noises they have playing. Probably not the best spot to sit and catch up, but definitely a fun place to hit up for a fun night. 

There really is no parking nearby, maybe if youre lucky you might be able to snag a spot somewhere. But I would recommend ubering/lyfting to this spot. 

I loved my experience here! Highly recommend for a good, fun night!
author: Joan Y.

description:
I'd walked by this place a billion times since it's close to work but never got a chance to stop in. Stopped by on a random Monday night around 11pm and basically had the place to myself. 

It's a bit reminiscent of Tiki Room at Disneyland, with all the tropical touches they got in there.  Cute little circular lights that look like portholes, with tropical fish swimming by. Bartenders in Hawaiian shirts and dark wood paneling reminiscent of a ship interior. Pretty stained glass window with a peacock that was backlit right next to the bar. Attention to detail can even be found in the lights imitating glowing embers under the stairs leading to the back room. 

The back room had twinkly lights and really transported you to a world away from the hustle and bustle of SF city streets. Ample and varied seating. Great date spot on a weekday, adventurous, fairly dark, and music within a reasonable volume for speaking.

Being a non-drinker, I got a mocktail-- not sure what it was, but it did aite, fruity and not too sweet. Drinks are kind of pricy, but I guess that's what you get for the ambiance.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Great bar for happy hour for those working in/visiting the FiDi. The decorations are fantastic and the smoke/noise maker thing is hilarious! I enjoyed the fact that the bar wasn't overly packed on a Friday night when my group was there although perhaps all the Yelp hype might change that soon...

All I can say is that this is a fun place. If you are planning to come here for "a drink", chances are you'll stick around for more.
author: Nina M.

description:
What a fun place!

This used to be my work happy hour spot when I worked on Kearny. Huge fan of all their drinks. If you are new here walk in and go straight to the back (up the stairs) and enjoy! Tiki bar with stars on the ceiling. They put so much effort into this vibe and they are doing it right!

Try many off the menu. Bars like this in NYC use to have a weird policy where they had to pay for the cool tiki mugs but not here! 

The music can get quite loud so make sure you are not going here just for convo.
author: Amanda M.

description: This tiki bar transports you to the islands and is perfect for a group or friends meeting together for cocktails. I enjoyed my tiki version of a Long Island and the dramatic atmosphere. It's def a place worth stopping in with friends to enjoy a tiki cocktail or two.
author: A M.

description:
Ultimate tiki bar! Pagan Idol embraces their tiki bar theme with oceanic lighting, totem poles and spewing smoke  machine every 15 minutes to illustrate a "sign from the gods."
