It offers punch bowls (and even bowls with fire in the center) to share. Each drink has follows the tropical theme with fresh flowers in them. Drinks turned out unique and tasty. I struggled with what to order because the menu has little to no drink description, causing me to ask the bartender lots of questions. However, bartenders are very nice and didn't mind my questions. Despite the extreme tiki theme, Pagan Idol had mellow, elevator-like music that was a big mood damper. Definitely a place to sit back and chill with friends
author: Tori Y.

description:
Came here for happy hour with several coworkers on a Friday right when it opened. For the first hour it's open, it is totally packed and very small. Then a bell rings, kinda like at Trader Joes (!), and you discover the vast bar that is Pagan Idol.

Their cocktails are expensive but great, so come here for a good buzz after work but not a full evening!
author: Kerry G.

description: They would not honor our reservation.  Said it was open seating. Drinks were good. No service had to go stand in line at the bar. Not sure why we had a reservation, yet they keep sending reminders that we had one.
author: A P.

description:
I love the vibe here. 

Week nights - not crowded at all. Fridays gets packed. We ended up getting something crazy that was lit on fire and shared by 4 people with the longest straws I've ever seen. You know what drink I'm talking about? 

Loved the tropical, nautical, tiki bar decor and ambiance. As you walk in the first room looks like a ship's cabin complete with windows looking out into the blue sea. The second room is the tiki bar room complete with twinkling lights to remind you of the night sky and aquariums behind the bar. What more can you ask for?

Surprisingly clean, super cute, and a welcome get-a-way from the hustle and bustle of city life. I felt like I had been whisked away to a tropical island and at one point, as I was staring at the waterfall, it almost made me feel like a kid at Disneyland (Pirates of the Caribbean anyone?)

Highlights:
A couple of private booths (tiki huts) for groups
Dark corners for you know what ;)
Fire drinks
Pretty drinks with pretty flowers
Souvenir drinks 
Bartenders in Hawaiian shirts
Chill Bouncers
Fun times

Restrooms can get pretty gross since they are co-ed and guys just piss everywhere.
author: Song C.

description:
I'm not sure if it was a smart or dumb move on my behalf, to make Pagan Idol the 3rd tiki bar I went to in a single evening.  The drinks were potent and strong, and I wanted to try more on the menu, but I already had 3 drinks in me by then, and I'm not a fan of hangovers.

My drink that night was a Rum Old Fashioned.  If you've never tried an Old Fashioned made with rum, you're missing out.  It's so good to sip on.  While I wanted to do a more proper tiki drink, I just couldn't handle anymore juice in my system.

The decor inside of Pagan Idol was amazing.  I felt like I had escaped to some sort of tiki-adventure-fantasy world with a bit of Disney magic thrown in.  I liked that on occasion, a random fog machine would go off.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Super close to my workplace. My coworkers and i love going to this place for some drinks after work. It's a tiki bar- it's fun and dimly lit. The drinks are a bit on the pricey side but but their drinks are yummy and their punch bowls are yummy too.

it definitely gets crowded so just be prepared for that and can take a little while to get drinks, but the bartenders are super friendly.

i wouldn't try to park anywhere near it, it being FiDi. Cool vibe and fun place. I highly recommend this bar!
author: Bori B.

description: Soo cheesey like something out of a '90s movie about a family holiday in the tropics. But they have giant scorpion bowls and giant straws in which to share ridiculously sweet mixed drinks. They put on shows with fire and other tricks, so the novelty and showmanship make up for the oversweet drinks. I'm more of a beer, whiskey, and wine drinker so I'm just not the perfect fit for this place, but for big rager nights this is the place to be. Definitely forget you're in the city when coming here!
author: Julie N.

description:
A group of us came here early'ish on a Saturday evening and this place screamed Tiki Bar from front to back when I walked in. The ambiance is highlighted by all kinds of decorations that make you feel like you've been transported to an island that happens to have multiple bars. I mean the props they have placed around the rooms, and the lighting are really cool. You could walk around for an hour and just stare at everything. 

My only drink of the evening was the Ma Tai Float, which I would recommend for first timers here. It was a strong drink that had plenty of juice and looks like a true Tiki drink. The drinks here seem a bit on the pricey side but hey this is downtown SF. 

The bartenders during this evening all were friendly and chill. They take reservations for tables and larger groups, so I'm sure this place is good for after work drinks. All in all, Pagan Idol is a chill, cool looking place for drinks and to hang out.
author: Angela L.

description:
We kicked off Kevin B's birthday celebration recently with a happy hour at this hot spot... 

Thanks to the crew that arrived early to hold a spot, we had a place for our group to congregate... without that, we would have been standing awkwardly around -- if we were even able to get in!  

I don't hang at Tiki Bars often, but Pagan Idol definitely delivered on the awesome Polynesian atmosphere, variety of colorful and handcrafted cocktails, and overall vibe.

I perused the menu for awhile before deciding to go for the Pineapple Express, which I was super happy with.  It went down easy for sure, but one was enough for my lightweight self!  

I encourage you to watch the bartenders make your drinks -- you can see the attention to detail and special ingredients that go into each one! It's entertaining too - they definitely put love into each one... and you kind of have to since there isn't table service (at least there didn't appear to be when we were there).

This is definitely a fun place to mix-up your happy hour venue or celebrate on a fun occasion.  I'll be  back!
author: Gabi M.

description:
MAHALO!  

In my neck of the woods growing up, there was Trad'r Sam (still is) - hella divey, hella strong, hella cheap!  I'm not a huge fan of Tonga Room, so I'm happy there's Pagan Idol.  How come there weren't any cool funky places like this when I worked in the FiDi?  We had to wear suits, skirts, heels, strict grooming standards.  Now, people go to work wearing see-through yoga pants - casual much?  

If I worked nearby these days, I'd hop on over in my sweats and shake my tail feather to the background music with a "Witch Doctor" in hand, woot-woot!  My friend and I came here on a Wednesday night, sat at the bar and watched the bartenders (Dan & Johnny) in action.  They're extremely friendly and attentive; every drink is made with love.  We totally dig the vibe, not as cheesy as Tonga Room if ya feel me.  

It wasn't too crowded due to the beginning of Fleet Week in SF.  There were sailors looking lost in our fair city.  I directed them towards Broadway, as they were looking for titty bars and not tiki bars LOL!  I also thanked them for their service in protecting our beautiful country of course.

Onto the drinks, the "Bird of Paradise" had too much ice in it, but "Dawn Patrol" was on point!  My friend's second drink was "Flex on the Beach" - reminded us of a slushy "Hurricane" in New Orleans, except in NOLA, you can walk on the streets with it.  Patrons can purchase souvenir mugs & glasses, prices are listed on the menu, if not...simply ask.  Walk towards the back and checkout the rear bar.  Overall, the owners of Bourbon & Branch/Rickhouse/Local Edition did it again with their new venture.  This place is FUN and mesmerizing, congratulations!

'Til we meet again ~ cheers!!!
author: Christine R.

description:
I love any place with a theme and this place is no exception. They really deck out this place to make it like you're in a tropical paradise tiki bar. The back room is dim and even has stars lit up on the ceiling. I got the mai tai and not only was it pretty and tasty, but it was really strong. I haven't had one in forever and it hit me within half a drink. I was sadly not able to handle another one.

Overall, it's a super cute tiki themed bar with good but strong drinks.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
This place was great! Drinks are solid and the ambiance takes you out of the city. 

Had a reservation and was seated right away. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly. Prices were reasonable and drinks were tasty. Definitely going to be recommending friends visiting SF.
author: Robin H.

description: A gem  of a place bordering between the financial and union square. Drinks  are about on par  with other tiki bars and very tasty severed by super cool  staff. Very much of a younger crowd - most very nicely dressed.    My gal pal I was with met a nice young man instantly and spend the whole night chatting with him.  Good times for all!
author: Robert C.

description:
This has to be my favorite tiki bar in SF right now!  After being disappointed by Smuggler's Cove, I was glad to have found this place!  Pagan Idol has a lot more space, multiple bars, and great drinks!  While they have a back area, I've mostly hung out in the front, but that's because seating seems easier to find here.  The back does have reservable group party areas so definitely something to take a look into.  As for the atmosphere, it is a really cool tiki bar.  Relatively high ceilings and fairly spacious (by SF standards).  So it doesn't feel like I'm stuffed like a sardine.  The bar area gets busy, but it's not too hard to get a drink.  

My favorite drink here has to be the Bird of Paradise.  It is on the sour side though so just a forewarning.  But I love the passion fruit whip they put on top, it's super addictive!  I've had a few of their other drinks as well, they're pretty amazing.  

Overall, this is one of my favorite bars in SF, not just among tiki bars.  It's a really fun environment and the drinks are fantastic.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Bryson L.

description:
Tikis and Volcanos!

No, we weren't in a tropical or enchanted place last night but we were in one of San Francisco's hottest tiki bars. It is fairly new. They've only been around for a little over a year. Night life was well and alive in this popular Polynesian / Bohemian-style tiki bar located in the Financial District. 

Had a fun time with a group of friends last night at Pagan Idol as some 18 of us gathered here for some great cocktail drinks and conversations. Shared a Bird of Paradise ($13) with the hubby... so good! It had a richer, sweeter margarita taste with passion-fruit-infused whipped cream and sprinkled with irresistibly tangy li hing mui (Hawaiian dried plum powder). I enjoyed that fruity taste (and I miss Li Hing Mui from Hawaii).

We originally had reservations at the elevated Volcano Room which erupts periodically, filling the room with smoke and even sound effects. So cool! We hung out there until we completely filled the space which occupied about 12 or so people. With that many people it eventually got hot as if we were really near a volcano LoL! We then moved to a larger space just below as our group got big.

This tiki bar is very interesting once you enter the door. It is dimly lit inside but I had a chance to do a quick visual of the place. It had amazing decor! Loved it! Immediately to your left is a fish tank and behind that is seating space. Then the bar... it looks like a ship's saloon in a sunken wooden ship. On the right there are portholes lining the wall and featured looping videos of fish and sharks swimming by. Nice "under the sea" effect. The bartenders were decked out in Hawaiian shirts and floral leis and ready to serve you their concoction cocktails that comes adorned with an orchid.

There is another bar inside the tiki room which they called the Captain's Quarters and is sectioned off from the rest of the establishment by a locked door (yes, we had to wait outside till it was ready). There is even a whimsy sign on the door (see my photo). Once we are allowed to wander inside you will find it hard not to notice a giant hand-carved tiki statue (could be the Hawaiian god, Lono. I lived in Hawaii for 3 years and learned a history of this stuff there). There are little seating sections where small to big groups can enjoy the spirit of the island - private grass huts, wicker stools and look up! the fiber-optic ceiling actually twinkles like the night sky. So cool! What a fun place for friends to enjoy our fruity drinks in ridiculously fun glassware (or pineapple). Music makes for a fun atmosphere! Oh, one more thing, don't look for food here... they don't serve appetizers or any food but the good news is Chinatown is close by for some authentic Chinese food. Also, over 21 only strictly enforced! They check ID's! Parking is horrible... good luck!

Review #0696
author: May A.

description:
Too crowded and there was one time that I had to wait in a long line to get in right after working hours.  I dislike waiting for a bar place just to get drinks.  I didn't attempt to wait to get in for that one visit.  The second time to check this place out, it took an hour to wait yet again, in line, not to get in, but to get drinks.  It was about a whole hour in line to order and then have them make the drinks.  Sober talk while being thirsty. 

On another note, it isn't just another bar, but a tiki spot with themed paradise drinks to delve into.  The decor is a good getaway, I'm not going to lie, from the working environment.  I like what this place is and it's conveniently located in FiDi.  I just wished that this place is bigger. 

Birds of paradise was ordered because I like the name.  They have the tiki bowls that is great for sharing.  Come early is the key here to beat the crowd.  It's on the loud side to hold a conversation continuously.  Fun tiki down time to escape the feel of FiDi.  

Waiting is not my forte, however.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Almost every half hour, the Pagan Idol volcano erupts and the inner child in me goes SHARK BAIT OOH HA HA. SHARK BAIT OOH HAHA. SHARK BAIT OOH HA HA. 

Almost every Thursday, I worship the pagan idol... Sure there are a lot of tiki bars in SF now, but the pagan idol is an up and coming one! With a very expansive tiki menu and festive decorations, Pagan Idol always offers a good time. In terms of drinks, I love the witch doctor and the amount of rum they put in it! Their bowls are more affordable than other tiki places, but they aren't as strong as most. The drinks are more on the tropical side than fuq you up side. Definitely a great place to pre game but suggest coming here early or after 9 if you want to sit somewhere!

AND YES THERE IS A POKE STOP NEARBY
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for atmosphere, themed decor, and size of the space, plus creativity. It's s popular spot for the happy hour crowd and conveniently located in FiDi

Of course the drinks are expensive but they are artfully curated and delightfully over the top. However, you have to be patient, because EVERY drink they serve is gently assembled with hand crafted finesse so it takes a good 5 minutes to construct a simple whiskey/ginger (the orchid and striped straw gently placed just so.)

The back room opens at 5pm, so if you arrive 5 minutes before, you may have to wait in line outside if the front room is at the 20 head capacity. Although it is a large space with several nooks to crawl into, the empty space in the middle can feel like a high school dance floor with all the kids posted against the walls.

This is definitely a place to go for a lighthearted good time, or a good conversation starter for a first date.
author: jessica c.

description: Love this place. Great drinks and great bartenders! So glad my workplace is right around the corner. :)
author: Katherine G.

description:
First time ever going to a tiki bar and let me tell you guys it will not be my last time...
 Great experience, great drinks, great atmosphere... great vibes. If your looking for a cool bar with cool drinks I recommend pagan idol.
author: Christopher L.

description:
SF has finally nailed the perfect tiki bar in the heart of downtown. 

There are two main bars to accommodate everyone and fun spots to enjoy your creative, tropical drinks. We sat near the large tiki statue in the back and there were huts, water features, and lots of pirate ship themed decor. I really liked the star-like lights on the ceiling, which made you feel like you were outside on an open ship deck.

The illustrated menus were helpful and the drinks were not only cute but strong, too! They take some time to prepare each drink, but it's worth the wait.

You can reserve a table, which I'd recommend if you're coming with a large group, but I came with three friends on a Wednesday night around 7pm and there wasn't an issue with seating at all. Can't wait to go back!
author: Shira W.

description: This place is super cool! I had been to smuggler's cove before which is super cool but this place is more spacious and has crazy decorations! Drinks are definitely pricey but tasty and fun! Great place to come for some cocktails after work.
author: Katlyn H.

description:
By the time my group of friends and I arrived here last night for St. Patty's Day...I was pretty slothed. 

So from what I can remember, this lounge is definitely a sight to see. Meaning the decor is really cool and interesting and really give off the vibe that you are in some tropical escape. The multicolor lighting and cave-like structure really makes the environment a happening place. My friends and I truly enjoyed the space. Don't expect to come here to hold a conversation with someone because it gets really noisy. 

There are stools that line the entrance wall, but if you head towards the back, there are lounge tables. 

Overall, cool spot for after work drinks.
author: Lene N.

description:
Such a cute place!  The whole place is decorated well, from the little cabana booths in the back to the fairy light "stars" on the ceiling. The music is what you would expect at a tiki bar as well. There are a plethora of tropical tiki-themed drinks to choose from.  The presentation of the drinks are also on point and fun to take photos with. The drinks are a bit expensive but also pretty strong, so I'd say you're getting a decent bang for your buck. 
We had the Bird of Paradise and the Banana cocktails. Both were very accurately reproduced from the drawings on the menu. Everything was yummy, fun, and got the tropical mood going. You honestly can't go wrong with any drink on the menu. 
Overall, I'd definitely visit again. It's a great escape from dreary SF weather.
author: Amy X.

description:
It's statistically impossible for a city, any city, to have too many tiki bars.

San Francisco has a new one and it's a goodie.  

Be ready to flash your i.d. as this place is all business at the front, party inside.  A doorman cockblocks the entry, checking to make certain all patrons are 21 and over and if he really needed my i.d. to prove such a thing then he's probably already lost his vision.   

I made it inside.  What an inside.  

The space isn't huge but it's quite enchanting.  The front room brings a smile to your face with its highly stylized fishy decor.  Keep going and you'll find more unique places - is that a lava wall? - including private little tiki huts which can be reserved in advance for your 4 - 8 person party.  Got a party bigger than that?  You can actually reserve the whole place.  

I wish I knew someone who would reserve the whole place.  I'd love that party.  

Pagan Idol's menu is about perfect and I sampled widely.  It's intriguing, with each drink looking more unique than the last.  I ordered at the bar and chatted up the bartender, learning that he'd spent many years working at Trader Vic's.  The pedigree shows.  Rum based drinks with flavors like passion fruit are potent and well prepared and dare I say it, reasonably priced.  At least by 2016 standards.  Have more than one of these and I suggest you Uber your way home.  

At regular intervals there's a startling clap of thunder followed by what must be theatrical smoke enveloping certain areas of the bar.  It's an experience.

The very rear of Pagan Idol is where I found room and, unfortunately, I understand why.  Though it features a decent view into other parts and you're there amidst tiki decor, the lighting in this part of the bar is a bit off and this space feels a bit like an afterthought.  I'd actually suggest it would be the perfect spot for a 3-person uke band but I'm not in charge.  

Even if you wind up in the worst seat in the house you're gonna have fun here.  It's a tiki bar.  Fun is mandatory.  

Cool place.
author: Tracey A.

description:
I'm a sucker for tiki bar. A getaway without really getting away. Friday after 5pm can get busy, but scout out and you may be lucky to get a spot. I enjoy the back corner area, where it's less busy and less stuffy.

Had the same bartender both times I came here and she is always the sweetest. I like the bird of paradise, with tequila, passionfruit infused whip cream and li hing powder, yum. 

Hope to come back on a night where it's less crowded. I love the space and fixtures and would like to enjoy that more.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Shocking in San Francisco of all places to feel sexual assault. When a man hits on your friend and won't leave her alone after repeatedly asking him, you step in ask him over and over to walk away because everyone at this point is uncomfortable. And have to straight up yell in his face WALK AWAY and then ... The bouncer had no choice but to follow the orders of a "barback" to give him "another chance" its a fucking sickening joke!!

Two bartenders admitted to me they had multiple complaints within the hour of a ~creepy guy~ and yet they let him stay there and drink more? You lost 4 of us customers for life.

Total disgust in this place.
author: Molli W.

description: We showed up right at opening and thought, OK this is a cute but cozy bar.  Loved the nautical/tiki theme and had a great suggestion from the bartender (Daywalker).  Then about 45 mins later, the bartender rings a bell and opens a back door onto an even larger and more tiki themed bar area.  We loved it back there too.  This was definitely a highlight of our time in San Francisco.
author: Marie M.

description:
Love their drink selections. I recommend the rum monkey   
Great ambiance and the area is bigger than i expected. Plenty of space inside
author: Alessa L.

description:
Well, I am torn. 

First, the drinks are certainly tasty and chalk full of all kinds of booze. 

Now, my issue. Apparently, taking video of another table getting their special flaming drink made in front of them is a BIG NO NO. The waiter who was conducting the spectacle stopped his act and stared at me until I put my phone down. Instead of playing it off like a pro, and finishing his act, then coming to talk to me and ask me not to, he decided to make a scene, disrupt the show those people had paid for, and make me look like a dick for holding them up. 

Well, I don't appreciate being treated like an insolent child by some two bit server who has an inflated opinion of his showmanship. Next time, play it off, and come ask my, politely and discreetly, not to film, if filming is really such a huge issue. 

So, as such, my warning to the the general public is to avoid filming any part of the bar/drinks at all costs. This place is your typical hipster SF bar and the servers certainly echo that sentiment. Better yet, take your business to any one of the other cool bars with great drinks around the city.
author: Zach V.

description:
Tiki bars were very popular in the 80's and are still when visiting certain tropical islands.  For SF, the Tonga Room at the Fairmont Hotel is the tiki bar with the most famous past, but the long gone Trader Vic's is another. 

Pagan Idol is the newest addition to the tiki bar list and introduces a newer generation to the fun and, yes, kitschiness, that defines tiki bars. 

With a fun cocktail list with silly addictions like voodoo spells and Mai tai floats combined with the legitimate drink skills of the people behind Bourbon and Branch, Pagan Idol is a good time. 

Drinks are strong and refreshing and it makes a quick stop to meet friends and catch up, especially after the "ship" lands and the bigger back area is open for guests to mingle and hangout.  Our order:

Witch Doctor - $13. A tall statue idol glass filled deliciousness and a side of voodoo. 

Mai Tai Float - $13. Refreshing and fruity. A hit. 

Pagan Idol accepts credit cards including Amex.
author: Randy F.

description: My husband and I love the tropical drinks and we've been going to the same tiki bars all the time. We wanted to try another place so found out about this place. The place was pretty big compared to other tiki bars and the ambience was good. It wasn't too crowded when we reached but later on it did get busy. There were not many options for drinks. I usually like the piña colada and was surprised to find out that they did not make it there, however the bartender was kind enough to make it for me. I also tried their signature drink, believe me it was too strong and concentrated that I just couldn't finish it. My husband tried the mai tai which was too strong. Overall we had a good time but wish they had more drinks to choose from in the menu.
author: Sreelakshmi S.

description:
The most fun, unique bar in FiDi?  Yes!  I have a soft spot for tiki bars and Pagan Idol is one of the coolest tiki bars I've been to in a while....and did I mention they also make a mean Mai Tai?  Most drinks are on the sugary side of the cocktail spectrum, so watch out for hang overs the next morning, but this is such a great spot to meet-up with friends / co-workers.  

The only downside to Pagan Idol is there are limited seating options, and those locations tend to fill-up fast.  Also, Thursday and Friday afternoons during happy hour, the line to get in is often long and incredibly slow moving.  Once inside the space is dimly lit and a little loud, which is both good and bad (similar to the sister bar Rickhouse around the corner).  

Overall, this is a great bar, that, though not perfect for all situations, is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Tom G.

description: Excellent drinks and easy to find location.  Can't wait to return as the back room hadn't opened yet (6pm).
author: David R.

description:
Tiki bars are making a comeback! This is a fine addition to the city, with much more updated decor (unless good ol' Smuggler's Cove), and fancy gadgety things like a beautiful starry ceiling and fog machine for those tropical rainstorms. 

They have a good list of cocktails and most are pretty boozy, and they come pretty too. If you're looking for other sort of booze (like beer), you might want to go elsewhere though.

This is a great place for an after party, a bachelorette, or just general hang out. Just make sure you get a designated driver ;)
author: Alice C.

description: Such an awesome experience! When my boyfriend and I first got there, the bouncer opened the door for us and let us into this cute little world! Cool decor, there were fish tanks, skulls, tiki huts, fire, fish hanging from the ceiling, the atmosphere was spot on! Such a different vibe from smugglers cove and tradr sams. (No shame to them.) Drinks were strong but sooooo good, which made it kinda dangerous lol! They limited 2 per person on the drink my boyfriend had, and I could see why!!! It sure did the job and tasted great too! And I loved the presentation! My drink had flowers on top of it. Definitely coming back!
author: Genesis E.

description:
I love coming to this place after work! Such a nice refuge from your daily stressful life! 
It's a tikki bar, so the ambiance is very beachy, soft, loungy and cosy. 
The decor inside is outstanding. 
The bar tender super nice and friendly, would make a virgin drink if you ask with the flavors you like. 
I'll go back (again) for sure!
author: Rachida I.

description:
Tiki bars are one of my favorite things in the world. I'm always in search of a good tiki bar anywhere I go, From Three Dots and a Dash, Forbidden Island, Smuggler's Cove, to even the ones in Hawaii, I think I may have grown myself into somewhat of a tiki bar expert! When I saw Pagan Idol popping up, I knew I have to pay it a visit!

We pay here a visit on a Thursday night around 10pm and this place was already poppin! The hut booths in the backroom with the starry light sky are pretty cool, but it was already crowded when we got there. I think most of these are for reservations only btw. We sat in the middle section at the bar and we got the Witch Doctor and Hemingway is Dead. I was really excited about the ceramic tiki drinks mug that they have here! Unfortunately, only our Witch Doctor came in a nice fancy mug, while the HiD was just in a glass, where is my skull mug? sad face. 

The drinks are tasty and strong, just the way I like my drinks. While we were enjoying ourselves at the bar, the bartender invited us to take a shot with them (on the house!!). It was super nice of them! The shots also came in these small little tiki shot glasses which were just super cute. If I come back next time with a larger group, I really want to try their scorpion bowls! It's a great tiki bar, but I think Three Dots and a Dash in Chicago is still my most #1 favorite tiki bar of all.

It's great to see this new addition in the FiDi. More options for happy hours after work yay! The spooky pirate theme of a tiki bar is so much fun. $12 per drink is a great deal for FiDi price! Woohoo.
author: Hoyan L.

description: Tiki bar in busy DT SF--not too shabby for after work! Get the flex on the beach, it's my go-to. All the drinks are fancy looking but it can be a hit or miss with some (my friends ordered a couple that weren't super good). You gotta like rum though! I wish they made some other cocktails with other liquors. Pricey drinks with no HH specials but once in awhile it's a good stop by! SUPER dark inside, be careful when you first go in! TONS of space in the back of the bar with cool little hits but they get snagged fast after work so get there early and mark you post!!!
author: Nerissa C.

description: I would recommend this place for anyone with dry skin because the back room here can't have dipped below 90% humidity in the last decade.
author: Jon F.

description:
LOOOOOOVE this place. Hidden in FiDi you step into another world when you walk in. Full of tiki-bar-ness and drinks in bowls full of awesome yummi-ness. 

As busy as it always is, I can always usually find a seat somewhere. The front portion opens up earlier to get the party started then rush to the back at 7p when that opens to get more seats. You can also make a reso online if you have a large group to ensure you get a seat/booth in the back. 

I can't pin point what my favorite drink would be since they are all amazing. But, what I can say is that the passionfruit they sprinkle/shave onto the top of the whipped cream drink is what keeps me coming back.
author: Leina K.

description:
Great place to grab some tasty and interesting drinks. It's a tiki bar, with themed decorations everywhere, including assorted statues, a fish tank, and even a volcano that periodically "erupts", all making for a fun drinking experience.

There's an expansive selection of rum-based drinks and cocktails, all of which are fairly elaborate. Some even come with souvenir mugs (you can trade it in for a clean one to take home after you finish your drink), and there's also a few bowls for sharing. Most drinks are on the sweeter/fruitier side. Bartenders are all friendly and it's also pretty interesting to watch your drinks being made, especially the more creative ones. 

The interior can initially seem small, but there's a back room which opens up into a more expansive seating area, with booths that can be reserved.
author: Oliver L.

description: Wonderful spot, offers a great balance for groups and tiki-heads alike. Beautiful spaces, wonderful drinks, and polished staff. Only critique would be their approach to not name the ingredients of drinks; This proved challenging to many who have allergies, or certain taste preferences.
author: Christopher B.

description:
4.5 Stars

Refreshing change of pace in the SF bar scene
Front area is cozy but once you head towards the back the overall space is deceptively bigger 
Love the beach luau vibe and the night star effect in the back
Witch doctor was a well-made cocktail that I would gladly order again 
Most of the drinks made had great finishing touches which showed a high level of care to detail

Overall Thoughts

Can't wait to be back to try their other drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
Found another great happy hour spot by work and I love the ambiance. 

It's a really relaxing and chill spot.  Note: this place gets really pack on Fridays.  

I came here twice and the first time was on a Wednesday and it was perfect, lots of seating spots.  Friday, man it gets super packed and there's a line to get in.  

their drinks are strong: PERFECT!!! I got the fish bowl for everyone to share.  $50 for the one with frame and $24 monkey fish bowl which is smaller and it was perfect for 6 people.  all of us were pretty buzzed after the drinks.  that showed how strong their drinks were.  

It can get a little warm inside, so stay hydrate.  Love how they have a self serve water station, its perfect since the bar is too busy to serve water for everyone.  

This place is really huge and roomy inside.  Don't let the outside fool you. Its really huge inside.
author: Candice Y.

description:
It's definitely refreshing to see a Tiki Bar in the SF FiDi area. Why? Because Tiki Bars always makes me think that I'm in a far away place, away from work. And the people in Tiki Bars always seem to be in vacation, happy mode. 

I wasn't at Pagan Idol long enough to see the whole bar but from what I've seen, it definitely has that vacation feel. The bartenders and even the bouncer is sporting a Hawaiian shirt! 

I love it when bars put purse hangers near the seats. It's makes it so much more convenient for us ladies or lads with bags to socialize without worrying where to place our bags. 

Their menu consists of lots of rum based tiki drinks and those cool looking fire tiki bowls. 

I got the banana life drink and it tastes really good, pretty strong, does not taste like bananas, but so much ice and so expensive! The drink costs $12 and that's definitely waaaay more than what I'm used to paying for a tiki drink. But then again, it is the SF FiDi... 

The sad part of this bar is, no happy hour menu?!? WTF?!?!

Would I come here again? Without a HH menu, it'll definitely make it hard for me to want to come back here again....but I love the tiki bar idea in Fidi!
author: Alice X.

description:
I'm not sure who's idea it was to come here, but we were in the neighborhood and decided to drop by Pagan Idol. It was a stormy Saturday (March 5th) around 10:30pm.

The place was packed. We decided to do a walk through to get a feel for the layout of the bar. There's a main bar up front and another one in the back room. The back room didn't feel as crowded, but it was super stuffy, so we decided to find a space by the front bar. We ended up finding two stools along the wall, so we snagged those seats. Getting a drink proved to be a little bit of a challenge. It took a while to get the attention of the bartender to place an order. But once we did, it took no time at all. (I think everything was maybe pre-mixed?)

*Bird of paradise: cachaca, reposado tequila, lemon, vanilla, passionfruit whip, li hing mui, sea salt ($12)
*Mai tai float: rhum martinique, jamaican rum, ron de venezuela, orange liqueur, lime, orgeat, house float, aloha ($12)

I'm honestly not a huge fan of tiki drinks as I more or less like my drinks straight up. These were a little too sweet for me. Out of the two, I preferred the Bird of paradise over the Mai tai. It was easier to drink and had a little tartness to it. That cut into the sweetness. I'm not big on rum, so I just had a sip of the mai tai.

The decor here is awesome. They have fake windows with screens behind them displaying water and swimming fish. Kinda like peering through an underwater porthole? It definitely feels like you're inside a ship with all the wood decor. And the lamps were so cute! I think they were supposed to resemble a kraken?

Super fun bar, but I'd only want to come back when it wasn't crowded. Would be a fun place to chill and enjoy a drink or two on a low key night.
author: Elena N.

description:
I have to admit I have a thing for tiki bars. It probably started with my senior ball and going to the Tonga Room at the Fairmont in my heather blue tuxedo. The feeling only got bigger and messier when I was at the University of Chicago and found any excuse to down a scorpion bowl at the late, lamented Ciral's House of Tiki on East 53rd - finishing finals, finishing mid-terms, finishing the dark half plate at Harold's Chicken Shack down the street, passing by on the way to the L. Maybe that was why I was a bit giddy about this place, just the anticipation made my heart palpitate and my hips go into a hernia-threatening hula.

Jamie W. and I decided to stop by after a hearty meal at the newly refurbished Alfred's Steakhouse and hey, we were in a retro mood anyway. It wasn't too crowded at around 8PM on a Wednesday evening. What a cool set-up. You enter a room that looks like the inside of a pirate ship with a huge aquarium on the side. They need to get more fish though. Not that big a bar really but hopping (photo: http://bit.ly/227N75Y) and plenty of stools with too-narrow counters. Cool porthole with a video inside that reminded me of the submarine ride in Disneyland (photo: http://bit.ly/1P3dfWv). Pitch black in here, impossible to read the menu without your smartphone torchlight.

Drinks are exactly what you expect at a tiki bar though a bit higher priced than what I remember from Ciral's. OK, a lot. Oh well, it is the FiDi after all. Jamie went for the $12 Bird of Paradise, quite a tall one with cachaça, Reposado tequila, vanilla, li hing mui (salted dry plum), a whole lotta lemon and a passion fruit whip to make it all frothy (photo: http://bit.ly/1pAOFYe). It was tropically tasty with a kick. I went with the very rummy $12 Mai Tai Float with two types of Caribbean rum, orange liqueur, lime, and orgeat in something called a "house float" (photo: http://bit.ly/1Tz2MKe). It had the parasol and the pineapple and cherries on a bamboo skewer.

It looked innocent enough but wham! We first took our drinks to the stools and stared at the porthole, but then we decided to move to the much larger back room where they have little white lights, tiki huts, big carved tiki idols (photo: http://bit.ly/1UXuW0S), and rumor has it that there is a volcano that spews smoke. It was like being on the three-part Hawaii episode arc of "The Brady Bunch" when Greg wipes out in the surf due to Bobby's tiki idol. OK, not really. But we got a bench so we could watch the hipsters tapping on their smartphones. Oh look, they have a $25 Jamaican Scorpion Bowl, theoretically for three. We'll be back.

COCKTAILS - 4.5 stars...classic tiki drinks with a mule kick to the head soon after
AMBIANCE - 5 stars...excellent job evoking Waikiki nights
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...bartender is super-energetic and friendly
TOTAL - 5 stars...oh hell, it's a top-notch tiki bar...surf's up, dude
author: Ed U.

description:
Two bars and bartenders who are happy to be there. Hardest part is getting their attention. It was way more packed than i thought it would be for such a new bar. Word spreads quickly and looks like everyone in FiDi knows about it. Drinks take a little bit of time but are worth the wait. Delicious rum based drinks and strong enough. 

Tiki themed bars are my favorite! They went all out on the polynesian, island inspired theme. Impressed by their first room with the aquarium, the hull of a ship, and little details like the mermaid statue and naval striped back rests. Keep walking and you'll find bamboo everywhere. The grass huts for small groups with prior reservations and an active volcano! The ceiling emulates the night sky, sparkling and actually quite pretty but still keeping with the theme. I appreciate the vibe they've created.

Much larger than Smuggler's Cove, classier than Trader Sam's and not tourist filled like the Tonga Room.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I'm a fan of tiki bars, especially the drinks and this one is awesome! We when arrived, it was close to 7 and there was a line out the door! Thankfully only had to wait a few minutes for people to come out so we could go in.
The moment you walk into the "sunken ship" you feel like you're on vacation and not in the FiDi! The bartenders are wearing Hawaiian t-shirt and everyone is carrying fruity drinks with umbrellas in them. If you're brave enough and/or have some friends who want to share, try ordering one of their drink bowls. I had the Fassionola Gold and It was really good. (and strong enough for me!) it even comes with a "fire show" from your server. :)

It's a fun atmosphere and can get crowded during prime happy hour times. This is definitely a good first stop to go to before starting the night. It seemed to empty out by 9pm.
author: Mimie L.

description: Love the decor.  Parking wasnt too difficult.  I tried their zombie and it was delicious.  I saw a few other people getting the scorpion bowl and they put on a show for you when its delivered.  Good for groups, parties, etc.
author: Alvin The Chipmun K.

description:
Pagan Idol is a welcomed addition to the FiDi bar scene. I wasn't really sure what to expect from this place when my friends first suggested it since it looks pretty small. I am so glad we decided to come here:

- Ambiance: This place looks super small up front, but opens up to a much larger area in the back. The decorations are on point for any tiki bar and very well done. You even sit on "tree stumps" in the back.
- Drinks: These drinks are nice and strong. We got the huge punch bowl (the one that gets lit on fire), which came with that mini fire show that was pretty darn cool. Took 5 of us a while to drink it...but alas we finished it...which was followed by another punch bowl that was extremely strong. Both these names escape me, but they were solid

I'd definitely recommend stopping by here if you're looking to get away from the "standard" bar scene that has engulfed SF
author: Andrew C.

description:
It was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. A friend and I got here around 11pm on a Saturday night and it was pretty packed. There's two bars, one in the front and the other towards the back. I would recommend going to back. It seems to be more popping there. 

Drinks: I got the Bird of Paradise and a Mai Tai float. Both were really tasty. The mai tai was actually kind of strong which I mean is good. It gets you feeling yourself and you don't have to spend that much. Hay! Drinks are kind of pricey, but hello you're in at a bar in DT and the drinks are honestly to take cute pictures with. 

Point is, yes I would come back here for a chill night. It doesn't seem to be a place for dancing or to get all ratchet, if you know what I mean. Great bar with super cool drinks :)
author: Mayra A.

description:
The drinks are great but the customer service needs a lot of work. I had a guy come up to me and antagonize me for touching the candles on the table. He stated," Please don't mess with the lights. It's pretty simple." Made it seem like I was a trouble maker, when I touched the candle once.

Didn't know it was now custom for bars to treat paying customers like children...
author: Zee K.

description: Friendly bartender, awesome atmosphere, dark, romantic, mysterious - you feel like you are inside a ship. At the back of the bar is the volcano that erupts on a times basis. The drinks are awesome! Beautifully presented.
author: Tracey H.

description: Wow! What a cool spot! Octopus on the ceiling, "erupting" volcano in the back, mermaid lights, a sweet fish tank and so much more. Walking in, greeted by a man in a tiki style shirt for ID check. The front area is smaller, with cute two seater tables by the window, one bar and 2 restrooms. Upstairs is huge! I'm imagining that's where the dancing would happen when the DJs are here (I went on Tuesday night after work). The bartenders were AMAZING but one star lost because the drinks do take a while. I waited probably 15 minutes before my drink was started bc they were whipping up other concoctions! With that being said, I asked for recommendations both times and LOVED my drinks (Toucan Dream & Bird of Paradise). They are quick to acknowledge you and even though it took a while, it was never because they were ignoring me. Maybe adding 3 bartenders to the bottom area? Anyways, LOVED IT and will be back!
author: Alexa S.

description: HUGE tiki fan and the decor in Pagan Idol is awesome.  That's probably the only thing it has going for it.  If you go on a Saturday around 7/8PM it's pretty empty, so I guess that's another positive.  Otherwise, the drinks taste watered down.  The sea horse mug is $100, but it's just the generic sea horse mug that you can find at Three Dots and a Dash in Chicago.  The drink that is in the Sea Horse mug is terrible.  They put champagne in it!  You can't mix champagne and rum, that's not edgy, it's just wrong!  Apparently yesterday they came out with a new drink menu that we didn't try, so maybe they made some improvements.
author: Allison C.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars that recently opened in Financial District. I love the ambiance here and the space is so big that it's great for group outings with coworkers, meeting up people or you could snuggle up in one of the booths by the wall for a more intimate gathering.

It amazes me how this bar is huge! I feel most FiDi bars I know are very small and cozy, but this bar has three sections; the first section you walk in and there's a fishtank to your left, a bar and the feeling like you're in a submarine ship (look out the fake windows!). The second section is another bar in the middle up the stairs and more standing room, and the last section is where all the booths on the side are. Overall the place has a dim lit setting, but a very fun vibe.

I also really like the drinks here too! $12 for unique cocktails, $30-50 for good punch bowls. I've had the Pineapple Express (has a cute pineapple design at the top of the drink!) Hemingway, and mai tai float. There was one time some coworkers and I got two of their scorpion bowls which were REALLY good. Fun to share, and not to mention.. they aren't cheap with how strong their drinks are here too. 

Great addition of character to the Financial District in terms of being classy with a little tiki attitude :)
author: Kathleen S.

description: Really was impressed with this place. Decors on point with a Hawaiian feel. Little mini volcano in the back. Super cool! 2 bars plenty of room and chairs.  Lots of bartenders so didn't have to wait long for a drink. Drinks are of course filled with plenty of rum and sugar so get ready for heartburn. Overall this place is great!
author: KB B.

description:
Tiki bars are a little kitschy, but that's what makes them so fun. Leave pretension at the door and order one of Pagan Idol's many fruity offerings. The atmosphere is a lot of fun without being too over-the-top. 

My boyfriend and I are visiting the city for our second time in a few months, and our local friend brought us to Pagan Idol. It was still a little early, so it wasn't overly crowded. I liked that the bar is split into two themes, and that the space extends back to allow for plenty of space! 

My boyfriend ordered a Bird of Paradise, our friend ordered a Dawn Patrol, and I opted for a Banana Life. All of the drinks were excellent (and beautifully presented).
author: Sarah B.

description: Was the designated driver tonight found out the will make you a mocktail. Just ask. I had a virgin pina colada. Super yummy.
author: Rebecca N.

description: Walked right into this place and the first thing I said was "Am I still in San Francisco?". This tiki bar definitely does its job making you feel like you're drinking on a tropical island. They've got nice seating towards the front, windows to the underwater sea, cabanas in the back, a special magical smokey table that almost makes you feel like you're in an underwater cavern. This place completely takes you away from the reality of working in The City and puts you right in a tropical paradise! The staff members are great at playing along with the role as well. Completely in character. It was so sweet. Asked them how their day was and they replied, "We're in paradise at a tiki bar - how could it be anything less than amazing?". We ordered the Monkey (rum?) bowl. It's a big, icey, slushy banana bowl with the cutest straws to drink out of with. It was delicious, and there was so much put in there. Watching the bartender move everywhere to make it was overwhelming. Talent, indeed. Would love to come back here and try more drinks when I have the time. Definitely one of my recommended bars in San Francisco.
author: Kim N.

description:
The cocktails served here are so good. Each one is fairly complex that's why it takes longer to make. So don't expect to get your drink in less than 5 minutes. Keep that in mind when there is a long queue in front of you. Comes at a steep price though. Each drink is around $15 a drink. I think they price in the great tiki vibes into each drink. Which I am OK with b/c they did an awesome job with the decor and fake volcano eruption going on. 

This is currently one of my favorite tiki bars in the area, and that's saying a lot with all the great ones near by (Tonga being one of the most famous ones). Who knows if that will change though, I feel like new ones are being added every month or so. 

They take reservations, which I recommend doing that for large groups. One time I came in and the top "patio" area was all booked for a birthday party. Everyone wore Hawaiian themed apparel, which I thought was a cool idea (might steal that idea). If you don't get a reservation for a table, you can occupy the stool and table seating area (first come first serve). This place is pretty huge, so it is convenient that they have multiple bars that you can order from (2 large ones, and one small one in the back). Heads up, it gets pretty packed on Friday and the weekend, so if you want a chiller vibe you probably want to drop by Monday - Thursday.
author: Frances P.

description: Not impressed. Rude bouncers yelled at me for having a backpack (coming from work for happy hour, what do you expect?!), cocktail menu basically only had rum drinks (I know it's a tiki bar, but a little variety is nice), it was dark and loud and overall not a very welcoming environment. Wouldn't go back.
author: Krista S.

description: AMAZING! This place is top notch, the decor/ambiance fits the tiki theme perfectly (and almost feels like you're in Disneyland it's so well thought out) and the drinks are amazing! I got the Plex on the Beach and it was the best drink I've ever had! Super fruity and delicious, it's a better version of a slurpee that's alcoholic. I would 100% come back again, and will be going here anytime I'm in SF in the future!
author: Tori Z.

description:
Beside the sadistic name of this place, the bartender was awesome and the drinks were amazing. The decor was great and they did it right. 

The koi fish in the pond towards the back with the smoke machine and the stars in the ceiling was done so right. I think I had the day walker I was lit after a few of them. Classic art of the drink executed nicely.
author: David H.

description:
CUTEST BAR EVER!  If I lived in the city or nearby, I could definitely see myself planning GNO here.  All the drinks are super super SUPER cute.  I love how the bartenders put in the same effort to every drink that is ordered.  They make sure it tastes good but it also LOOKS good as well.  I tried my friends "Bird of Paradise" drink and it was so yummy!  My favorite part was the whipped cream that had li hing mui powder sprinkled all over it---SO BOMB! 

I'm super bummed that I was so exhausted when I was here so I couldn't really enjoy myself but I really enjoyed the drinks we ordered.  Our group also ordered the Fassionola Gold which is essentially a bowl of booze for sharing.  The cool part is that it comes with a cool fire show that one of the bartenders will do for you!  Definitely will be planning to come back next time I'm in the city again!

**Side note, the bathrooms are disgusting here.  That's probably the only bad thing I experienced that night.  I couldn't tell if the floor was wet from water or..... you don't want to know.  Yes, it was that bad.
author: Regina O.

description:
I'm more of a gin n tonic or vodka soda kind of gal, but my friend convinced me to grab a sweet drink as dessert after our dinner. 

I never have good luck with drinks when ordering at tiki bars and I always feel like I'm spending a bunch of money to drink nothing but sugar, but let me tell ya, Pagan Idol changed my mind about tiki bars and my drink here was amazing! I ordered a Bird of Paradise ($12 more affordable than some of the other tiki places that I've been to) and my friend ordered a Banana Life and had them put whip cream on top. Both drinks were great, but I did enjoy my drink a lot more than the Banana Life. 

We arrived pretty early in the night, so we were able to grab a seat, but it did start to get crowded. If you plan on coming here with a large group, I would suggest making a reservation. 

This place was a lot of fun and it helps that even the bouncer and bartenders were friendly. Cheers to finding a tiki bar that knows how to make perfectly crafted tiki cocktails!
author: Denise J.

description: The bartenders exhibit an attitude not conducive to leaving tips. Most of the bar - the back room- opens late . Check your bill for mistakes.
author: Steve G.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for quite some time now and I was not disappointed! In the Tiki Bar realm, this ranks between Smuggler's Cover and the Tonga Room for me. The ambiance is amazing with the wooden, ship wrecked decor, a waterfall and even a fish tank!

This place was the tropical vacation I needed in the midst of this terrible weather we are currently experiencing. 

4 of us shared the scorpion bowl and while there was a lot of ice this was a pretty potent drink and perfect for 4 people. I would highly recommend getting this and get your Snapchat ready for the fire show!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Great interior, loved the aesthetic. Drinks were very good (though Forbidden Island in Alameda is better) and bartenders were attentive.

Bathrooms were atrocious.
author: Lorin L.

description: Fun! Great cocktails and fun theme. Our group had a nice after-work gathering. Good service.
author: Vicki L.

description:
I love tiki bars because of the decor , tasty drinks, and overall feel. This place really steps up their game!

They have a pretty large space which allows you Sit at the bar in the front room for a more intimate feel or venture out to the back room where you can hang with a larger group. They even have this one section with a tiny waterfall and is a little more secluded.

Anyway the overall feel of the place is dreamy with a night sky motif. There are twinkling lights above to imitate stars. The drinks as you know are in the $$ side but that's standard for tiki bars.

The drink menu is fun with lots and lots of choices. We ordered two bowls to split amongst us three. One was $35 and the other was $50. The $50 one even came with flames!!! The drinks were delicious and the atmosphere was pretty unique.
author: Bianka G.

description: Excellent drinks and fun theme! A little pricey but cool! I probably wouldn't spend all night there however it's nice to mix it up every now and then instead of going to the typical SF bars.
author: Katie G.

description: I just love the atmosphere. The souvenir glass is a nice touch too. I totally want to comeback for their swing night
author: Merisa R.

description: This tiki bar is so fun! The drinks are all nicely decorated. We got a bowl (forgot which it was) and they lit it on fire. Love the decor. In one room, it felt like the inside of a ship and in the back, they had totems, tiki torches, a volcano, fishes, etc. I really liked the ambiance of the back room with the twinkling night sky on the ceiling. They even had fog machines go off every once in a while. Drinks are all at least $12 but they are definitely strong while tasting great.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Tiki awesomeness!

Two local friends (who happen to be tiki bar connoisseurs) took me and my mom here on our trip to San Francisco last week. They opened at 6pm and there was already a line outside at 5:45! Walking in to this place feels like walking into the hull of a ship, complete with aquariums, portholes, and glass-blown tentacle chandeliers.  The drinks were all delicious, but you definitely pay for the extra effort that goes in to them. 

At 7pm they rang a bell, made an announcement and opened the doors to their back room, which featured huge tiki heads, a ceiling with twinkling stars and a waterfall (with real fish swimming in it!) It felt straight out of Disneyworld! What a fun place to hang out and enjoy a delicious drink. If I lived in San Francisco I would absolutely be back very soon!
author: Clara T.

description:
This place is awesome and huge. 

There is no happy hour but they got a lot of plusses:

They have 3 bars to get drinks.   
They have a lot of room. 
They make sure it doesn't get too full. 
They have Great decor. 
And you got to love the extra touches stars on the ceiling and the fog machine. 

They have a lot of sharing drinks and they have beer too so whatever you like.  

Enjoy this place.
author: Homer S.

description: Bourbon and Branch dudes started this one. Boozy drinks in a great space. Had a mai tai and the banana life. Lots of booze, but that helped round out the sweetness. All the other drinks looked great. It's like drinking inside of an aquarium. Very cool atmosphere. Didn't seem to be totally full of tech geeks. With this, the Tonga Room and Smugglers Cove you can round out a nice tiki bar hopping night.
author: Michael C.

description: Super fun spot!  Great drinks, we had our own private bartender, who made his own creations for me!  Delicious!!!
author: Mia D.

description:
Great tiki bar with awesome drinks & superb service !

Like other have said, the drinks are potent.  Delicious cocktails, mocktails, and aged sipping rums.  Quade is an awesome bartender !

Tropical, casual vibe with very cool decor, lighting & humid ambience.

Many of the cocktails, like the planters punch have unique syrups & tropical flavors.  The mint leaves & other fixins are flavorful & nice touch.

One thing missing....  no food.  Eat before you go or you'll have a killer buzz.  If you don't eat, take a taxi or lyft to your hotel or home.

If you like a Tiki Bar and craving a mood transporting feel, visit Pagan Idol.
author: Gregg F.

description: After walking for 1 mile we reached to the place on the night of santacon and they said no for the "people from santacon". We weren't really dressed up for santacon. When I ask what is their definition for santacon they didn't answer! Never seen such a discrimination in any of the bar in the city. Disgrace to sprit of the city!
author: Aankita D.

description: One of the worst paces in the whole SF area. We accidentally stopped by this bar on the eve of santa con. And they decided not to let anyone in with any attire related to Santa con. I dint even know it was Santa con, I was just wearing a normal tee and a jean with a coat. And for some reason the bouncer decided that was a Santa con attire and decided I should not be let in.  Now thinking of it, looks like a racist discrimination. I ve heard from other friends also that the bouncers are pretty racist.
author: Soudipta D.

description: Tried to go there for santa con, and got turned away, which is fine, but the bouncers there demeaned their customers as they did so. There was no need to be hostile, no one was drunk or being an idiot. I felt very let down with how they handled the situation. Many people around us who were regulars at the bar mentioned that they are never coming back because of that experience. I think I will be doing the same.
author: Naho K.

description:
This is a serious tiki bar! There's a bar as you walk in and another if you keep venturing towards the back. Each bar was serving up Craft (with a capital "C" if you know what I mean) tiki drinks. Like expect three to five minutes per drink. And if there's a queue, expect to wait longer. But if you have to wait a little while, that's fine, as you can wonder around and enjoy the darkly tropical decor that's not so unlike exploring a haunted pirate ship attraction, complete with trippy music and random air blasts and other unexpected loud noises.

So yeah this place is really cool so expect it to get busy pretty much every day from 4pm on, especially during weekdays as after work warriors pour in to talk tech.
author: Will S.

description:
Do you like sugar to go with your alcohol? Then you are in luck, my friends. These tiki drinks are well done, don't get me wrong, but whooheee, all that fresh fruit and liquor makes for some sweetness!

Happy hour here is hopping. And there isn't even any happy hour deals. It's just a popular spot to get some post-work libations filled with a ton of suits, to boot. More popular with a group style setting vs an intimate 1:1. 

The area is set up in 2 areas: the front and back bars. The front is a bit more casual while the back is a full on dark tiki bar with some really great decor if I do say so myself. You will need to break out the phone to actually read the menu since it's dark up in here.

My drink of the night: the grog with a sugar candy stirrer. Three of these and I'm feeling it this morning. Drinks are at about $12, which actually isn't horribly priced for these labor intensive cocktails. Other fan favorites were the Manhattan, the Pineapple Express and the Rum Punch!

Definitely kitsch and I like every minute of it!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
The line to worship the altar of the Pagan Idol starts behind me! I finally got the chance to check out San Francisco's newest, hippest, and liveliest tiki bar in the FiDi District! Founded by the team that brought us Bourbon and Branch, Pagan Idol is everything I imagine it would be and then some! The place was a sensory explosion for the eyes and the drinks were a flavor sensation for the taste buds! 

I was lucky enough to finally get a chance to experience the wonders of Pagan Idol when my good friend Christine and I were wrapping up a late night on the town and wanted one last place to get a fun yet festive nightcap in. The first place that came to mind was of course Pagan Idol. We have been dying to try this place out since they opened earlier this year but the timing and crowd was never right. Finally on a Wednesday evening in October, the timing was perfect. The crowd had a high tech meets hipster vibe was large but not overwhelming as I've seen driving by on the weekends.

Thankfully there is no cover charge, but there is someone outside checking IDs. Upon entry, you'll find a dimly lit paradise with whimsical decor everywhere you look. Tonight there was plenty of room to walk around, the space is divided into separate rooms and bars. Up front it's the "Captain's Quarters" which resembled an interior of a boat complete with portholes with actual screens of sea life in them. In the back, it resembled a traditional tropical bar complete with tiki sculptures, private dining areas, a starry night sky on the ceiling and even a working volcano! If you can judge a place by its interior, Pagan Idol would win hands down!

But we came for some tiki drinks and we really lucked out when the space on the front counter cleared up as soon as we approached it. (Proving that this trip was really meant to be!) After perusing the menu of about seventeen drinks, we asked our first bartender Dan what was popular here. He suggested we go with the Bird of Paradise with Cachaca, Reposado Tequila, lemon, vanilla, passion fruit whip, li hing mui and sea salt. It was a decent drink, but had way too much ice in it even though it was in a traditional tall hurricane glass. For my first drink, I decided to go with a Jungle Bird with pineapple infused Jamaican Rum, pineapple, lime, Campari, passion fruit and saline. (Saline? Um okay!) Both drinks were tropical and tiki inspired in every sense possible, for my friend's Bird of Paradise, although she loved it, for me, the hurricane glass was filled with way too much crushed ice and that disappointed me to a degree. My Jungle Bird drink was filled with just the perfect amount of ice versus liquid, was light, yet simply sweet, delicious, yet smooth. 

After taking in so much booze, I needed a quick respite before we headed into our second round of drinks, so I decided to order a simple Coke to cool me down. What I got was one of the most stunning drinks I've ever seen! A chilled Coke bottle served alongside a chilled tall glass with the longest ice cube I've every seen topped with a lovely orchid flower. It's was the perfect way to put a pause on the party, but also showed me the effort that the team at Pagan Idol puts into every drink they serve, including the nonalcoholic ones.

For our second round of tiki drinks, we went with the Dawn Patrol with Scotch, coffee liqueur, creme de cacao, lemon, cinnamon, and cream topped with toasted marshmallows and a maraschino cherry. My friend loved the pick me up aspect of her drink. I went with the Flex on the Beach with a blend of fresh rums with fresh peach, orange, lemon, apricot, and hibiscus. They had two sizes with this drink, our bartender Johnny told me to get the larger size served in a heavy yet totally festive tiki glass! Christine asked about how much it cost to buy a glass since they sold other cups for an optimum price and Johnny said it cost 15 dollars. When we decided to purchase two tiki glasses as souvenirs they gave a ten dollar discount when we bought two of them! As we contemplated our glassware purchase, I thought the Flex on the Beach felt more like a hurricane from Bourbon Street in New Orleans rather than a fabulous mixed tiki drink. It was a slushee poured from their margaritas machines on the the counter in back and wasn't expecting that at all. 

But despite the disappointing last drink, I'd still totally go back to Pagan Idol, it's fun, festive and clean for a bar in the FiDi area of San Francisco. I'm always down for a good tiki bar especially one as nice as Pagan Idol. There's even a secret menu that you can ask your server for which apparently mainly consists of changes to drinks they already have on their menu, but it's always worth it to ask. Mondays thru Thursdays are the best time to come in because over the weekend it gets packed. When we finally got up to leave our bartender even got up to shake our hands at the door. I guess it was late they wanted us out! All the more reason to return in the future!
author: Jason F.

description: We came here with some friends who were in town. I had never been before, it was recommended for its cool atmosphere. I had no idea what to expect. Walking in from the hustle and bustle of a SF Friday night you are immediately taken to a whole new place! I suddenly realized I wasn't on the the streets of SF anymore, I was now in a tiki bar. But this isn't an ordinary tiki bar it is tikid out to the max. The music, the lighting , every corner had some kind of tropical type theme. It's very different from any bar I've been too. I recommend checking it out.
author: Diane G.

description:
One of my favorite bars in San Francisco. I believe they are the sister bar to Local Edition(another great spot to check out) They do the whole tiki vibe to the max here. Occasionally random smoke pushes out of the ceiling and doses you in a heavy cloud. The ceiling is filled with twinkly lights to make it seem like a night sky. The air is balmy not sure if they are trying for that or it's just bad ventilation though. I really wish instead of smoke they shot out mist would help with the balmy temperatures. Fair warning this is a fairly new bar and it's really popular so it does tend to get packed. There is lots of space. There are two different bar sets ups. I went this past Friday and it was super packed. Th drinks are really good and some of the most aesthetically pleasing drinks I have seen in the city. The bartenders have always been really friendly.They also do large drinking bowls to share with a group of friends. 

Definitely a bar I will always keep coming back too.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I'm a sucker for a tiki bar (Tonga Room, Trader Vic's, etc.). And Pagan Idol is as good a tiki bar as you're going to find in the Bay Area. 

This boozy, Polynesian-themed newcomer has everything you could want in a tiki bar - kitschy decor; rum-based cocktails with silly names; and bamboo huts for private parties; and an erupting volcano water fixture. When you step inside, it's almost sensory overload. But it sure is fun! It's like Disneyland meets the Brady Bunch Goes to Hawaii episode.

While most of my friends ordered sugary, tropical cocktails (which, to be honest, all sounded like variations of a Mai-Tai), I opted for the Rum Old Fashioned. Since the folks behind the bar are also the folks behind Bourbon & Branch, you know the libations are going to be stellar (and they were). 

Since it's located in the heart of the Financial District and a new kid on the block, be ready for a big, noisy crowd. If you're looking to have intimate conversations with someone, this is definitely not the place. But if you're just looking for a fun after-work happy hour spot, where you can loosen your tie and transport your mind and tastebuds to a tropical paradise, then Pagan Idol is the perfect place for you. I can't wait to come back!
author: Kevin B.

description: Excellent cocktails and great ambience ..loved this place didn't expect it to be so big ... great tiki bar in the financial district ..
author: Kalyani G.

description: The place and inside decorations are great. Service is good. The drink selections are awesome!! There are so many different kinds of specialty cocktails to choose from. I got the sparkle and broth and the hemminway. They were good but I have to take off one star because the drinks were blended with too much ice so they were slightly water down as you drink. Definitely come back here again soon.
author: Huong L.

description:
What more can you want in a tiki bar? This place is great!

I was surprised how large it is, and appreciate that there are multiple bars for when the place gets hoppin'. Unlike another smaller tiki bar in SF, we were able to walk right in (although there was a short line outside by the time we left). The bartenders aren't pouring shots, but creating semi-elaborate drinks (think grating nutmeg over the top as an aromatic finish), so when you approach the bar know your order and be patient. As with most tiki bars, the fun illustrated menu can help you decide. We enjoyed both our drinks, the Witch Doctor and Maybe Grog, which comes with a stick of rock candy - how fun is that?!

Enjoy the kooky decor and grab a table or intimate bench seat in the quieter back, or if you have a group consider making a reservation for one of the cool huts.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I love a place with fire, and this place has fire and water features, not to mention cocktails that will make your hair curl or straighten depending on your hair-needs at the time.

If it's ridiculous punch bowls for 4, pina coladas for 1, or enough tropical drinks to make you forget how many you've had- Pagan Idol is the place to do it.
author: Brianna S.

description: Dark & tropical. Expensive but tasty/cool drinks.
author: Kelly G.

description: Absolutely loved visiting this tiki bar with friends on a Friday night, there was a line out the door by 5:30. Great decorations and tasty drinks, averages $12 each. There's a canoe hanging up in the ceiling in the back! Adequate seating. Can't wait to come back again in the future.
author: Wendy L.

description:
After stumbling in from an event that served free beer and wine, I didn't get to fully explore Pagan Idol's menu--- I know so sad. But because we were in the neighborhood and Pagan Idol has been in my bookmarks for the past couple of months, I had to at least get one drink--- or bowl whichever lol. 

The drinks are fairly cheaper than Smuggler's--- bowls around $25-50 and cocktails around $12-$15. Selections are not as extensive as Smuggler's but they cover the basic tiki bar essentials--- punches, bowls, mai tais.

My friends and I ordered their Jamaican Scorpion Bowl. Maybe because I haven't had hard liquor for a while I found the drink to be strong. The bartender was lenient with the Cognac, which I can never complain. 

The venue feels a lot more spacious with better air circulation. I didn't get to explore the back of the bar, but hopefully that could be resolved at my next visit.
author: Denzell S.

description: Looks like you are in a different world when you enter. Half ship half tiki lounge status. Good drinks, if you like sugar.
author: Peter S.

description:
I do love this place. Drinks are good and it's fun. 

Can you guys engage that puffer fish though? Watching him all night he seemed so bored in his small tank and needs a little more to be a happy fish. I know that seems like a small ask in the scheme of a wonderful bar but it weighed on me as I watched him stay in the same spot the whole night.
author: Emma S.

description: Good times with the girlfriends. Enjoyed Friday night vibe. Cocktails are large and mighty strong. Line to get in went fast.
author: Tracy D.

description: This is my favorite bar in San Francisco.  It is utterly beautiful - the design, the ambiance, the feel of the place is everything.  The drinks are the best.  They have so many options to choose from, including drinks with actual flames.  The place is never too crowded and we always find a place to sit.  We love taking all of our out of town friends here! I highly recommend this place.
author: Ghazal S.

description: Best Tiki drinks in SF. Blows Smuggler's Cove out of the water. Fresh made juices and real knowledgeable bartenders. They even knew about my favorite PKNY in New York (rest in peace.) Drinks aren't cheap, but you can see the hard work that goes into each one, and it's worth it. Can get crowded, but it's a huge space, so walk around to figure out what sort of vibe you want.
author: Josh K.

description: Came here with coworkers to check out the new million dollar renovations and amazing drinks. I was a bit let down cause I hold my standards higher than they should be. I think the drinks were pricier and just okay compared to the hype. The place is designed like Polynesian islands like Moana for adults. But I don't know if they captured the vibe right. It feels a bit unfinished. This is what I think about instead of having conversations with my coworkers by the way. They have good cocktails though for groups. There's Polynesian themed drinks to share, but again I've had Tokyo Fishbowls in DTF back in college that I liked more. It's a place to check out at least once, but I think there's always new bars to discover in SF.
author: TJ P.

description:
So I'm a driver in the city and have heard and seen this place many times so I finally decided to come here with my husband on date night. I'm going to do a break down of what I experienced. 

Atmosphere: Inside it's actually quite larger than I expected. The decor is amazing and loved that the owner put a lot of effort to make it look like a ship. When you first walk in there is seating to the left behind the fish tank which we liked. A bar and a bathroom to the left. Then walking further down is another bar and lots of room and more seating in the back. There were a couple entertainers dancing with hula hoops which everyone seemed to enjoy. I didn't watch but it seemed entertaining. 

Drinks: The menu didn't seem all complicated as must places so I liked that there were great choices. My husband ordered the Witch Doctor and I ordered the Pineapple Express. The drinks were amazing! So delicious but very dangerous. My Pineapple Express was very tasty but I know if I had at least one more then bye bye soberness. So no seconds for me. 

Prices: The prices of the drinks were as expected. So the average drink is at least $12 so just know one person could easily spend $50-$100 here. 

Overall: We liked this place a lot. My husband is considering having his birthday celebrated here so maybe we will check it out.i highly recommend this place.
author: Cristina S.

description:
"In the Tiki Tiki Tiki Tiki Tiki Room all the birds sing words and the flowers croon in the Tiki Tiki Tiki Tiki Tiki Room." That what I was singing the whole time in Pagan Idol! Take a trip to an Island in the sun without ever leaving San Fran. 
Pagan Idol is fully committed to taking you on a trip! With 2 distinct bars, as you enter you feel like you are on a ship.. Need a drink captain I think you do! 
Up the stairs you find your self in a Tiki bar, with lights capturing the twinkling of the stars and ever so often you hear the erupting of a volcano with fake smoke fog entering the bar! It's really fun and quite the surprise! 
The drinks are pricey but fun, and your really get the island vibe! 
I purchased a 15 dollar beauty called the "Day Walker" a combo of rums and sweet stuff topped with minty leaves it was delicious and strong! If you are going to go for bang for your buck this would be a good option and will have you hula dancing in the isles! 
The atmosphere is so fun, and the bars were busy at Happy Hour times, but the bartenders worked fast and got us drinks quickly! 
This would be a perfect spot for a 3 hour tour.. if you know what I mean!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Hands down the best modern tiki bar in the city. Such great drinks. I made a last minute reservation for 4 in a tiki hut.  I was stood up for an hour until my party arrived. Mind you the reservation times are held for up to an hour and a half. (Haven't found anywhere that this information is listed prior to making the reservation)
I've started a tab on my own in the mean time. As long as you have a reservation the attention from the bartenders/staff is great. 
The bouncers kindly allowed us to move booths after our original allotted time not knowing that we weren't going to continue with bar service. We were ignored and the cocktail waiters/bartenders were avoiding us after the ending of our original reservation. After some half thought out excuse how we aren't to be served - reluctantly they served us another round and then my bill was presented.
