I was the original reservation holder I was charged a 20% gratuity without any explanation. The menu states this is added for parties of 6 and more. I kindly inquired on why it was added to my bill and again "no one knew how/why it happened" 
This felt like a dishonest action because I haven never had so many issues settling a bar bill or so many people "not know what happened."
Over All great experience and I would come back just make sure you don't sign your bill without really reviewing it first.
author: Rene C.

description:
This place is awesome! I'm a big fan of those fruity alcoholic concoctions so when I heard about this place, you already know that I had to come and check it out. The attention to detail is this place is on point. I literally felt like I was on a Disneyland ride the moment I walked in, from the shiplike front of the bar to the very dim lit back area with the mini volcano and "starlit" skies...it was great. It didn't feel tacky at all, like how some other tiki bars are. Just be aware that it is very dark in there, so it may be hard to read the menu and/or see whoever you're with..not sure if that's a good thing or bad thing, though. 

The drinks were standard pricing, ranging from ~$11 to mid 30-40ish for one of those bowl drinks meant for multiple people. The drinks had hilarious names and descriptions, and even came with some not-so-standard drink toppings (think banana chips, marshmallow fluff, and so on). From what I can remember, the drinks were pretty strong and all had some form of rum in one way or another. The front bar may be crowded, but it's nice that they have a second, lot less crowded bar in the back. Overall, it's a pretty chill place and also conveniently located within a few blocks from Bart too! A win-win for me. 

Would definitely love to come back here to try one of their bowl drinks and to finally enjoy that back room. Til next time, Pagan Idol!
author: Gabrielle S.

description:
This place is the scene. Smoke, a boat on the ceiling and tiki making bartenders. I went in on a Saturday and the place was busy but not to the point that there is no place to move. It was my second stop of the night but still felt the drinks still had enough oomph in them. Also, many cocktail places in town have become too pretentious with their drink making which did not feel like at this place.

A good tiki choice if you are in that hood.
author: Rahul H.

description:
OH. MY. STARS. Literally - there are decorative little stars on the ceiling. I'm a sucker for a good theme, so this really tickled my tiki torch. The drinks are expensive, but boy howdy are they potent. They're also incredibly delicious. I got a fun little tiki dude souvenir mug. You can enjoy your drink without purchasing its vessel, but who doesn't want a weird little tribal dude staring at you in your kitchen? 
The decor is insanely cute. It feels like you're underwater in a boat, then in Hawaii. If this sounds confusing, you should just go and see it for yourself. It's definitely worth it.
author: Jenna J.

description:
I've said it once and I will say it again - nobody has a bad time in a tiki bar. 

I went to Pagan Idol at around 6ish on a Saturday night and it was already pumping. Being a solo barfly at this point, I immediately snagged myself a seat at the bar and promptly started chatting away to the bartender.

I ordered a Mai Tai float, which is the recommended drink for first-timers to this bar and was absolutely delighted. Boozy, juicy and utterly tiki.

It was upon finishing this drink that the bartender rang a large bell and yelled out to the crowd "We have arrived at our destination! Enter the island up the stairs. Don't look at the cannibals directly in the eye." WHAT ON EARTH WAS GOING ON!?

The back door swung upon and guests walked through a cloud of smoke to discover an enormous, far more elaborate second room. I was later told the front room of the venue is considered the boat, and the back room is considered the island.

While Pagan Island does NOT have any souvenir glasses, it certainly did quench my tiki thirst.

Don't come here for dancing and music to sing along to (the music is mostly ambient noises of bugs and birds chirping).

Do come here for good times.
author: Jackie D.

description: This place is fantastic! I'm an absolute sucker for Tiki Bars and this one fit the bill. Nestled only a few blocks from my job I can tell you already I will be back again. This was my final stop during a bit of a night time romp with some co workers and I'm glad we did. The decor inside is great. Giving off a boat/island vibe throughout. A very cool place to chill, talk and just drink some great island infused drinks. We decided to go big on this one and order one of the bowls. The staff was super cool and the drink was great and strong! I left here feeling like I was leaving a ride from Disneyland and I literally can't wait to go back with some more friends!
author: James R.

description:
Very unexpecting kind of place to find a rum tiki bar in the middle of the FiDi.  It's pretty dark in here so you'll need your phone just to read the drinks menu.  Overall it wasn't that crowded as other FiDi bars on a weeknight.  This place actually had standing room in the back where the smoke machine was in full effect.

I don't know how early I'd need to get here just to get a table but the drinks were decently made at usual FiDi downtown pricing.  And this place is closer to my work than Smuggler's Cove.  So win/win there.

Would I come back?  Definitely but with a Hawaiian shirt on next time.
author: Ben H L.

description:
A few coworkers and I decided to give this place a try on a Friday afternoon around 4 and the place was packed. Took us about 10-15 minutes just to get our orders in & actually have a drink in hand but we understood there were only a handful of bartenders at the time and each drink takes so much to make... We were all getting a little restless being stuck in a little room with so many people, and just when we were about to leave... at 4:45, they opened up a magical door leading to a space more than doubling the first room + 2 more bars. 

We quickly went over to the larger room, got ourselves some seats and ordered more drinks. The atmosphere is awesome, really "tiki" like and drinks are strong, but delicious.

Will definitely be back soon!
author: Carrie L.

description: I'm already planing to come back for some more of their tasty drinks. Came here with a group of friends on a Saturday night,When we first got here there was no line but some of our group decided they were hungry and wanted to eat something real fast, so we walked across the street and got a pizza real fast by the time we came back there was a pretty big line but it went pretty fast and we had pizza to eat why we waited, so be prepared to stand in line and wait if you come on the weekend. The drinks I had was the Bird of Paradise and The Mai tai, the Bird of paradise was really good and it creeps up on you, the Mai tai was pretty strong you could taste the liquor in one that, was a little scared to finish that one off. Didn't really walk around much cause we found seats in the front so I really cant tell you about the back bar but the front bar had two bartenders. Will be back this weekend I try some of their other drinks.
author: Dennis T.

description:
Very fun tiki bar and a great atmosphere. There are two sections to this bar - the front room is designed to be like a ship, complete with wheels and portholes "looking out" into the ocean, while the back room is designed to be like the island, having stepped off the ship and onto your island getaway. 

The drinks, while a little pricey, keep in the tropical theme and have fun names/ingredients (ie, the "witch doctor" comes with an ancient curse). The bartenders do a good job of making the drinks just strong enough without tasting too much like alcohol. 

The place does get crowded - before 5pm, only the front room is open, so a good time to come would be a little bit before 5, so that once the back room opens up, you can be first in line at the bar in that room, minimizing your wait time. 

I was really impressed with their commitment to the theme, which definitely helps with the overall experience. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Wayne H.

description: Great service and amazing drinks, fun atmosphere. The painkiller was great - not too strong or sour, sweet but not a pina colada overkill.
author: Alpo P.

description: Great atmosphere and the drink was big and great with fun sinking ship theme and great view everywhere!!! Loved it!!
author: Keywanda F.

description:
This is a tiny island paradise filled with drinks and FOG VOLCANO EXPLOSIONS, gigantic FIRE-LIT alcoholic bowls with long straws to share, and just seriously SO MUCH FUN. 

This is as much fun as your first time at urban putt, without the work of having to move or think. Just enjoy the drinking, and if you manage to snag a seat - I AM JEALOUS. because this place is awesome. 

I can't wait to go back. Gets a little packed, but not annoyingly so.
author: Kristie C.

description:
I love Pagan Idol. I never really had a thing for tiki bars, they tend to come across as dusty and a bit sticky and the drinks can be too boozed up to taste any. Pagan Idol is unlike any tiki bar that I've ever been to before. It's a classy tiki bar, which I didn't know existed!

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ The interior is absolutely gorgeous, like a classed-up Disneyland bar (which is a compliment, believe me), with regular 'storms', 'stars', and awesome tiki huts for bigger groups
+ The drinks are absolutely fantastic, strong but with tons of flavor
+ Their fish bowls (for lack of the proper term) don't just exist to get you smashed, but to collectively enjoy tropical drinks
+ Bottles of water and glasses available at the front bar to enjoy responsibly

I adore this place, and hope to be back very, very soon (but not too late, when it gets crowded and loud!).
author: Claire S.

description:
Pagan Idol is deceivingly big. When I entered, I was slightly underwhelmed by the front room. Was I in the wrong place? It looked nothing like the photos I had seen online. And then I kept exploring and found the bar up some stairs. The room was dark (as my coworker would say - perfect for dates since you can't tell how unattractive the other person is). 

When my date did come, he spent 20+ minutes at the bar ordering our drinks. I am not a very patient person and if it wasn't because the drinks looked so beautiful and tasted delicious, I would've been pissed off. My blended pina colada was divine and his mai tai was strong.

After two rounds of drinks, we headed out for dinner at cute Belden Place across the street.
author: Yi Z.

description: Probably the best tiki bar in San Francisco, and one of the top 2 or 3 in the entire Bay Area! Great decor, ambiance, service, menu, showmanship, and drinks -- and I went on a somewhat crowded Friday night with no stage entertainment! The flaming bowl I split with my group was excellent and the scotch/coffee/chocolate drink I had (topped with a toasted marshmallow and cherry) was a delicious desserty drink!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
This place is like rainforest cafe in bar form, or a Disneyland ride. 

I love the detail the designer put into this place! They even have a volcano erupting noise go off every so often with smoke and lights, it's pretty abrupt though and scared the shit out of me the first time it went off. -management, this is fun and all, but maybe consider toning it down just a bit. 

Ive only tried out two drinks here but I liked both, one had absinthe in it which I thought balanced the fruit flavors really well if you don't want something too sweet. I thought it would be weird but it works surprisingly well. The other was "Hemmingway is dead" and I really recommend it, great frozen drink and not too sweet but still fruity .
author: Elena K.

description: Amazing Tiki Bar! Great atmosphere- a must visit when visiting the city by the bay! Service was fast serving the best drinks!
author: Brian A.

description:
This is a pretty cool spot!  The drinks are good.  I had the dawn patrol.  My only complaint is that there was so much ice.  However, the drink was good and the bartender is a master at her craft handling all these beautiful drinks simultaneously.

I definitely recommend this spot for HH!
author: Rachel L.

description:
We came - 40 MINUTES - before closing. Interested in trying the cocktail scene in San Fran, as we live in NYC and wanted to check it out. The bartender literally saw us coming from the street, threw away his cigerette and locked the door.

Welcome to San Francisco - do not bother with this bar if you have any interest in having a real drink, at a reasonable time. Too often it seems sleepy San Francisco is as much a product of the people who run it than the operational hours its run by.

Appalled and disappointed. NYC 1 - SF 0
author: Chris Y.

description: I visited Pagan Idol for the first time last night for a private event. I loved it. I didn't have to wait in line once for drinks, water, the bathroom, coat check, or food. It was so well-run, it made the experience so easy and fun. Even more importantly, every single staff member was just so pleasant; the bartenders, servers, door staff... Everyone was so nice and fun, they made our night just lovely! The bar itself was very cool- the fish tank and the fish pond/waterfall were fun, the decor was cute, and the setup with two bars in three and a half rooms worked well. I generally don't like fruity drinks, but the two I ordered (one alcoholic, one non-) were both delicious and came with plantain chips! My friend's drink came with a flaming marshmallow! I can't say enough good things about this place, I can't wait to come back!
author: Megan H.

description:
So apparently going on a Monday is a good thing. While there were still a good number of folks there, we were told about the crowds almost any other day of the week. Yay us!

We came for one thing and one thing only: the DAY WALKER. 

I knew we were in trouble when the bartender smirked after we ordered them, but we ain't ever scared! After drinking one, we all looked at each other. It just got real. What do tipsy folks do, order another round. I can say this with certainty - you only need one of those things. You can't really taste the liquor, but definitely feel it. 

It was masterfully made and the bartender was great. I'll be back.
author: Kischa J.

description:
Pagan Idol is the tiki bar of tourist dreams, and I like it. 
I was super hesitant to check out pagan Idol as I was very underwhelmed by Smugglers Cove, but last Friday I got off work a bit early and my bf and I decided to finally give this place a try. Walking in, you wouldn't expect it to be HUGE, this is more like a tiki sunken ship the place keeps going all the way into the back with little nooks and crannies to hang out in. Two large bars in the front and back with slushy machines, walls of rum and Hawaiian t-shirt wearing bartenders, how perfect. In all this place is fairly dim lit and slightly reminds me of being in some ride at Disney with the tiki theme, occasional gusts of smoke, tropical scenes, but with booze!
As to be expected, it was pretty packed for a Friday night after work but we were able to make our way to the bar to grab some drinks. I decided on the City of Refuge ($14) and my bf went for the Hemmingway is Dead ($12). Be patient, the drinks do take a bit longer than most places, but they are quite the masterpiece when you go get them, adorned with little umbrellas, perfectly cut lime wheels, beautiful flowers, etc. The drinks were great, super boozy but nicely balanced and not over sweet with fake ingredients like a lot of tiki bars have. You can tell the citrus ingredients are freshly squeezed and the spirits are top notch. I am not a huge fan of the slushy style drinks (hemmingway) as they tend to separate and become a watery mess when you're sipping on them so I do wish the menu would somehow note how your drink is being served, but that is just a personal preference for me. The drinks are on the higher side for other places in the area so I don't know how much I will frequent this spot, but a great place to check out one time and being out of town friends to experience.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
When my buddy told me we were going to a place called Pagan Idol, I seriously thought we were heading to a goth bar or joining a cult.... But dang was I surprised of how cool this place was. 

Me and my friends were vacationing in town and just looking for a nice place to relax and talk. After visiting a few places (local edition and Hawthorne) this was our favorite by far. The first couple were a little too loud for our taste (we're old...). Place was huge and there was plenty of space on a Friday night. The bottom section of the bar was actually pretty empty while the top was about half full. You could easily get a table to sit and it the perfect noise level to actually have a conversation. I was on my phone one time during the night when the walls started to thunder - I embarrassingly dropped my phone and got a slap in the face to be in the moment. 

If you ever been to Trader Sam's in Downtown Disneyland, you'll love this place! It's basically a bigger version with cheaper drinks. Staff was all very friendly and drinks were great!
author: Phillip L.

description:
LOVE the MUSIC!!!!!!! Tiki bar lounge beat with cool lights and ambiance everywhere. There is tons of space in the back and the bartenders are in Hawaiian shirts. Very spacious and chill with fruity drinks and lots of areas to sit or stand . You can reserve the "Volcano" area or booths , really cute set up and nice place to chill and on wind . NO FOOD is the only bummer ... Suggestion box (egg rolls only?). I drink more...

Awesome place ... Check it out , I like the back
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Take all the cocktail craft skills of Bourbon & Branch, Local Edtion, etc. and then apply it to a tiki bar, and you get Pagan Idol.  As with the aforementioned bars, there is a lot of attention paid to detail here to give you a true Tiki Bar experience. From the Tiki statues to the palm leave decor and staff decked out in tropical attire, you feel like you are lost somewhere in the pacific ocean on a starry night.  And yes, there are stars, and they shimmer!

As for the drinks, they are quite the treat.  Once in a while I will trade in my bourbon or irish whiskey for a nice strong fruity drink!  Banana Life was my favorite!!!

There is a bar out front and one in the back.  The back tends to get a little more crowded.
author: Veasna H.

description: I've never been so compelled to leave a 5 star review before. Friendly staff, strong drinks, exotica music, and the back room was an unbelievably special surprise. I could live here. Perfection.
author: Sharie M.

description:
Pagan Idol is really impressive! I love a great cocktail bar and Pagan kicks it up a notch with it's Tiki theme and super fun surroundings!

We wanted to explore and took our time to walk around Pagan- as we walked in we noticed the light colored staircase with stones, the faux star-lit ceilings, and the smoke-filled corners.

Suany and I ordered a drink each- The Tiki drinks ($10-$14/each, with most being $12) were on the sweeter side for my taste buds, but what Tiki drink isn't?

While we were sipping on our drinks, a "thunder storm" happened and made us jump off our seats a bit.. it was quite entertaining! Evidently this happens every 15 or 30 minutes or so. It will really catch you off guard the first time, ha ha.

Overall - Pagan's a fabulous spot for fun drinks in a really unique environment!
author: Veronica S.

description:
The best new bar of 2016 I'd say! Definitely a line after 4:30pm so get there asap or even take time off and leave early from work if you have to-- because the incredible tropical concoctions will make your nite worth it!
Drinks are great for sharing, esp if you aren't used to a stiff drink. Love them for that!
author: Veranna N.

description: Pagan idol is so cool. For an extra $4 you can order your drink in a coconut, which DUH, is awesome. You will love this place for the vibes, the decor, and the three, THREE bars for you to order at. Great place!
author: Glory F.

description:
Pagan Idol has the best-tasting cocktails in the city, period. 

I've been here several times and have never once had a bad one; only excellent ones no matter what I ordered. The level of craftsmanship that goes into creating each cocktail is impressive. 

Most of the cocktails are complex, yet the ingredients always just work well together and the attention to even the littlest details is always apparent. I also appreciate how consistent the drinks are from visit to visit. I've never once thought, "oh, XYZ was better the last time I was here." The bartenders are terrific; high energy, enthusiastic but always consummate professionals. It's fun to sit at the bar and watch them make the cocktails but you have to go early to score a seat at the bar.

My three favorite drinks are the Bird of Paradise (the passionfruit whipped cream on top is insanely good), the Witch Doctor (gorgeously nuanced like a really good chai thanks to the spices; alas, they no longer serve it in the voodoo mug; you have to purchase it as a souvenir) and the lime-based daiquiri (which is simpler than any of their other cocktails but executed perfectly -- the best I've ever had -- and a relative bargain as it's $2 less than most of the other cocktails on the menu).  

The space itself is exquisitely designed, a Disneyland for adults in the best possible way. There are so many things to look at...the Kraken chandelier, the digital portholes that make you feel like you're in the belly of a ship, the starry skies overhead, the skulls underneath the stairs, the tiki huts in the back, the faux volcano that erupts periodically, the fish tank with the cutest fish (I've never watched Finding Nemo, but I'm pretty sure you can find a live-version Nemo in the tank), etc., etc. It is simply the most visually arresting and aesthetically interesting bar I've ever been to. 

On the downside, it's so dark that it's practically impossible to take good photos of either the drinks or the space. Oh well. 

It's obvious a lot of thought went into the details and it makes for a very escapist experience. Going to Pagan Idol is like taking a vacation to a place that doesn't exist in real life but is rather an idealized amalgamation of tropical places you've never visited and will never will visit because they don't exist. But that's what Tiki is when it's at its best: an escapist fantasy. 

As a final note, I've also been to Smuggler's Cove a few times (which often gets compared to Pagan Idol). Their drinks are a bit less tasty in my opinion but more potent (Puka Punch!) and their menu is far more extensive (several pages long, in fact). Both spots are absolutely worthy visits, though I like Pagan Idol just a bit more. 

Go to Smuggler's Cove to get an education on Tiki history via their expansive menu and to explore traditional Tiki drinks that use more historical recipes; go to Pagan Idol to get modern (and better-tasting IMO) interpretations.
author: Maya B.

description:
Now this, is a tiki bar.

The place was busy on a Wednesday evening, but not too busy where we were able to grab some seats near one of the bars. We were in the front of the room and there's a back room with another bar. It was too crowded back there when we showed up, but they have a volcano that goes off about ever 30 minutes or so. I also enjoyed the music playing in the background. Some tropical, some modern. Some of the bartenders obviously really enjoy their jobs, which adds to the atmosphere of the place.

We had a couple of cocktails that were very delicious. They also have some of the bowls to share. All the cocktails are decently priced. It's definitely worth checking out! Just make sure you have your ID because they card at the door.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Cool place.  Kind of muggy inside when it was at 10% of capacity.  But cool decor and great rum drinks and variety with all freshly squeeze juices. And great bar staff. 
Every x minutes a thunder storm happens in the back room with starlight ceiling.  
The inside rear bar security guy is a bit rude.
author: David C.

description:
Situation
- Attempting to go to this bar before 7pm on a Saturday and the wait was 15 minutes
- My friend and I both ordered the Dawn Patrol

Pros
- Nice decor

Cons
- They create a line because it's "full" inside, even though I though it's mostly empty
- The Dawn Patrol was a very poor tasting drink (I left most of it behind, because it was gross)

Overall
- There are much better places to grab a tropical-type drink that will treat you better as a customer and provide you with a proper cocktail 
- I've gone once and I don't really care to go back if I don't need to
author: Dipesh G.

description:
TL;DR - What a fun tiki bar in fidi.

Yes, its tacky and gaudy and looks like a fraternity tiki party. BUT thats kind of the charm of it. I love all the lights and the sticky floors.

The drinks are all pretty legit and SUPER boozy. I like strong drinks and these totally caught me unaware because they were so pretty!

Although the atmosphere is fun and silly, expect to find everyone (ok not EVERYONE but a good majority) in proper fidi work attire. But don't we all need a little something something to take the edge off after work? Haha.

Happy drinking!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
The only place I've been too that may spray cologne on your beverage. (I'm Kidding) 
They do however, make some of the best Tiki drinks I have seen in San Francisco. They not only look good but smell appealing. The ambiance is nice and it almost feels like you're inside a Disneyland ride when you are inside. Think Pirates of the Carribean/Tiki Room/ Indiana Jones. Be careful with the drinks as well because they are potent. This place is nice not only because of its amiable staff and amazing drinks but because of the crowd it draws inside. Most people are an eclectic mix of hipsters and yuppies. (I know it is frowned upon to use those nouns but I had too)
author: David W.

description:
Remember The Enchanted Tiki room at Disneyland? With the singing birds and rain-forest sound effects and indoor pyrotechnics? that's what this place is like. Imagine that place with adult beverages. The moment you walk into this establishment you are transported into a secret heaven that may confuse people because....(Why is this In FIDI)? I feel like this place is going to get very very very Hard to get into, very shortly. You can rent out the Cabanas if you make a reservation, that's what I would suggest. This is from the same team that has bought to life "Bourbon and Branch" this place reminds me of "Trader Vic's" stylish younger brother.

It's about 1,900-square-foot space is divided into two separate areas. The entry way is more of a captain-pirate nautical "Captain's Quarters" Which looks smaller until you peak thru the sliver and in the back is a tropical island bar, It's like looking and rocking on a cruise ship.

The spooky sexy oasis is complete with large wooden tiki sculptures, private tiki huts, a romantic twinkling star-lit starbrite evening sky and even an erupting volcano water fixture. You almost feel like you are transported into another place where King kong and witch doctors
may come around the corner. The decor and ambiance is PERFECT!

There are two bars. I even think there is a side-bar making it, a 1/2 bar? Stool seating, Barrell seats, even those wooden wicker seats as well! The thoughts and elaborate planning on this place leaves me with Awe, I wanted to stare at everything.

This is what I had to drink: The Daywalker ($15) It's like a Zombie, I think the strongest drink there. Some Pineapple colada drink that reminded me of a Slurpee, but was great none the less. The witch doctor I had with strong Jamaician Rum, passion fruit and egg whites. ($12) It comes it a Pagan tiki statue(Note the word Pagan). I want to Try the Mai Tai float and some of the Scorpion bowls...I'd probably just order one and drink a whole bowl to myself. I've done it before.   

All I can say is this...Smugglers cove eat your heart out! You got some competition. :)
author: Michael R.

description:
I can never pass up an opportunity to go to a Tiki Bar, let alone one that was opened by the brains of Bourbon and Branch. The set up is fantastic, basically a more elevated version of Smuggler's Cove and in a more accessible part of SF. The main vibe I got when I first entered was like I got transported to Adventureland in Disneyland (not in a tacky way, but more that you feel like you aren't in SF anymore).

+ DAWN PATROL: My go-to at any bar is to always go for a coffee-based cocktail. This drink has a mix of scotch, creme de cacao, coffee liqueur, lemon, and topped with a toasted marshmallow garnish (so if you want to see the bartender pull out a blow torch, get this drink!). The lemon gives the nice tropical taste to accentuate the more chocolatey and darker flavors.

+ BANANA LIFE: Probably my favorite drink of the night. It's simple, fruity, and very refreshing. Loved the garnish of salted plantain chips.

+ RUM MONKEY: Oh man, this tasted like a smooth, nutty shake! This was the only bowl that we got that night, but what drew me into it was the use of macadamia nut. The use of the nut, creme, and egg give the drink a nice creaminess that is cut by the citrus. Satiates three people, but u could go for 4 people to share :)

+
author: Patrick L.

description:
What an amusing tiki bar in the FiDi!

When you walk in, you're almost tempted to sing the Spongebob Squarepants theme song and/or pretend you're in Pirates of the Caribbean or something. No? Okay it's just me then...

Very spacious interior, and you are free to cozy up at the bar (there are two of them, if I recall), or grab a booth with your group to drink the night away. They really went all out in making this place as "tiki"-like as possible, including putting in the intermittent thunder sounds every 15 minutes or so. Really fun vibe! 

I ordered the Daywalker (Puerto Rican, Jamaican and overproof rum, orange, pineapple, lemon, grenadine, fassionola, bitters, absinthe, $15), and for all the fruit it contains, it actually tasted quite strong (for my tastes...I'm an occasional drinker). However, it was still quite delicious! If you're a fruity type of drinker, try their mai tais. They were quite alright also. 

I'd absolutely come back here!
author: Viet N.

description: Cool atmosphere! Drinks are very strong. Definitely recommend stopping in for 1 or 2 if youre in the area.
author: Mark C.

description:
Came here last Wednesday (2/24) with some friends and the place was packed! Granted it had just opened so we were expecting that to be the case. The front part of the bar opens at 5 and the larger back area opens at 7, so if you're coming with a large group, I'd recommend waiting until 7+.

Ok, on to the review itself. The interior space is insane! If you were a fan of the Tiki Room @ Disneyland, or the Pirates of the Caribbean movies then you will LOVE this place. Pay attention to the skulls in the stairwell leading to the back part of the bar. It's radical. 

The cocktails take a bit of time, so be patient with your order. Did I mention that every drink has rum in it?! I'm generally not a rum drinker but, was very impressed with the three drinks that were ordered in our group. 

All in all, this place is a great option for happy hour or private parties in the back area. It's low lit, the drinks are strong, and come on...it's a tiki bar!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Here on "soft opening" night. Future Bars doesn't play games with openings or run any obvious publicity, they just tell their thousands of Facebook friends and Twitter followers, oh, we're opening a new bar tonight, here it is. 

This one is a very thoughtful homage to tiki culture, going back to the roots somehow as an exotic, atmospheric, classy place that serves the best made drinks with the best ingredients from expert bartenders -- think Trader Vic's or Duke's when they were new and fresh, rather than some campy ironic dive bar. As an example they make fresh pineapple juice in house every day, as far as anybody knows the only bar in town doing so. When they run out, they run out. Drinks are stuffed with a fistwad of fresh mint - and decent bourbon cherries. 

The decor is something special, fascinating, with stained glass, aquariums, fountains, video screens, tropical plants, lots of dark wood. It's as if Walt Disney were alive today, yet more tasteful. 

My only concern / doubt is whether this will always be a special occasion date-family night indulgence, or whether it will become a regular haunt of the financial district workers next door.
author: Gil S.

description:
Place has such a cool vibe and plenty of space to sit down and enjoy a drink and company. 

Your options are of course fruity cocktails, but you can't go to a TIKI bar and not expect that!
author: Kayla B.

description:
I loved the space, the staff, the drinks, the mood... 
whoever worked security at the door on 2/23 opening hours- you were a sunshine! Thank you for setting the mood. 
No TV s in this establishment :) that was a nice break from crowded noisy night of Warrior game throughout the city. 
The bar staff were friendly and creative with cocktails. 
We were hungry so We were looking for  anything to chew at the bar. Banana chips were a nice welcome addition to the cocktail. I don't know if no food policy is forever and ever but if they do add appetizers or finger food later , I will be the happiest tiki fan :)
Overall, thank you !
author: Elena S.

description:
This place is pretty cool, maybe not super because tiki bars are interesting to weird. I believe the owners of the rickhouse around the corner opened this up just a few weeks ago.

It has a pretend line outside, don't be phased you wait for a quick minute. The inside decor is really tiki-ish vibe and very cool. You feel like you're getting ready to ride splash mountain or pirates of the Caribbean (sans Johnny depp). The drinks are Pina colada and all that type of variety. 

Fun place to go with a group of friends. Just wish they had good music playing, maybe they didn't since was Tuesday happy hour?
author: Mahsa T.

description: I definitely prefer this tiki bar over others in the city, there's more space and it's less Pirates of the Carribean set and more of a classic Disney movie feel. This mostly has to do with the theme music playing with bird calls and lighting. The bartenders are very friendly and helpful when it comes to suggesting drinks. They have plenty of cocktails to choose from, I ended up going with Flex on the beach. It was pretty sweet but I also tried the jungle drink and that was good if you're a fan of pineapples. There's plenty of seating in the front and back which is good for groups. I now see why tiki bars are popular
author: Trisha S.

description:
Came here with a few friends after work last week when we heard about the opening. We came around 5pm and to be honest my first impression wasn't great - it was very stuffy and hot inside and the line at the bar didn't seem like it was moving but the bouncer told us to come back around 7pm when the back part of the bar opened.

So glad we decided to come back! Once they opened the back part of the restaurant, it was like a whole new world. So much room for activities! 

Very cool vibes, all tropical rum drinks, has a pirate-y feel. All the drinks are well made, strong and delicious. Takes a little while to make the drinks though, but well worth the wait!

Will definitely be back.
author: Ilana B.

description:
I have been here twice and was not impressed both times! The place gets hot and muggy in the back. However, I did enjoy the starry night sky decoration...

The last time I was here, I was charged $30 for 2 shots of Jameson (seriously!?!) and this was not including the tip! 

I've also tried their signature drinks. They were sugary and weak. I guess tiki drinks are just not my kind of drinks. 

This place doesn't excite me and if friends were to go here, I will probably skip and go somewhere else.
author: Alice L.

description:
Hands down this is THE coolest tiki bar in SF. It's only been open for 2 weeks and there's already lines forming at 7?! Ain't no joke. But it seriously is themed out, even if you're not going to drink, it's worth walking in to. Pictures will not do it justice. Trust me.  100 plus points that their drinks are both delicious and strong as well, high quality stuff and not overly sweet. Beautiful, beautiful place, highly recommend! (Did I mention there was rock candy in my drink and a fresh flower in my friends? SRSLYYY)

$11-15 cocktails and 25+ for bowls. Come early and grab a seat for your companions cause it's crowded up in hea.
author: Emily C.

description:
I made a reservation for a tiki hut with my 3 friends and the staff was very accommodating and helpful in getting us settled in. The place was packed even on a Wednesday night so reserving a hut for a group of 4-6 is recommended.

At the same time it was very easy for us to get a drink quickly since they had two bars open. And don't be deceived by their tiki drinks - the bartenders are pros and the drinks are just not just sugar bombs. Our favorite was the pineapple express - would definitely recommend!
author: Tani Y.

description: Omg Pagan Idol is a glorious tiki heaven. The decor is on point. I'm so sad I didn't discover this place until I was moving out of the bay area, but I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit and hope I can return soon. I tried two different drinks and they were both delightful. I'm not sure how often there is a live band, but they were smashing it while I was there.
author: Jamie T.

description:
You probably wouldn't think that San Francisco needed another tiki bar, but if anyone has to do it, it might as well be Future Bars! (The minds behind Bourbon & Branch, Wilson & Wilson, The Devil's Acre, Local Edition, Rickhouse, Cask, etc.)

Adjacent to Rickhouse, Pagan Idol fills a tiki bar void between The Tonga Room and Smuggler's Cove much closer to the Financial District for after-work rum drinks!

Great drinks all around - we loved the Banana Life and the Pineapple Express!
author: Max E.

description:
This place isn't exactly hurting for reviews because it's pretty dang awesome. It's rather large and they limit their clever take on tiki drinks to a 16 drink spread which means getting a bevvie here is much faster process than other similar bars (sorry, Smuggler's Cove). I adored the Mai Tai Float and Pineapple Express and the Witch Doctor was weird but delicious (I think it comes with a hex, so maybe that's the unique taste we experienced). The portholes with the fish and the faux rainstorms are key and the decor is on-point.

Bartenders were pleasant and doing an amazing job with the crazy huge crowd and multi-ingredient concoctions. Despite the line out the door they do a decent job of keeping it not-too-crowded, so folks can make their way to the bar or find a place to stand/lean.

Once the line dies down I'd probably up this to 5 stars (or perhaps when I'm able to score a table ahead of time). Otherwise, I found this place not-so-handicapped friendly as I had to stand on one leg in line for a bit (you have to wait for enough people to leave before you can get inside). Then once we were in, chairs were pretty hard to come by. However, it did give me to time to appreciate the skill of the bouncer who was both friendly and efficient as he checked the IDs of the folks who were next in.

A very welcome addition to the Fi-Di I hope will be around for a while.
author: Nikki M.

description: Man, I can't give this place enough praise. Very knowledgeable bartenders. I wanted a rum similar to cuban Havana Club 7...the bartender knew of a rum they had made by an old ex-master distiller of Havana Club. Just so happened he defected a while back and started making rum in Panama. Atmosphere in the place is great for a tiki bar. More than that, they've really nailed it with their cocktails. Anything with that passion fruit powder dust on top is pure gold. For me, this is THE tiki bar to go to not only in the Fidi, but in SF itself.
author: Daniel F.

description:
tl;dr crowded from post-work fidi workers and service slow, but decorated awesomely and drinks are good + FUN!

When I went:
Went on a Friday at 7pm and the place was croooooowded. The place started clearing out around 9, so probably literally any other time than when we went should be fine!

Decor:
The place is deceptively long. There's a front section when you first enter that's kind of narrow but has a bar. Near the window you can seat a dozen people on a long couch with tables. There's a bar with bar seating and stools along the wall. When we went there were only 2 very overworked looking bartenders at this bar. The back room has a few awesome booths in almost separate rooms (get those!), a few wooden stools but overall not much seating. There's a bar back there too. There's also a small intimate seating room.

The quirkiness of the place and decor made me like it immediately. From the awesome lit-up peacock mosaic over one of the bars to the giant chair to the ship viewing hole simulating the ocean and fish swimming outside to the tiki huts that have booths, Pagan Idol did an awesome job of making a bar environment I could spend awhile in. (Check out Eater for actual pics: http://sf.eater.com/2016/2/26/11120992/pagan-idol-tiki-photos-san-francisco#6348395)

Service:
- Each beautifully crafted drink also took quite a long time, so the wait to order and then get the drink was a very, shall we say, solid one.

Drinks:
+ But the drinks were all so pretty. I got an orchid flower in mine.
+ The selection is decent for a tiki bar and reasonably priced for SF cocktails. Also, they have several group drink options - punch bowls where the bowls look pretty cool
+ Drinks were tasty. A good chunk of them were very sweet as you can imagine goes with the theme, but still tasted good.
- The bowls are smaller than you might hope for...
author: Andrea F.

description: This place is great for its ambiance. Very very well decorated, however their drinks are very weak. A glass full of crushed/blended ice with 1 shot for $15... On the plus side, the bartender was nice. The presentation of the drinks is done well with care, but the price is definitely not worth the drink. You get more alcohol in your drink in Vegas (or anywhere else for that matter) for the same price. Come here if you have already had a lot to drink or don't want to drink much. The place is new and everyone in the city wants to check it out so you may experience a wait before entering. On a Friday night it took about 10 minutes for our group to get in. If you want to get seats for your group go earlier in the night as it gets very packed later in the night and you'll definitely end up standing somewhere. Overall well decorated but wouldn't really come here for drinks again.
author: Saachi G.

description:
I do like myself the occasional tiki bar... Pagan Idol is very cool. Will definitely be stopping by once in while again. 

It's kind of like a bigger, more refined Smuggler's Cove. But with a less extensive cocktail menu. But overall, the same ish. 

All the drinks have great presentation. I recommend the Witch Doctor - really great!  I don't like drinks that are super sweet, so this was perfect for me. 

The Dawn Patrol is interesting: creamy with a slight citrus kick, almost chocolate-y, very sweet, topped with a marshmallow. Get your friend to order it so you can eat their marshmallow. Drink itself is too sweet for me personally. 

If you're ordering the Hemingway is Dead just for the skull glass, don't bother. People have managed to steal all of the skull cups in the first few opening weeks. SHAME ON YOU PEOPLE. 

There's a cool souvenir shot glass that you can buy if you want. It looks like a penis if you turn it upside down.

The lines get long past 10pm. It's great if you're inside already though because it helps not let the place get packed. Would have completely ruined the ambiance.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Decor is FABULOUS and tiki decadent with their high budget everything. It's gorgeous. They got the music down,; you feel transported to another land so no complaints on that. 

However, drinks are a bit small for the price and not as tasty as Forbidden Island or Smuggler's Cove and the crowd is all downtown SF financial district office types unless you go after 9 or on a weekend when they aren't around to hog every seat and fill the place with their banal chatter.

Easy to get to from BART.
author: Sally M.

description:
Pagan Idol is a decent enough tiki bar in downtown San Francisco. We arrived at 6 PM and the place was already mobbed with millennials. More on that later. 

The drinks were fair to good. We started off with the Jamaican Scorpion Bowl for two ($25). It was presented in a surprisingly small tiki bowl with a gardenia and fresh nutmeg on top. A little bit bigger than a normal drink. We were warned to bring the bowl back to the bar when we were done, otherwise we would be charged $75. :( It was good, but it was really sweet and lacking in rum. Isn't that what you come to a tiki bar for anyway? I'd give it a 4/10. 

Next, my wife had a Daywalker ($15) and I had a Witch Doctor ($12). The Daywalker was quite good and boozy. It was served in a tall glass with fresh mint and crushed ice. Not too sweet, and the over proof rum, absinthe, and bitters combined to give it a spicy note. The bartender said that drink had as much alcohol as the scorpion bowl. The Witch Doctor was a well-balanced drink. The egg white gave it some definite mouth feel that was quite interesting. It was served in a green Witch Doctor mug and also served with fresh mint. The Daywalker was 9/10 and the Witch Doctor was 8/10. These drinks were more on a par with Smuggler's Cove.

The bar itself is full-on tiki with the usual adornments plus some really nice ones. The two large tiki carvings are spectacular and I love the kraken lighting in the front bar. The back bar was very dark, but had a cool starlit ceiling. Definitely needs better ventilation with crowds this size. Nice exotica music playing overhead. There were probably seven busy bartenders amongst three different bars. The bars were all about 5 people deep. We used the single bartender in the very back corner. Nice guy who seemed to really enjoy his job.

The bar itself was really crowded, warm due to the crowd, and quite sticky due to all the millennial's spelling their sweet drinks. Here's a tip: When you're done ordering your drink move away from the bar to drink it. Others would like to order their drinks, too. Here's another tip: Don't wear a backpack in a crowded bar. I saw five different people wearing backpacks who would pivot around and cause people to spill or drop their drinks. Have some common sense. The guy at the front door checking IDs should tell people to remove their backpacks when it's crowded.

Overall our experience was ok, but not great. Most of that was due to the crowd and their seemingly oblivion to others, but hey, isn't that what being a millennial is all about? It will be interesting to see how this bar does after the newness and crowds die down. I'll be back when it does.
author: Jeff G.

description:
The creates of Bourbon and Branch strike again! 

No wait on a weekday night; large list of cocktails with some non-rum alternatives for those inclined. Pretty tasty though might be too gimmicky for a regular spot when it ends up on tourist lists. 

They definitely took the theme to heart with dark wood interior finishing and tiki/boat related decor. Very thorough.
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Entering Pagan Idol is like going to an adult Disneyland! Great customer service: the staff seem to love their job, which excites the customers(especially lighting those drinks on fire). I love coming when DJ Tanoa is entertaining us with his smoldering good looks and sultry music. The drinks are always picture perfect, but the alcohol could be a little stronger! 
The only critique I could make is that the most boring financial district dolts are always there. We need cooler people for such a cool hang out!
author: Krystal S.

description: We were in town early for our dinner reservations and had a couple hours to kill and a friend had recommended this place to us so we thought we would check it out. We walked in and it was packed but luckily 2 minutes later they opened up the back bar (which is awesome). Smog machine, tiki chants, and let me tell you the most amazing tiki inspired drinks. My gf and I were VERY pleased. Will return!
author: Zachary T.

description:
The drinks here are artisan crafted. They were so good looking I felt like I was disturbing it to drink it. The decor is like being in a sunken pirate ship, complete with port holes on the walls with digital fish swimming by. 
It was a bit crowded but that's what I'd expect at a popular place. The only complaint is that one of the bar tenders clearly acknowledged us but then went on to take orders from people that came in 5 minutes after we'd been waiting to have our orders take.
author: Vanessa A.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place. The decor, the drinks, the garnishes, every freakin thing here is AH-MAY-ZING. You feel completely transformed into a tropical paradise even though you're in the middle of downtown and it is just incredible. The drinks look like they have a whole island inside ^_^ and are expertly crafted! 

If you don't think you're a 'tiki bar' person, come to Pagan Idol and find that changed. The original drinks are made with all fresh juices and ingredients in the classic tiki tradition (before all the cloying artificial stuff came around in the 70s/80s) and are delicious!! The place is owned and created by the same guys behind Bourbon&Branch, Tradition, Rickhouse, Local Edition, and the like, so if you're into those, you won't be disappointed by this place

I LOVE the Bird of Paradise but really you can't go wrong with any of their drinks. For a little extra ($40 with drink), you can take home their amazingly gorgeous tiki mug with the Sparkle&Froth (which is also delicious!)
author: Faith X.

description:
This place was so badly needed! Great decor, great drinks, and friendly, efficient staff. Even the owner was going around making sure things were flowing. He was also very gracious and friendly. 
My only wish is they add some addition seating arrangements. 
Okole Maluna
author: Heather R.

description: One of the best tiki bar in San Francisco.. Highly recommend to try at least once.. I went with a group of friends and we all had a great time!!
author: Gayatri G.

description: If you're dreaming of sandy beaches, sunny days and mermaids, grab a drink at Pagan Idol. My drink came with an orchid, colorful straw and whipped cream - yum! The punch bowls looked delicious, too. Make sure not to stop at the first section of the bar, and walk back to the luau area. It's a unique place, from its fish tank to the glass blown octopus tentacles coming from the light fixtures. I only gave it four stars, because the drinks were all so sugary, giving me a slight headache the next day (whoops).
author: Lauren G.

description: Holy fuck I loved this place.  The drinks were amazing, the staff was cool as shit, and the atmosphere was really cool.
author: Daniel S.

description: The best tiki bar I have ever been too. The drinks are strong. I had planter's punch which was pretty good and not too fruity. Tuesday's they sometimes have nice Hawaiian band. They got really nice decoration inside. It's fairly huge place and they have small huts for group of 4-6. Really a very cool place to hang out with friends.
author: Ash M.

description:
My favorite new bar in SF! I felt like I was transported to Mauai in this cool little niche bar. And to think we were in the heart of SF's Financial's District...

I got the "Hemingway is Dead" and was not disappointed. Silver rum, lime, grapefruit, maraschino cherries and a little pink umbrella. This was definitely my jam! The drinks are fantastic and I love the bartenders' attention to detail. 

To add, it was so nice to be able to sit down and hang out. Next time I'm renting a tiki hut!
author: Nicole W.

description: Drinks weren't your typical 'tropical cocktails.' Weird flavors. Staff was friendly. Not going back unfortunately.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Love love loved everything about it, the place, the decorations, the cocktails! Go there if you're in SF!
author: Meital P.

description: Came here again precisely a year after they opened.  After 11pm, things empty out and it's a much more enjoyable experience!
author: Chris S.

description:
Cool spot for HH after work.  It's a bit crowded but for HH, but that's part of the deal.

Great service, great drinks and it reminds me of Smuggler's Cove but a lot bigger and maybe an EEENNSSY WEEENSY bit inexpensive.

Definitely a spot I'd recommend folks to go to.
author: Cliff S.

description:
Usually i cringe when someone want to go to a bar in the FiDi but I just HAD to check this place out. I agree with the other reviewers and here are some things of note: 

1) back bar opens at 5pm
2) best to get here as early as you can- place fills up
3) Felt like they could use a few more bartenders or maybe a non- tiki drink station. Buddy had to wait quite a while for his beer
4) be warned of the loud financial dorks who will yell across the bar to each other and spill their drinks on you

Loved my Bird of Paradise! I never would have put all those things in one glass but it works. The atmosphere of the bar is great- they've definitely dropped some cash into making this place beautiful. Sadly, no erupting volcano when we were there :(. 

I'm glad I came here but I think with the crowd, wait for drinks, price of drinks, and snobby clientele this place just aint for me.
author: Alyssa J.

description: Um this is not a tiki bar but a hipster bar. They don't have Kahlua nor a substitute for kahlua but they try to make drinks that are supposed to have it and they fail. The drinks are gross and taste like watered down pina coladas. The fish tank is cool that's why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1.
author: Christian R.

description: An absolute must go to! The vibe, THE DRINKS, and the service is beyond amazing!! My husband and I went for the first time on Friday night and we were not disappointed we will definitely be coming back.
author: Daniela A.

description: Really friendly bartending staff and overall a fun time in an ultra-kitschy, bubbly space. Drinks are solid and about as overpriced as you'd expect, but the fact of the matter remains that this is a cool spot to hang out with a medium-sized group of friends after your daily endeavors in the Financial District/Union Square area. Hoping they can have more special events and reasons to go back more than once for the novelty of it.
author: Andy L.

description: A surprisingly cool bar that you would never guess from the outside. Come right before 5 and grab a drink before the back opens up (at 5) so you can score a good seat in their crazy jungle room!! Pretty normal tiki bar drinks and but bit expensive and a little touristy for me to ever be a regular. But good for a couple drinks just for the atmosphere.
author: Alan E.

description: I love coming here whenever I'm in San Francisco. You walk in the door and it's like waking into a scene from Spongebob Squarepants (I mean that in a good way!!). The atmosphere is that awesome Tiki kitsch that screams delicious fruity drinks and chill music. The drink menu has some delicious selections all made by hand by bartenders with an awesome attitude and totally relaxed vibe. Every time I've come in I've tried different drinks and never had a bad one! I'll continue coming every time we're in town!
author: Justin G.

description: Hawaiian and Tiki Bars have been my favorites lately. We went there with a couple of friends on a Saturday night. The Ambience is really very piratey and cool!! It is a huge bar so initially we stood for 10 min and then found a place to sit. All their cocktails are great with an awesome blend of rums, but wait- they are strong too!! The experience of sharing those bowls with a group of friends and also use long straws to reach through was very thrilling! One can easily spend more than 2 hours there. Perfect for catching up with friends and having a memorable Saturday night!
author: Foram C.

description:
If you don't love tiki bars you have no soul. Yes that's an exaggeration but whatever because Pagan Idol is excellent fun. The ship side is smaller and whimsically nautical. There's also a fish tank. The back room or the island is rad. There's a second bar, cabanas, a starry night sky, tiki idols and a volcano! This is the thing that gives the Tonga Room a run for the money. Actually the cocktails are what give the formerly noted bar or any tiki bar a run for their money as everything I tasted was damn good, I mean daaaaamn good.
The place fills up quick and I've even noticed s line to get in closer to Friday. 
Rumtacular!
author: Tommy W.

description:
I am a San Francisco native who moved to Sacramento 15 years ago. I have family and friends in the City and my wife and I visit regularly.  Last week while celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary week (yes, a whole week because after 25 years, that's how we roll) my sister recommended Pagan Idol as one of our stop overs.  She mentioned they had a large room in the back with another full bar that opened later in the evening. We dropped in on Thursday around 5pm, it was pretty full.  We decided to go across the street to get a bite to eat and returned around 6:30.  They had opened the back area & we were able to find two seats at the front bar.  We started with one of my favorite Tiki cocktails of all time, Mai Tai's; a perfect blend of rums and essence of almonds and oranges. By the end of the our 1st drink we started to notice the fish swimming by the port holes (nice touch), it felt and looked like we were in the bottom of a wooden ship. This is a really nice Tiki Bar; they respect the culture and the cocktail. 

Time for round 2.  We asked mixologist extraordinaire Nick to create a concoction to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. He whipped up a double Bird of Paradise that was spectacular. A nice blend of tart from the fruit juices and sweet from the cream and it packed a punch from the rum. 

For my 3rd drink I went back to the Mai Tai (so damn good) and my wife ordered a Saturn, a rare gin-based Tiki drink which in her words "made me orbit". I could taste lemon, passion fruit, oranges, almonds, ginger, cloves and vanilla.  I didn't taste the gin, which I like all on it's own. It was a creeper and I had to finish it for her :) She said that walking back to the hotel (7 blocks) was going to be out of the question so we Uber'd it back.

Pagan Idol is bustling with locals & tourists alike, hipsters & business people & old married folks like us. Wait, we're only 50, who am I calling old?! They have one of the most talented teams of mixologist's I have ever seen. They work fluidly (no pun intended) together. Someone is shaking something up, someone else is getting ready to finish up that creation with some fresh fruit or a pineapple frond to use as a spoon.  Each one of them is a Rock Star in their own right but it's really nice to see the teamwork and camaraderie.  Pagan Idol went to Hawaii to recruit Nick, what does that say about the rest of the stellar team? 

We look forward to our next adventure.
author: Rudy N.

description:
Do not come here. They kicked out our party of 10 due to the fact we were ordering drinks. Really rude service. Empty as well. Not sure why they didn't want free money when were ready to order. 

Please don't come here. Manager was rude and bartender was rude. Again, save your money and go next door.
author: Sid N.

description:
From Tiki ti in los angeles to traders Vick to the iconic tongo room. Pagan Idol could be our generation coolest hip tiki archetype!

As you approach the entrance you'll immediately be transformed by the bouncer who is dressed very Polynesian like. As you enter, you'll be impressed by its ambiance and Moody lighting that sets for a great vibe. There are multiple seating areas and two bars (one in the front and back room) However, it's quite busy and would suggest getting there early just to snag a table or bar seats.

I ordered the witch doctor and was thoroughly impresses by the mixologist and his passion to make sure that each drink is created and designed well. Almost like an art form. The bartenders are super nice and make great conversationalist. 

I would give this place 5 stars but because if the mouse level, sticky floors, minimal seating areas, and lack of an outdoor environment...4 stars.
author: Zoey W.

description: This place is so fun I love the theme! The drink are very good! The bartender were all very nice! I recommend every drink. Great for drinks with a group, or just a friend.
author: Cory T.

description:
Looking for a tropical get-away in the heart of downtown San Francisco? Pagan Idol is your place. Pagan Ideal boasts an authentic menu and atmosphere making you feel as if you've found yourself on-board a tropical cruise. 

The drinks are creative, and fun to sip on. Take a look through their treasure-map style menu, choose whatever your heart desires and, of course, don't forget to Instagram it as the drinks are beautiful! Drinks are priced around $12- $15, not exactly cheap, but you are paying for the entire experience. Also, the majority of the drinks are blended, made with lots of ice, and not exactly strong alcohol-wise. 

Monday to Friday, after 5PM, is when Pagan Idol typically gets busy, as the FiDi workforce comes out for an after work drink. If you are making plans to go there, be sure to get there quickly, because there will be a line up.
author: Aletta B.

description: Check this out: small after-work team outing to celebrate some great wins! But the bouncer only lets some of the team in. What the...? The rest have to wait in line. Guess we all go somewhere else if they don't want our business. Way to go Pagan Idol.
author: J S.

description: Hipster Tiki bar. Crowded and fun. A nice place for 1 drink. Very loud so you gotta shout!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Solid Tiki action, and even the pretend line outside didn't last very long. We came right after work and waited about five minutes before being let in. Place isn't that crowded at all and the two bars keep the drink lines from being awful.

Chihuly tentacle glass in ships for lighting all along the ship hull as ceiling, and the little tables are perfect for standing around with your drinks.

Most drinks are priced at $12, and then there are the big shared drinks for $25+. 

We got the Mai Tai Float, the Witch Doctor, and the Dawn Patrol. All were tasty, but the Dawn Patrol may be a little odd for some (creamy blast and then a kick of lemon).
author: Kevin L.

description: Delicious drinks with an awesome atmosphere. Perfect place for a fun night out. Drinks were average price for any SF bar around $13-17, but they were definitely boozey and packed a punch. I will definitely be back here :)
author: brianna t.

description: Good environment, the lounge is very spacious. The drinks was great . The only problem was parking, so if you go it's better if you don't drive.
author: Christine P.

description: Really cool tiki bar serving interesting & delicious drinks in a amazing space. Definitely a great place to come with groups. Theres a bar up front and another in the back. Better yet, the bartenders here seriously knows how to mix drinks. My only minor criticism, which I think is worth mentioning, would be with the paper straws that come with some of the drinks. They don't withstand time and liquids well, so if you are a sipper they tend to "melt"/become mush before you even have a chance to finish your drink.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This is a dope spot bomb drinks! Only thing is it's a little boring needs better music.
author: Ana P.

description: Classy tiki! Great drinks. Love reservations on the huts. And fun events. Skip Tonga Room come here!
author: Rebecca M.

description: First time at the Pagan Idol ! Great atmosphere, Great Drinks! We started at the Tonga Room but unfortunately  it was closed due to a private function so we walked down the steepest hill in S.F. and made it to the Pagan Idol. I started off with the Sparkle and Froth, great drink and I purchased the mug with it. My Wife had the Parrot something or other, It was slightly better than mine. Both drinks were made with fresh squeezed juices and fresh flowers and aloe leaves. The drinks were a little costly but they are works of art and very potent. Enjoyed the visit and will be returning every chance we get!
author: Robert S.

description: As far as tiki bars go, this is the real deal. The exotica music, played at a comfortably low volume, makes this bar experience really shine!
author: Gee W.

description: I finally had a chance to check out for a Friday HH! Drinks were tasty- particular if you're into the fruity tiki-esque cocktails.  The bartenders are super attentive and friendly and the overall vibe of the place was mellow but lively at the same time.  Would definitely go back the next time I'm craving a Tiki experience!
author: Gohar J.

description: I love this tiki bar, makes me feel like on in a tropical island. Drinks are strong, but taste good and artfully crafted. The staff is friendly, and it has a cool space. Make sure to stroll into the back area for more seating options, and another bar!
author: Thomas R.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night at 6:30 and was surprised at how crowded it was. It's definitely one of the few spots in that area that's open and fun to go to at night. Less than a five-minute walk from Montgomery Bart. I would't suggest coming with a large group unless you got here on the earlier side and "saved" spots. It takes a bit for the drinks to be made, but it's worth the wait. The drinks were good, strong, and decorated with mini umbrellas and flowers.
author: Shoshana G.

description:
Let me start out by saying, I really like this bar. Drinks are a little on the sweet side but overall a great and closer alternative to Smuggler's Cove.

HOWEVER, several of our friends had their credit card information stolen here. Multiple people in our party had thousands of dollars spent on their credit cards following the evening at Pagan. Coincidence, or shady business practices? Looks like several bartenders are trying to make a little extra on the side.

We called and left several messages to Pagan. Surprise surprise no one returned our phone calls. 

If you do go to Pagan use cash.... We mostly won't be coming here again. Such a shame as we all said it was our new favorite bar, until we realized what happened.
author: Jason T.

description:
Great atmosphere. Menu was amazing, as were the drinks.
Surprisingly a good amount of space on a Friday night.
author: Nitesh D.

description: Along the lines of the Tonga Room, but somewhat younger and douchier, this place made me feel like I was at a frat party in Wisconsin, i.e. With really nice people. The smoke machine in the back room is cool and over the top. The bartenders are accommodating. I love how they announce on the loudspeaker when they're free to make a drink.
author: Andrew K.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday and it was a pleasant surprise! I'm always down for hawaiian drinks, and these didn't disappoint! I drank the pina colada and it was delicious and totally transported me to a tropical island for the night. The decor is cool and I loved the starry night ceiling! Bartenders are fun and nice, I'll be back next time I need a "getaway" and good tropical cocktails!
author: Kelly F.

description:
I'm going to echo the review that was written below by Jason.

This was my first time at Pagan Idol and my group had a great time. For a weekday, the scene seems very lively and there was enough space towards the back to fit the crowds. Drinks were creative and had a fun Hawaiian twist to them. The central location to downtown made it a viable place to come back to for regular happy hours.

However, after last Thursday's incidents, I will not be returning. It's not a coincidence that two people in my group were scammed thousands of dollars at 2am following our night at Pagal Idol. Our phone calls were not picked up and there has been absolutely no contact since, despite leaving a voicemail.

In the case where your customers are getting SCAMMED at a bar I was previously getting exceptional customer service at and whose owner is associated with many well known bars around San Francisco (Bourbon & Branch, Local Edition, Rickhouse), I expected better. I'm extremely disappointed with the lack of action.
author: Sally C.

description:
This place is fantastic! Really nice bartenders - a wonderful array of cocktails. I enjoyed the Bird of Paradise: Cachaça, reposado tequila, lemon, vanilla, passionfruit whip, sea salt. So good - the passionfruit whip was AMAZING! (I should note - I love passionfruit!)

I was only there long enough to enjoy one cocktail. But I will definitely be back! My favorite tiki bar in the city!
author: Shannon H.

description:
What a cute tiki bar in FiDi! Came here on a Friday night around 10:30pm, place was pretty packed. They have a bunch of really fruity, creative, but strong drinks. Ranging from ~$12 - ~$28 for the Tiki bowls. 

Drinks: We got the Jamaican Scorpion Bowl and it was so tasty. It had a mix of an interesting banana/citrusy combination, it sounds weird, but it was so good! We finished the bowl between 2 and we were tempted to get a second. Honestly, all of the drinks looked amazing, I could get drunk very easily here.

Atmosphere: Dimly lit with really cool neon lights/Tiki themed decor. Has a larger back bar with a lot of standing room. Seats are limited in this bar, which sucks if you're here on a date. As far as the crowd it ranged from youngings like myself to an older late 30s crowd. I'll regret thinking that's old later on. But overall a pretty classy crowd, no one was overly obnoxious or drunk. But then again this bar is in FiDi so that makes sense. I think this bar just recently opened, so everything is shiny and brand new.

Def would recommend this spot if in the area! Get your Tiki on y'all.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
I love tiki bars but this place was like a poor man's Smuggler's Cove (and by no means am I a fan of Smuggler's Cove). They did just open so maybe they just need to iron out some things.

- For a $12-14 drink, is it too much to ask for large ice cubes or at least give us a choice? Crushed ice is for cheap drinks and it quickly melts and makes your drink all watery. It isn't like we're outdoors in the sun by the pool gulping down these drinks to stay refreshed.
- The City of Refuge was drowning in sugary red syrup and reminded me of the sugary drinks you find on Bourbon Street in Nola.
- I also tried the house daiquiri and it was okay but nothing special. I expected more from a bar coming from the Bourbon & Branch/Local Edition/Rickhouse family.
author: Alex P.

description:
Went here at 5:00 on a Tuesday and the place was jam packed. There is a bouncer, in a Hawaiian shirt of course, that tends the line waiting to get in.

This place is drinks only. It is like a Tiki bar on steroids but in a good way. I imagine with a good group that enjoys rum, it would be even more enjoyable.

I was amazed by the lcd potholes projecting an underwater life. It looked real!

I plan to come back with someone that can steer me towards the perfect rum drink, have a tropical attitude and just enjoy being in a different place. A nice change from the hipster/beard/bun/lumber look you see all over these days.
author: Marie D.

description:
The city has reached saturation on prohibition themed gin joints serving craft cocktails. But what the world needs now, is more Tiki bars. It was a pleasant surprise to see one opening up in downtown.

Typically to scratch the Monday-afterwork-overproof-rum itch I would have to cajole one or more co-workers into making the trek from downtown to Hayes Valley. It isn't always an easy sell, and often times was met with limited success. Fortunately now there is an alternate proposition!

The interior is very well done, definitely in the top 10% of Tiki themed bars. From the cartography themed restrooms, to the fish tanks behind the bar, to the volcano in the back that occasionally blows a plume of smoke, this place does a great job of setting the tropical mood. It is also fairly large inside, with tables in both the front and back, barstools on some of the edges, and a large standing area in the back.

Cocktails were also quite tasty. Favorite of the evening was the Maybe Grog. It was strong, but also delicious. Best of all it came with a stick of rock candy, which was a delightful addition I had never seen on a drink before. The garnish on the Mai Tai was also spectacular. As my good buddy described it, "You could fall in love with an orangutan in that!"
author: Michael S.

description: An awesome tiki bar that is a solid rival to the Tonga Room at the Fairmont Hotel. The Witch Doctor cocktail and Rum Runner are stupendously intoxicating. The after work scene is good, with revelers from Soma mixing with those from Union Square. The space has tons of voodoo and seafaring decor. Only downside is the long wait at the bar, as drinks take a long time to make.
author: Paula M.

description:
The line outside and the young crowd at the bar when I arrived felt sceney, so I was worried. I like quiet bars where I can chit chat deeply or maybe even spread out and write a little while I drink. 

But I also really love a well-executed theme, and this place really felt like the inside of a weird ship with its port-hole aquariums and Chihuli-esque octopus sconces. Once I got to the front of the drink line, an efficient bartender made me a creamy, luscious Pineapple Express, and I found a nice window seat in what felt like the fore galley. 

Could I write here I? I did write a little while at an adorable wooden table with a map of Tonga carved into it. Still, the place was a bit crowded and noisy for my taste. 

Until a big, bearded hipster kid rang a bell and shouted, "Land ho!" He swung open a mysterious door to a misty, island-feel back room. The crowd cleared, spreading out to enjoy much more space. 

In the back, the still-lively bar feels much more open and relaxed. There's room for a nice mix of vibes, from noisy parties to laid-back cabana-stye relaxation. I'm glad I gave this fancy, new little spot a chance. I'll be back.
author: Kristy L.

description: Atmosphere is equal parts tiki and "underwater nautical." Bar tenders are super nice, and knowledgeable about their ingredients. The drinks are tweaks on Tiki classics, and are presented immaculately - almost too pretty to drink - but it would be a shame not too because they are some of the best you'll have.
author: David G.

description: Incredible environment and the bartenders are sweet and patient and will explain any drink you have a question about, switch out one you don't like, or freestyle a drink genre you're in the mood for.
author: Stephen G.

description:
Happy to have yet another tiki bar to check out but Pagan Idol does have some work to do when it comes to cocktails.

The bar itself is beautiful....every corner looks amazing and the unique touches like the lava spewing volcano and octopus tentacle lights are really stellar. 

Seating is plentiful, the layout is roomy and you have multiple bars to chose from when ordering cocktails. 

Staff seems genuinely happy to be there and are extremely personable and attentive--well as attentive as one can be when you are trying to bust out many drinks for waiting customers. 


The drinks need work.  Out of the 5 I tried only 2 were really something I would drink again,  1 was not served to us full and 2 were  were complete busts and really unbalanced. I would blame it on it being Saturday night and pretty steadily busy but when you order the drink twice and it tastes the same both times its the recipe. 

Rum Monkey -- has zero flavor. It just tastes like ...well nothing really. For such an expensive bowl this drink should pack some punch. Not taste like the last sip from a punch bowl. We all didn't even want to finish it because it was so flavorless but when you spend a lot for just one drink well...you might as well.

Witch Doctor -- was well balanced and definitely the best out of the bunch.  Really thought the juice/rum combination had great flavor -- there just needs to be less ice. I drink tiki drinks often and expect crushed ice...just not an entire glass of it where I have to search for the cocktail. 

Bird of Paradise -- topped off with passionfruit whip cream this was pretty good also.  Great, tart  flavor...I could drink this again although to be honest I would do it for the whip cream. Besides the tartness I couldn't even tell you what was in it.   Ice to drink consistency was spot on.  

City of Refuge -- man this drink was way too heavy on lavender.  It was like drinking a sachet or potpourri .  I like lavender but it is such a powerful flavor when overused.  Note to you all..less is more...like a LOT less

Banana Life -- this drink was pretty tasty however we ordered one and it was pretty full , we ordered a second and it was 2/3 full.  Yea..don't do this. 

Because the bar is staffed by pros who definitely never looked freaked out by the size of the crowds waiting I would say the drink recipes need tweaking because these bartenders can handle the drinks they are making...in the case of the Rum Monkey a major overhaul.  
After Pagan Idol we went over to Longitude in Oakland and the 1 drink I had there was better than all 5 drinks I had at PI.  I am in no ways a cocktail snob but I like strong flavors...none of the 5 I tried were strong enough to say "Man I need to go back and get ______..that drink was killer!"

I realize the bar hasn't even been open a week yet so things always improve and overall they did a pretty great job for a Saturday night that seemed super steady. I want to reiterate how great the staff was. I never saw them do anything but smile and even when they were in the weeds unless you were paying attention they never showed it. THAT is pretty awesome. 

I know they plan on adding cocktail servers (SO SMART and NEEDED!) and reservations even down the road but in the meantime Label the bathrooms, print more menus (which I know they are already doing--paper menus tend to get soggy but at least don't cost a lot when they get stolen!), have the line marked off outside so people know in which direction to line up (so we don't anger your neighbors), and the staff needs to be identifiable...not uniforms per se but you could easily have printed shirts made like Trader Vic's does so we can tell who is working there and who is just drinking there. 

Overall a solid 5 stars for décor and 3 stars for the drinks.  I think they can greatly improve on their cocktails and hope they do.
