I would love to make Pagan Idol a regular stop on my cocktail route but for now I will take folks there to see the place and after we have hung for awhile take them elsewhere so they can try better, more memorable drinks.

It's a beautiful bar and when the drinks catch up to the interior the place is going to give other tiki bars a run for  their money.
author: Liz K.

description: this is a very interesting place. i work around the corner but never noticed it since it's pretty inconspicuous from the outside...but inside, they really went all out with the tiki theme -- lights, real fish, smoky volcano, etc. similar to smuggler's cove and the tonga room in the fairmont so if you like those, you'll be a fan here (and vice versa). pagan idol feels more spacious than the other two. it's big enough for groups, but does get a bit loud. i think the drinks are tastier than smuggler's cove, but less strong.
author: Connie Q.

description: Great bar! Super cool decor, security was amazing I gotten too drunk and they helped me get an uber and I really appreciate that. Overall had a great time and experience. Also they have a very cool fish tank
author: Shavonne M.

description: I love that this tiki bar brings more fun to the Financial District! The drinks are everything you'd want them to be when temporarily escaping to a tropical paradise and the bartenders are great at recommending what to pick based off of your preferences. I've gone a few times for happy hour and it's been pretty packed, but it looks like you can make reservations. I was surprised that it wasn't as busy when I went there on a weekend night, but I think this was atypical. Make sure to stick around for the fog bursts!
author: Stacy K.

description: Walking in you can immediately see the well themed interior. The vibe is warm and relaxing but inviting enough to appease all groups. The drinks are absolutely amazing, they have a good variety and the ones with egg truly are worth the visit on there own. Check out the Pagan! I would love to see more places like this
author: Haley C.

description: Great location to go with friends after work or to take anyone visiting SF. Nice selection of tropical cocktails and the overall atmosphere can be best described as a Disneyland bar. If you have a group of 4 or more, try to reserve one of their Tiki Booths.
author: Austin R.

description: Really fun environment, great drinks but what makes it was the bartender, Jeanie! She was beyond personable, talkative, made great drinks and just made the experience that much better for a first time goer in San Francisco. Highly recommend for a group and make sure you have Jeanie take care of you!
author: Shay K.

description:
Very, very good bar. A solid addition to the Bay Area Tiki scene.

First thoughts: a lot of wood, wicked lamps, solid drinks, and great bartenders.

First off, parking during a weekday is a bit cumbersome. Your best choice is probably the Sutter-Stockton garage. Super low rates for SF, and less than two blocks from Pagan Idol.

The outside is fairly nondescript, per the usual SF Tiki code. Walking in the first thing you notice is that the entire place is covered in handsome wood, ceiling to floor. In fact the feeling I got was that of entering an overturned shipwreck.

Grabbed a seat at the bar, which was a little difficult. Not because it was crowded, but because many of the stools are burdened with a bar-affixed lamp that  basically blocks the entire bar. Perhaps if they could make those a little taller it would open up more bar space.

Grabbed a menu, which is very similar to the one they have Forbidden Island in Alameda. They have some of the Tiki standards, supplemented with the bars own creations. I had the Maybe Grog and the Mai Tai Float. Both drinks were excellent.

I think the best part of the bar were the bartenders. They were available but also left you to your own devices. The perfect blend of checking in without being a nuisance. Drinks came out quickly and calmly.

I was a bit disappointed that Pagan Idol didn't have custom mugs or swizzle sticks available, but perhaps those will come along later. All in all a very enjoyable first experience. Just keep in mind that I came on a Wednesday around 5pm, so my review can't speak to what the feeling is like on a Saturday night.
author: Chris J.

description: Pretty cool bar. Nicely decorated inside and bigger than I expected! There are tables to the side for smaller groups so you can get some space/privacy to yourself. Because this lounge is in financial district, if you come here on a weekday, then you'll see a lot of people chillin here with their coworkers. Some drinks come in large cups and are super cold (because they're blended) so your hands or brain may freeze. Drinks aren't that strong (though large) and pretty tasty.
author: Annie S.

description: One and Done! The doorman was right. Good vibes. Friendly af bartenders and tasty beverages. I'll be back to bring some friends next time I am in SF.
author: S. L.

description:
Came out to scout this place out after a friend posted a news article about the grand opening the very night I just happened to be in SF. 

Pagan Idol is less than a 10 minute walk from the Montgomery St BART station so there is no need to drive. You don't want to drive after a couple of potent tiki drinks anyway. 

Stepping into Pagan Idol instantly transports you to some tropical isle with amazing attention to detail throughout. Drinks are on the pricey side at an average of $12 and up but with premium fresh ingredients and the amount of work put into each drink (not to mention SF rents) you can see why they price the drinks as such. 

Downsides come from average time it takes to make a drink so on a busy night, be prepared to wait a while. I lucked out by finding out about this place early before news spread amongst the FiDi crowd and snagged a spot at the bar while I messaged my friend who was in town on business to join me. 

I ended up having 3 drinks (or was it 4?}, all were delicious and left me feeling happy. I will be returning soon with friends and may partake in a volcano bowl or two to share with the group.
author: Craig F.

description:
The hype machine is working overtime on this one. Expected a lot from the folks that brought us Bourbon and Branch, but they didn't deliver. There's really only one thing to complain about, but it's the reason you come: the drinks. We had the Hemingway's Dead and the Port Royal. Awful. Actually awful. We couldn't finish them. They both tasted like children's cough syrup. Your $12 cocktail should be reminiscent of Dimetapp. 
The drinks have nothing on Smuggler's Cove.
author: Matt O.

description:
Fun atmosphere and not extremely crowded (went on a Friday evening/830pm), but I'm not sure why I had to wait over ~10 minutes in front of the bar to get a drink.

After the bartenders kept helping other people (the first bar area when you enter), I walked away. Maybe they were too busy or didn't see me? I'm not sure what happened but I was pretty disappointed.
author: Chris O.

description:
Cute little tiki bar in the FIDI district. The drinks look fun, as any normal tiki bars would have. I do like that they have two venues inside the bar that you can drink at. The second one, which is located more on the inside is so convenient because you can avoid the first bar that is crowded with people and get your drinks much faster in the second bar location. 

I usually go to smuggler cove for tiki bars but I'm more glad that the pagan idol is here cause its so much easier to get in and actually have a conversation with people cause you have the space to sit here!
author: Cavin T.

description:
I'm a huge fan of tiki theme bars, rum drinks and locations like Smuggler's Cove and the Tonga Room. So when I noticed this bar on a blog was opening in the Financial District I just had to check it out ...and apparently so did everyone else.

The staff here was outstanding. Their personalities were very positive, warm and even making jokes setting the perfect upbeat get away atmosphere you'd expect from a tiki bar.

We tried about half the drinks on menu. Most of them tasted very stiff with way too much ice that it felt more like a snow cone with not enough fruity flavors that are very common with tiki drinks. Generally people like myself who love rum drinks are wanting something flavorful and tasty. Something that tastes so good you'd slam it down, but it can deceive and creep up on you. Kind of like their version of the Zombie called The Daywalker -- hands down their best drink.

The bar itself was featured in a blog that stated its design was fashioned as a greatest hits of other popular tiki bars, but when I got inside parts of it felt lackluster and cheap while other decor looked great. A lot of the lighting didn't seem turned on and the volcano was off the entire time we were there. My partner and I took a closer look at it and it looked really cheaply designed. Then again it's pretty hard to top the production design of the Tonga Room which was designed by an MGM set designer.

The bar was really packed full of yuppie FiDi techies sharing their first-world problems about work. There were lines going out the front door for quite a bit. There were also lines at all the bars, so a friend had to hold a sitting spot while the other fetched drinks. To add an extra layer of annoyance, these girls dressed as "baby sluts" were cutting in front of this gay man thinking their drunken charm and smile would get them a pass -- only to hear them order a vodka tonic at a TIKI RUM DRINK BAR. Yeah no, it's called take your bridge and tunnel east bay lookin' asses to the back of the line like the rest of us boo-boo.

Overall it's great to have a tiki bar in this side of SF, but right now it's best to avoid it for a few months until the trendiness wears off and they shake out all the kinks with their drinks.
author: Terry C.

description: This is such a cool spot! The decor is perfect and makes you feel like you're on a boat/ tiki hut. The drinks are around $12 but they are SO GOOD. I normally get the Bird of Paradise. It does get packed and their isn't much seating, so get there early.
author: MacKenzie B.

description: this spot was wayyyy bigger than i had anticipated! the layout is kinda weird though. two bars - one in the front, one in the back.  there's bar seating and small tables in the front, and a few steps up, a pretty big standing area wiith seats against the wall, second bar, and an even larger area with stools + tables, and 2 tiki huts. menu is definitely tiki-themed, but not as extensive as three dots n a dash in chicago.  i got the mai tai slush, which was all right.. they tend to blend everything prior to serving, i noticed. they also had a pagan slush topped with hibiscus for $9. i would come back with a bigger group to try their large format cocktails..and maybe reserve a tiki hut!
author: Christina L.

description:
The bar tenders are great. Amazing drinks friendly service. The security guard inside the place is full of himself.

He was upset that I drank water from a bottle. It was to "low brow". It's a tiki bar for Peet's sake.

Front door dude is alright thought.
author: Nazario A.

description: Awesome drinks with awesome garnish. Great ambience as well. The bartenders are really relaxed and cool. Pay them a visit!
author: Andy N.

description:
5 stars for kitsch galore; 3 stars for the drinks

The interior reminds me of the tiki room in Disney. Where there are automatronic birds singing catchy jingles. There's fake stars on the ceiling and fake potted plants and huts with tree-stump like tables. It really speaks to whatever Asian part of me that also loves the neon lights and shiny skyscrapers of Shanghai and Hong Kong. Very much like the Tonga Room... except for lazy folks like me you don't have to scale Nob Hill to reach it.

That being said. I tried two drinks and they're adequately good. But they don't feel very special or superior - and they're more twice the price of Trad'r Sam (where you can get a giant boozy scorpion bowl for $14 that 3-4 people can get properly buzzed off of). Would prefer the drinks either become more creative or the prices to come down (not going to happen... so hopefully the drink menu gets more varied).
author: Sylvia L.

description: Wanted to try something new and different for my bday after dinner. Not a bad place, just a bit small tbh but it didn't ruined the experience. Drinks were good. I wish the place was bigger but definitely has that cool vibe going on.
author: Joanne A.

description: Yayyyyy....so happy I found this tiki bar....a great relief from the usual over crowded dive bars of SF. Their drinks are great....I have literally tried all their drink bowls...all super yummy and fun to drink...the rum monkey is my fav....their ambience is lovely too..they have really paid attention to detail...don't forget to check out their bar area in the back with starry lights....the service is awesome too...very friendly and attentive bartenders...they ensure you get your drinks fast :)
author: Rithu J.

description: Very cool, but a little expensive for my taste. However the drinks were good, the decorations were cool, the bartenders in the back room were awesome. I'd come back if I find myself downtown.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Time to add this one to the downtown bar rotation. Pagan Idol is awesome.

I used to a visit a tiki bar in downtown San Mateo all the time when I lived down there, and I may have found my new go-to. The drinks are fantastic, and their descriptions are so fun: including ingredients like happiness and ancient curses in addition to the usual bevy of tropical rums and fruit juices. They're definitely strong, but totally worth it. I highly recommend splitting a punch bowl with some friends, and watch in awe as they light your drink on fire.

The decor is what really sets this place apart though. It starts from the exterior; the entrance looks like the door to a tiki hut, and the first room you enter has a bunch of candlelit tables, kraken-like tentacles coming out of the wall, and a large fish tank. You then go to a second room where you truly feel underwater. It's darker, and there are aquarium-like tanks behind the bar that really add to the underwater feeling. Beyond that, there are tiki huts with a star-lit ceiling and various weather and volcano effects. There's even an elevated area with neat jungle decor. Absolutely check this place out if you're in the area.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
There is a new Tiki God in town. Pagan Idol delivers all the best aspects of the classic tiki lounges of the past, and then some.  Bottom line: For an outrageous great tiki bar experience, Pagan Idol is a major win.  For more info, read below:

DRINKS:
An impressive tiki cocktail menu sports mostly house specialties, with variations on the classic recipes ( Maybe Grog is their Navy Grog ).  The drinks are made with extreme care and presented beautifully. The recipes are well balanced and taste appropriately complex.  Great.

DECOR:
This is where Pagan Idol really excels.  The front room has a bar, where the tone is more relaxed, more light available, but still with awesome tiki decor and flavor. It then goes into a back room which features a beautiful second bar, with amazing decorations along the back wall.  There is a star-lit ceiling, and private huts in the back area.  It's spacious with fun nooks and crannies for parties to enjoy themselves.  There's an elevated area in the back with a cool tropical jungle scene.

MUSIC:
Again, spot on. Ambient music features Martin Denny style exotica.  Appropriate mid-century Polynesian romanticized soundtrack.  Great.

AMBIENCE / CLIENTELE:
My visit was during the soft opening period, so it wasn't super crowded yet, but the interior is spacious enough that I can't imagine it ever getting too crazy inside.  Bartenders were very lively and excited about the cocktails.  One of the managers even took time to talk to me briefly about the bar.  It has a welcoming vibe, dark lounge atmosphere, great time.

BONUS:
Tiki bars will sometimes have a few extra pieces of fun. This one features a periodic atmosphere-changing effect, in form of a thunderstorm.  Lights flash, thunder claps, and mist and fog fills the back room area.  As this is a Tiki-Exotica theme bar, it's appropriately great.

I'm so happy that Pagan Idol is part of the new tiki family.  Hats off to the owners, and I hope it stays around for a long time.
author: David B.

description: The cocktail r strong! Get 2oz shot in it!!! I love the banana cocktail  so tasty! The interior design is cool  so Hawaii
author: Alicia S.

description: Definitely the best tiki bar in the city! Went here they first opened up. It's brought to you by the same owners of bourbon and branch, rickhouse, devil's acre, local edition, and tradition. It's right around the corner from rickhouse. The interior is super themed and definitely feels like you're on an island. They even have a volcano in the back with stars blinking in the sky. The cocktails are super delicious and potent. We had various cocktails that night and remember that my two favorites were the day walker and the birds of paradise. Definitely check this bar out if you're in the financial district!
author: EccentricAura A.

description:
I used to work in FiDi and can't believe I had never heard of this place! The bar is gorgeous and gives off a really cool vibe, you feel like you're in some magical world. I came here on a Friday night around 9pm to hang out with a girlfriend and catch up. There was no line & no cover! This is one of those bars that you come to with friends to just hang out; it never gets too packed so you can actually hear each other and have a conversation.  Finding a table is fairly easy, and they also have these cool huts for a group sizes that seem fun. The cocktails are yummy and super cute! I was disappointed with my first drink however, it was one the bartender suggested called the Flex on the Beach. It comes out of a slushy machine which takes away from the drink even though at the end she added decor to make it pretty, it still made me upset that I had ordered it. There was a fire drink that a lot of groups were ordering out of a bowl, so if you want something fun, go this route! The bar is pretty big, and there are actually two rooms, the one in the back is bigger and has more things going on. 

Suggestions, order your drinks at one time for your group. The bartenders put a lot of work into making most of the drinks, so it takes a lot of time and you don't want to be going back and forth. If you are looking for a fun chill place to hang out with friends or bring out of town guests, this is it!
author: Anita S.

description: These people are very racist and that they kicked out for np reason other than the color of our skin. I would recommend never going to this establishment ever. They are horrible, unfair, racistC and fascist!
author: jp v.

description: This place is fun!  Really nice thematic atmosphere.  The decor is really well done.  Awesome drink options and great areas to chill and hang out.  Pretty popular and servers/staff are really cool.
author: Serina K.

description:
Everything about this bar makes me so happy - the quality of the drinks is superb, the staff is friendly, the ambiance is perfectly kitschy. You can rent out little cabanas in the back of the bar with friends. The only downsides are the wait outside and the fact that there's no dancing. 

I wish they started playing, like, 90s hip-hop when the clock hit midnight. Then this would be my dream bar.
author: Claire S.

description:
It's a good place to hit in the evenings. 
Some of the cocktails were good, some were Awful.

Heard a lot about the Amazon theme, but didn't live up to my expectations, hence I give it 3 stars.
author: Ankit K.

description: Pagan Idol, you have FANTASTIC ambiance and great bartenders.  Unfortunately, your drink offerings and prices are not nearly as desirable.  Great place to take a visitor or meet up for ONE drink.  I ordered two and neither was worth the $13-15 price tag ($35 total for 2 drinks).  Sometimes there are workarounds at SF theme bars, but when the guy next to me ordered a bottled beer and it was $9, that's when you realize it's time to say goodbye to the fish tank and close out your tab.  How many $15 tiki cocktails can someone tolerate without heading out for a legit old-fashioned, Manhattan, or martini.  Answer: ONE.
author: Karen W.

description: Great drinks and atmosphere, I would have given an extra star but a few of the bartenders a little condescending. I would however give it another try. Please serve some kind of snacks!!!
author: Mark N.

description: $30 for two drinks, neither of which were palatable. I'll give them credit for the awesome atmosphere, but I did not like the drinks at all.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
What a fun place to be! Plus they carded me, even though I'm in my forties! That felt great! lol

I love the underwater feel of the place and cthulhu everywhere! Yummy drinks, too bad you don't keep some of the cups!
author: Carmelo W.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. The reason for the 0 is 100% the bar tender. He was extremely rude and in the worst mood I have ever seen a person be in. I thought bar tenders are supposed to be fun lol. Extremely surprised by the negative attitude this guy was radiating. I don't understand why he is working there if he is so unhappy. A completely party pooper. You get there and you are all happy. The moment you goto the bar to order drinks you want to goto the corner and cry after meeting this guy.
author: Ria S.

description:
YASSSSS

SF may have an influx of tiki bars, but I'm always happy to find a new one.  Nothing is better than tropical booze - am I right!?  Pagan Idol is also no ordinary tiki - they have a wide selection of non-rum drinks (hello scotch and tequila!) and don't even get me started on their starry night ceiling.  

Beware of long lines during the Happy Hour crowds and a few too many Fidi bros, but definitely, absolutely, come here.

ps. get the birds of paradise (or whatever it's actually called) - holy yum!
author: Lindsey G.

description: Decent place, definitely a more corporate like crowd which has its pros for sure. I'll be back with friends, definitely NOT a place you'd wanna just go get a beer at though as it's mainly for groups of people.
author: Anonymous ?.

description: This place is such a blast! And the drinks are so good! I love the style of not only the bar but the staff. I have the day walker 2.0 and it is a must try! I'm determined to try a new drink every time :)
author: Cynthia J.

description:
A two act story, told in architecture. A cocktail list with whimsy, authenticity, and special touches to make them unique. Simply a win across the board.

Had heard so much about Pagan, but haven't had the chance to get to the bay in far too long. Finally, tonight, made it. And its so worth it. It's a different "blend" of Tiki in a ciry/region that holds some of the best Tiki spots in the world. Instead of competing, they pivoted. They pivoted to something very much their own (see first paragraph).

The bar is still young, and still coming together, but when you walk through into the second act of the bar.... their deft talent and potential is readily apparent.

As for the cocktails, only tried out two tonight, but they were both very good. The Maybe Grog is stellar. Excellent spice dancing in the spirits. The Witchdoctor is a wholly unique and we'll balanced drink. Reminds me of a Ramos Fizz mixed with a Bahainian.
author: Brad B.

description: Ok so it does take awhile to get a drink, but it's worth it. These tiki drinks are not simple to make; there's cut-out design sprays, fruit-kabobs, blenders, and mini-torches needed for some of these drinks. But the bartenders do a great job of pumping drinks out as fast as possible. I'd recommend a visit if your in the mood for some tropical drinking.
author: Robert L.

description: Visiting this local Tiki paradise for the first time. It progressively gets better as you saunter further back. The decorations and little hidden gems make it another great Tiki Bar in San Francisco. Having the Mai Tai float made with fresh ingredients and house made Orgeat. It's very flavorful yet smooth. Presentation by the Bartenders is outstanding, quite a show. I'll be visiting often.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Brought here by my hip daughter. The place was full of loud overpaid young professionals. The drinks are good but pricey (Hence the clientele). It's very noisy and hard to get a private table. Good for young adventurous types not so much for middle age stick in the muds
author: Rich K.

description: The location for the bar is pretty good. The interior is super nice. It's contemporary but yet has a tiki feel to it. It's pretty big inside. When you look up to the ceiling, it looks like you're out in the field staring at stars which is really creative and unique for a bar. Love the design!! Towards the back area, they have a jungle looking area and every 20 minutes or so, the fog machine will activate. I just want to check out this bar since it's newly opened. We ordered the rum monkey hoping that they serve it in the seahorse bowl. According to my friend, they're running out since people kept stealing it. They served it in a monk bowl instead which is fine. Just thought it'll look nicer in pictures if it's in a seahorse bowl. The drink is pretty fruity but if you drink it fast enough, it actually hits you. I would definitely come back to this place to try other cocktails.
author: Cindy W.

description: Cool place but a bit messy in terms of service and people's logistics. Also very loud and pricey.
author: Serena P.

description: Great Tiki Bar with even better bartenders and drinks. I ordered the Mai Tai and my co-worker, the Daiquiri. The drinks are strong and delish. And the straws?! Long or bendy, a lot of fun!
author: Deborah B.

description:
How much time, money and effort did they put into creating this place?! It truly does feel like you're on an island!! I loveddddd it!!

The drinks are also super creative and yummy however they're on the pricer side. 15/per drinkish. I guess you're paying for the ambiance/creative cocktail combination.

I'll definitely be back again!
author: Tina J.

description:
We just finished dinner on our last night in San Francisco and hubby and I decided to try a Tiki Bar.  After searching on Yelp we decided to go to Pagan Idol.  As we walked inside the place was packed full of patrons. We tried to get to the bar to order some drinks but it was difficult to even get there. Luckily I eyed a couple that was just getting ready to leave and their seats were at the bar so I quickly maneuvered into their seats as they got up. Hubby was pretty impressed. LOL.
Even with our seats right at the bar we had to wait a bit to get our order in since everyone was trying to order from the three bartenders. When we could finally put in our orders I got Bird of Paradise and hubby got the Witch Doctor. Both cocktails were excellent and had plenty of alcohol in it. As we sipped away we could hear one of the bartenders saying that  they didn't expect it to be so busy that evening which probably explains the frenzy behind the bar. But I have to say, the three bartenders nailed it anyway. After our first cocktails my hubby and I decided to share the Jamaican Scorpion Bowl. It was pretty big and boozy.  
The atmosphere was pretty casual and the service was top notch. I had a wonderful experience here!
author: C C.

description: If you want pretty cocktails in a place with good ambiance, then you will like this spot. They have a smoke machine complete with sound effects that reminded me of being in Disneyland. The place looks magical to me and is reminiscent of Little Mermaid.
author: Leah Anne B.

description: Loved the tiki bar, yummy Mai Tai float and super friendly staff.  kinda surprised, they only serve drinks :/ Thanks but seriously people love a nibble, and /or snack.  Bring it!!
author: Janet P.

description: This place was so neat and the waitress that helped us was awsome and attentive! The drinks were good and strong. One of a kind place.
author: Sofia B.

description:
Went here last Saturday night. Cool, new spot for island-like fun. Much bigger than anticipated as it stretches all the way back. Just keep walking. The "ship-themed" look of the front gives way to the outdoor/island feel in the back and there seems to be plenty of seating around barrels, against the walls, etc. Lots of stools everywhere. Every so often the thunder sounds and smoke billows as the volcano erupts...cool! 

The drinks are fairly elaborate and pretty good. Our group went through: mai tai float, daywalker, maybe grog, a banana one, port royal, a coffee one...sounds like most of the menu. All were pretty good with the grog, royal and daywalker being the stronger of the bunch. 

The bartenders were all lively & fun, and put lots of finishing touches, flair and style into their drinks. Since our group was a bit bigger, we took over a section near the server station and it accommodated us well. You can reserve the booths as some other reviews have mentioned but there's only a couple & they may go quick, so I'd call far ahead of the day you plan to go. These are also the only spots you get served; otherwise you are on your own at the bar. Honestly, there was so much room, I think just going is fine and carving out your own spot.

All in all, a pretty cool place.
author: David L.

description: Sure the cocktails take about 10 minutes to make and they're on the pricier side, but you get what you pay for and everything I've tried off their menu has been delicious. If you're a cognac lover like I am, try the Port Royal. This place does get packed on Friday afternoons though so be prepared to wait for your drinks. Still a great tiki bar with a welcoming vibe and pretty patrons.
author: Sasha A.

description: Drinks are expensive, but such is San Francisco. Would much rather spend $10-$15 for a delicious cocktail in this fun environment here than for a shitty watered down cocktail downtown.
author: Carissa H.

description:
We were meeting some friends for dinner in Chinatown and they suggested we head to Pagan Idol (awesome name!) to start the evening with a cocktail.

Staff (even the bouncer!) could not have been nicer, which was nice to see at a popular bar, as there is often the risk of a "too cool for school" vibe about such places.

Customers were diverse, which was also cool--all ages, races, etc. Just a bunch of people out having fun with friends.

Cocktails were boozy and good; the old fashioned had a hint of cinnamon and hit the spot. We were seated at the bar itself, so we got to watch the bartenders work their magic, and it was evident they really cared about the quality of their product. The cocktail menu is, no surprise, island-heavy--lots of rum-based drinks featured. (As a non-rum fan, I went for that old fashioned.)

Only complaint: SO LOUD. Fun vibe, but not a particularly great place to catch-up with people unless you want to be hoarse by the end of the night. But, for a start-to-the-evening cocktail, it hit the spot; I'd happily return.
author: Craig P.

description: I was very impressed. even while very busy they took the time to hand craft their tiki drinks. The ambience is excellent. I highly recommend.
author: George P.

description: Not really sure if it's jut me, but a lot of their specialty drinks taste the same. On the bright side This place is ADORABLE, and the drinks are super strong. I love how the ceiling looks like it's made of stars. The staff is also really kind and attentive here, no city snobbery. There was a female bartender who took great care of us, I believe she was blonde. Maybe a light brunette? Either way everyone is really great.  It's a nice place to go to after a long day at work to meet some friends and have a drink and escape the city vibe. They also have those fishbowl type drinks you can set on fire. And beautiful fresh flowers they garnish everything with. I just wish the drinks had more of a tone to them. I would absolutely go back, but I just wouldn't find myself craving one of their drinks or anything.
author: Sierra B.

description: I like the relaxed and fun vibe of this place when happy hour gets going. It's a great place to meet a large group because it is fairly spacious in the back bar area. The staff are super nice and helpful, especially Jeannie and Justin. The one thing I would warn people about is the periodic sounds of the pagan idol--it's a little startling the first time. That said, I will definitely be back.
author: Catherine T.

description:
Great new entry to the SF tiki bar rotation. This place is huge with two main bars. The back bar area has a volcano with a smoke machine and some cool table cove rooms. I went on a rainy night and got in at around 7pm without a wait. By 9pm, there was a line of about 10 people out the door.

I got the Witch Doctor, which was really good. The serve the drinks with fresh herbs and freshly ground nutmeg. The bartenders are friendly and will make you off-menu tiki drinks as well (I got a Painkiller). The bar did get really busy by around 9pm. The decor also felt unfinished in some areas - it seemed like they could have filled out some more blank space in the back room. Definitely will be back soon to fill my coconut cream prescription.
author: Colin K.

description: Came here on a night they had a live tiki band - they are amazing! I had the Daywalker... some may think $15 is alot for a cocktail, but I've paid  $14 for a Rum & Coke in NYC....this drink is way more alcoholic and delicious than any average cocktail. Plus the unique experience  makes it definitely worth the $$$
author: Tina P.

description:
What can I tell you, this place is legit. The decor goes way beyond gratuitous chinoiserie or mere kitsch. It's "tasteful" Tikki--if there is such a thing.

The menu is smaller than rhum-stalwart Smuggler's Cove, but that only makes it easier to choose. JP took great care of us and din't flinch when we decided to order off-menu as well. You can tell that there are some regulars who give this fi-di hotspot a neighborhood feel. I'm sure with the after-work crowd they get their fair share of douchebaggery, but I get the impression the staff would be the kind to make sure everyone can relax and have a good time.

Only thing I can't figure out is how they feed all those fish in the giant aquarium behind the opposite wall. And aren't we supposed to be in drought?
author: Sven E.

description: You walk into a tropical, under the sea environment. Drinks are good and creative, but wear something light it's HOT and stuffy and your makeup will melt off.
author: Cynthia G.

description: If you need a tropical escape from the 9-5 work life, this is the place to go. Pagan Idol is one of the newer bars in the Financial District and makes you feel like you've set sail and left the city as soon as you walk in. Complimenting their smooth tropical cocktails is a tiki themed environment complete with an occasionally thunder storm, fog, and stars.
author: Bobby S.

description: Visiting San Francisco I was dead set on making it to The Tonga Room but was unable to swing it. Searching for an alternative we landed on Pagan Idol. What a great find! This place has all the kitschy tiki decoration your heart desires, including really cool kraken-devouring-a-ship wall sconces. The drinks were top notch - the bartender even went out of his way to serve a drink in a pineapple for my friend that normally is served in a glass. A+ decor, A+ service, great experience.
author: Debra G.

description: I was playing tourist in the city and wanted to go to a tiki bar. Since I was already in the Embarcadero area, Pagan Idol was an easy 10 minute walk. super cute and you are transported to the islands as soon as you walk in haha. kitcshy decor, flashing lights on the ceiling, and themed drinks - all so cute! the place was fairly crowded around 9pm on a friday night, but my group of 8 was able to find a corner spot to stand and hover with our drinks haha. i started off a sweet punch drink, A Poolside Affair (~$10) and it was a great start to the night to the night - resfreshing, tasted good and was easy to drink which is a dangerous recipe haha. the Witch Doctor drink (~$12) was another favorite for our group and it comes in this cool tiki face cup haha. the real highlight of our night was the big punchbowl drinks that they have! we opted for the Fassionola Gold (~$50 for 4-5 people) that not only tastes good but it comes with oversized straws that are fun and a fire show! haha. every so often, there's some cool smoke effect that gets everyone in the tiki bar mood too. overall a really cool place to hang out and have some fun with friends!
author: Kristin B.

description:
Walking down Bush St, we saw a line forming at this place and decided that it was almost 4, so let's jump in. The doors opened, greeted nicely, the little bar was mobbed pretty quickly. Took around 10 or maybe 15 minutes to get our drinks, 2 Mai Tai floats. Normally I'd be a little put off by the long wait, by they got slammed fast and the drinks were delicious and strong. 

Then a bell rang, and the back room of awesome grooviness opened. Tiki fun, starry skies, 2 more Mai Tai's, friendly service. It's a good thing I don't live in SF. I'd have a Pagan Idol habit. Go. It's fun!
author: Jeff M.

description: Hands down one of the best tiki decor I've seen. The motif of the entire bar is just so well crafted and almost Disney-like in the details - my favorite were the glowing skulls under the stairs between the rooms :D my boyfriend and I  were here for the weekend as tourists and we love tiki bars so we thought we'd try this one out. The drinks were awesome too and our bartender DeeDee (sp?) was super nice and friendly and very helpful in giving tips about what we might like for our drinks. Can't wait to come back to SF to go again!
author: Nicole D.

description: Boozy goodness from the same team behind Bourbon & Branch. The drinks here are nice and strong and frankly dangerous because of how tasty they are. I came early after they opened on Friday and grabbed a table in the front. You do have to go to the bar to order, so that can take a while even early after they open, but it's worth it! It has all the typical decor you'd expect at a tiki bar and is definitely one to check out. My only wish was to have some food to munch on :/
author: Jenny W.

description:
Good drinks. (Not too sweet. Yay!) Great tiki atmosphere. But so loud my ears were ringing the next day.  
The place is large, so perhaps the front bar is quieter but it was all pretty off the hook loud on a Sat night.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Great place, gets busy around 10pm. Bars are always packed, which means you'll have to wait in line to order and you probably won't get a seat unless you arrive early. But the cocktails are *very* well made and the bartenders really put their skills up front and center.
author: Leo M.

description: This place has it all! Beautiful delicious drinks and a great tiki ambience, plus the staff are always super friendly.
author: Hayley Y.

description: Super fun tiki bar with good drinks! If you want to sit in the more private huts you can reserve one in advance - I would highly recommend!
author: Mackenzie L.

description: Loved this adorable little bar. Went on a Thursday night and it was great. No wait. Not too busy. The staff and security were friendly and welcoming, it was our first time. The guests themselves were a little stuck up to us but that's no ones fault, lol. I'll be back to try the rum monkey!!!!
author: Daisy S.

description: I have been to most of the tiki bars in SF and went here for the first time last weekend. First off this tiki bar was created by the same people behind Bourbon & Branch and because of this you know the drinks will be (and were) good. One issue is the selection of drinks is limited (compared to other tiki bars) and they are pricey but that should be expected. They do offer souvenir mugs which you can take home (awesome!). Finally, I was very impressed by the decor (cue erupting volcano) and it is obvious that a considerable amount of time and effort was put into this gem. Break from the norm and experience one of the best tiki bars in SF!
author: David H.

description: Aesthetically pleasing, a beautifully crafted space. Friday night around 9pm, wasn't too crowded but once we were finished there was a line.  On to the important part, the drinks. Was sharing with a friend so needed to find something that we both liked. The bartender suggested an off-menu option "Quarantine order" for two. It was delicious and not too sweet which is what we were looking for. I can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu.
author: Michelle S.

description: Amazing environment with the greatest bartenders. We really enjoyed our time here. Strong and delicious drinks that are huge and guarantee a great time! Overall I highly recommend this awesome spot!! Bird of paradise is really sour but the passion fruit whipped cream was amazing!! Mai Tai is really strong and delicious. Dawn Patrol was surprisingly my favorite drink of the night! It was unexpectedly strong and not overly sweet, which was amazing! I also requested a drink that has coconut in it and she made me an off menu drink called the Mind Eraser- it was so strong and so delicious!! Overall this place is amazing, but I will warn you, the $13 drinks add up quickly!!
author: Kimiya M.

description: One of the coolest tiki bars I've been to. Decor and ambiance are on point. We arrived about half an hour after opening on a Saturday night and it was packed, so it took a while to be noticed by one of the bartenders and tiki drinks are made with pretty flowers and such so that also takes some time. I started with bird of paradise and was not impressed with the taste but it was pretty then I had the one with the marshmallow, that one I enjoyed but forgot the name. Once the back room opened up it was much easier to order.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Cool place...
I believe it's the same owners as Bourbon & Branch, and I loathe that place, so job well done here.  First, the good:  really cool space.  Love the theme and the decorations and the artificial smoke.  The drinks are well crafted and tasty with lots of fresh ingredients.  The bartenders are smooth, tolerant, professional and friendly.  The only fault being when I asked for a zombie, they acted like I was some kind of idiot.  Umm..a zombie is a pretty standard Tiki bar drink.  I have been drinking them at Frankie's in Vegas for about 15 years.  Anyway these guys have a tough job grinding out these time consuming cocktails.  All in all I like the place for what it is.  There are some minor flaws - 1) Parking sucks. A couple garages in the area charging $12 flat rate...Take a rideshare. 2) I know these drinks take a lot of time and have a couple of shots in them, so I don't mind at all paying a premium price, but the bowls for the shared drinks are very small, and I finished my grog in about 3 sips and was left with a full glass of crushed ice.  
So - a great place to meet up, enjoy the ambiance and have a couple of cool, tasty cocktails and move on.  I can't drink all that high priced sugar all night.  They have a spirits list, but it's mostly rum (at up to $65 for a shot).  I will definitely be back.
author: Ken P.

description: Came here for the first time last night for our company holiday party. Great design, cool spot. Inventive and flavorful drinks on the menu. Will be coming back for sure.
author: Bill W.

description: Waited 20 minutes and still didn't get a drink. F this place. Forbidden Island, here I come--you are a true Tiki bar and aren't overrun by a-hole tech dudes.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Fun!  Good atmosphere.. I appreciate the dedication to the theme in all the design aspects.  Ordered from 3 different bartenders in one night, and they were all very nice people with positive attitudes.  We tried a bunch of individual cocktails from the menu, and they were all enjoyable.. Need to return to try the bowls.  Only downside is there is no food on the menu.  We had to leave for a bite and come back.  We went on a Tuesday night, so seating wasn't an issue for us going in and out.
author: Tanya P.

description: This place is great! Love the tiki theme - staff are super helpful and accommodating. I'm not usually a rum fan so I tried the Bird of Paradise (tequila drink) and it was delicious. Careful, they go down easy ;) The place is HUGE inside and we sat next to the fog machine/volcano - overall it was a great happy hour spot!
author: Tori M.

description: Excellent tiki bar! But...Might be about finding the right time to be there, because could hardly hear the people I was talking to while yelling in the after work hours.
author: J K.

description:
I'm giving 5 Stars - And let me tell you why. Most people will remove stars for trivial issues like sugary drinks (it's a Tiki Bar, do you not know that ALL Tiki cocktails are practically built off rum and sugared juices?), the service (it's a NEW BAR, everyone wants to be there, the staff is going to be swamped) and how long it takes to get a drink (again, Tiki drinks are craft cocktails, they are not simple well cocktails or three ingredient drinks you shake on up)..so naturally they will take a long time, have long lines, and be some of the sweetest cocktails you've had - that's just how Tiki bars have been and likely always will be as long as people frequent them in this resurgence of 60s kitsch. 
So why the 5 stars? The menu is simple - it has some great classics, awesome new cocktails, and house specials. It's not a large menu, but has quite the selection The Mai Tai's are spot on, the Navy Grog has that Orgeat meets "tropical gum" type flavor, and the Daywalker is pretty much a zombie, named from an employees love of The Walking Dead - makes sense, after drinking it, I was ripped and felt like I was wondering aimlessly around this bar.

The decor - this is where they shine bright like a diamond, or in their case, shine bright like a star - and there are plenty of stars that flicker in the night sky. With a black ceiling, fiber optic lights through out mimic the night sky over a beach resort complete with tiki huts that sit 4-6 (you won't ever get one of these no matter how hard you try, unless you get there and wait in line and are literally the first people waiting for hours before they open) - and yes, there is foliage, and the fantastic volcano/waterfall combination with little lagoon at the bottom. Again, mostly fiber optic simulations but it's too charming to care that its not done all LED light style like other bars have been creative with. Beside, optics allow them to change things over time, and do not get damaged. Attention to detail in the video screen fishtank portals in the Captains Quarters in the front side of the bar. Be sure to look up, see the Kraken lighting fixtures. Part Pirate, Part classy ship, part shipwreck on a South Pacific Island.

This place gets PACKED. Like to the point other bars like Tonga Room and Smugger's Cove get, where only some are allowed in, others made wait till the space clears out a bit. It's normal and natural for all new themed bars to do this, I don't understand why people have a problem and think things are "overrated" by that. Be a tiki die-hard fan, and not just a lush, and you will love this place and realize its worth. I sure do!
author: William D.

description: Drinks were expensive but the atmosphere is amazing. Other than the Disney Sams Traders, nothing comes close. Again, expensive
author: Ryan C.

description: This place was great the night I was here. Great atmosphere, live music, strong tiki drinks. But then the next day, I tried to find my jacket I left here.  I came twice but had no luck (not the bars fault.. some other patron probably took it). The first time I was helped nicely with one guy going and checking the lost-and-found for me and eventually returning to tell me no luck. However, I later remembered I hung it from one of those purse hooks under the bar and decided to go back and double check. After waiting for somebody to help me for awhile (it was busy) I saw somebody head into the back area of the bar (where I left my jacket) and figured I would just go back and look for myself. No dice. However, I then asked a server back there about my jacket only to realize it was the same person I talked to earlier. He recognized me and gave me a BS line that he would only talk to me about it further if I went back into the main bar area. Apparently the back area of the bar was reserved for a private party I had stumbled onto for a few moments while looking for my jacket. I apologized and left, but the server was clearly not actually going to follow me and just said that to get me to leave. Rude! I wasn't belligerent (it's 7:30pm on a Wed) but still felt treated poorly for somebody who just wanted to find a one-of-a-kind jacket that had sentimental value. Thanks Pagan Idol for your hospitality!
author: Chris M.

description: Funky looking place that makes you feel like you're in a Tahitian cave. The place was packed! Fun overall.
author: Bill R.

description:
A tiki bar right in downtown. Came on a weekend after dinner at belden alley and the amount of crowd is just right. Not too packed where you cant breath and smell body odor and fart (like the previous night elsewhere)I believe due to the location of the area.
Drinks are sweet, my friend got the $30 punch bowl that says good for 2 to 3 on the menu but it actually came in a shallow bowl for 1!  Other than that most drinks price wise are on par with other establishments in the vicinity. Theres a loud thunder sound and smoke seemingly every 15 min or so. 
Overall fun place and makes me want to get glow in the dark stickers for my ceiling upon seeing their star lit ceiling. 
*3 stars instead of 4 because of the price to size ratio of the punchbowls.
author: CP K.

description: Delicious tiki cocktails by the Bourbon & Branch minds.  Definitely not bargain cocktails, but they're worth the splurge (we're in FiDi guys) and service was great.  Be sure to try the shared drinks if you're with a group.  2 choices can suit a pair as well, but if you're on a date maybe avoid the strong Scorpion Bowl unless you can handle the booze.
author: Kellyn W.

description: I couldn't grab a seat when I wanted to meet my friend here for happy hour. It was poorly ventilated, I was dying. I wish they had a outdoor area but no, so sat next to their lovely lagoon/aquarium nook for awhile asking myself if I wanted to brave the crowded, loud, and intolerably miserable sweat and humidity for one of these delightful girly cocktails, but considering it was much cooler outside we headed across the street to one of those cute alley restaurants, b-44 for some tapas and happy hour pinchos and sangria. Seriously circulate the air, and I might actually come back for the drink. One star for the decor, another for the drink selection. tres estrellas negativos for the overall ambiance.
author: Onika C.

description: I've already been here a handful of times since opening--such a fun spot! The drinks are carefully crafted and delicious. I love the starry-sky ceiling and tiki decor. It's much less stuffy than other FiDi bars, and (dare I say) an overall better experience than the Tonga Room.
author: Lauren T.

description: Yup it's a Tiki bar. Gets pretty crowded, and a scorpion bowl will keep 3 people busy for $50. Not the best deal on drinks, but you came here for the ambiance right? If you don't care for the ambiance, move along -- nothing to see here.
author: Adam D.

description: What a fun place! I don't usually like gimmicky bars but Pagan Idol does it well. You walk in and it def feels like a tiki bar. The drinks were delicious and the bartenders were friendly. Hubs even said their Mai Tai was one of the best he's tried. Looking forward to coming back here (not during HH) and trying the punch bowls and secret menu tiki drinks!
author: Lynn C.

description: This tiki bar always seems to have the perfect size crowd and the drinks are horribly addicting!  (Although the menu does rotate so if you have a favorite, you might not find it the next time so you can always find new favorites.) You can get your drink served in a pineapple or coconut!
author: Beth I.

description:
I adore this place! It totally reminds me of Trader Sam's at Disneyland! I'm a huge Disney fan so it was suggested that I check out Pagan Idol. 

Drinks are a bit pricey but you're really paying for the ambiance. There's so much attention to detail in the decor and I love the volcano! 

Docked a start because there is always a line for the bathroom, there doesn't seem to be enough space for people wait for the bathroom, and the bathrooms can get pretty gross. Not what you'd expect from a nice place like this.

it can get very crowded and it gets pretty stuffy in the back room. Highly suggest reserving a tiki hut if you're going with a group because seating fills up super fast and it gets very crowded.
author: Yuri K.

description: Dope Spot! Excellent Craft cocktails for Rum lovers, one of the better Tiki Bars i've been to. Good service the bartenders were cool, creative decor and good seating. I'll give it a nod over The Pirates Cove, even though I like that place too.
author: Efren G.

description:
I live nearby and wanted to wait what others say about this place, and here's why I may hesitate at returning or recommending to others after last Friday's visit:

1. I ordered a rum monkey at $30, it looks NOTHING LIKE the $50 drink they got on the menu, but they throw that on my bill instead. I marked it and told them about it, guess what...now I gotta get my credit card company involved to fix my charges.

2. Each of their $12, $15, $30, or $50 drinks take forever to make, and when I request them to just gimme the drinks without all the extra decorations, they refused & made me wait another 10 min to get the drinks ready.

3. All the drinks are extremely cold to hold, there's not a lot of places on the wall to put the drinks down, and warm up our hands. 

4. While on the subject on temperatures, it's extremely cold at the front, and very stuffy & warm in the back. I thought the owner fixed the AC issue at the back.

I'd probably recommend other tiki bar until this place fix itself up some more...sigh
author: Keoini H.

description: This place is so cute & fun! The staff was very accommodating and generous and the place is much larger than you'd thing from the front...be sure to check out the back room complete with a volcano. Get there early if you're with a larger group, but otherwise not too hard to find a spot for two.
author: Katie M.

description:
If you want a Tiki bar..This is it! Cool spot with fun atmosphere. Very cool vibe and 
diverse menu of drink choices.
author: Tom F.

description: Cool place. Recalls the Tonga Room and Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland compressed into a good sized bar.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Really good drinks and atmosphere. A little pricey but definitely worth it in the end.
author: Bree C.

description: Awesome decor. Great selection of rums and other spirits. I don't do cocktails much, but I've always gone with folks who do and they rave. One point off for lack of any diet soft drink, but they a great about mixing fruit juices for me so they get the point back.
author: alamedabrian m.

description: Another futurebars hitter. Futurebars really knows how to make a drink. I'm not what you would call an "alcohol connoisseur" but the drinks are delicious and do the job.
author: Alvin P.

description: I'm not a tiki bar fan per se, but my friend is, and I was curious to try this place. We met there around 5:30 pm on a Wednesday night and scored a seat at the little area to the left of the door. Drinks were sooooo pretty and very strong! Fun atmosphere, mixed crowd, GREAT bartenders. I like that they don't let it get too crowded - there were about 4 people in line as we left.
author: Mi M.

description: Pro: Great tiki theme with LED star lights as a nice touch. Con: HOT, need fans/mister for some tropical breeze to make it complete
author: Chris A.

description: The cocktails are OK for how much time they spend on them. About an hour wait per drink on a slow night. Bartenders are rude.
author: Brian B.

description: Fun New Tiki Bar in the financial district area! The drink menu is colorful with catchy names for their themed cocktails. Mai Tai is always a good choice. The Banana Life is tasty but super sweet. The layout of their location is odd for seating.
author: Taylor M.

description: Midpoint between the Tonga Room and Smuggler's Cove. Big space and well decorated. The bartenders are nice and enthusiastic. The drinks are yummy. When they first opened they had really cool glassware, but apparently people steal them :(. Good place for happy hour or drinks with friends. I like the lava pool in the back!
author: Zara S.

description: What's there to say except it's too many young people trying to be hip. I only had the Pina Colada which was festive looking and I imagine took time by the bartender to make. But it tasted like cough syrup and it was $15 plus $3 tip.
author: N A.

description: This place is a whimsical tropical paradise! The Tiki atmosphere is fantastic and rich in the tradition of campy island magic.  The drinks are mostly alright,  not the tastiest or most fruity which has made it tough for the ladies and not as much fire as I would like though the flowers make great presentation...  Stick to the Potion #9 or whatever the stuff from the slurpy machine is called.  It's the tastiest and also lowest priced.
author: Richard A.

description: Came here right when they opened around 6:30 on a Saturday night and it was already packed.  The back part of the bar which is the tiki area was not open yet.  They opened the tiki room around 7 pm which made for more room in the bar area.  The drinks were delicious and creative.  If you come with a group you can reserve a tiki hut in the back.
author: Katrina E.

description: Really good drinks if you like rum. They have a spacious area Hawaii themed.
author: Jordi R.

description:
Wow, what a place! Amazing decor!! I'm glad I went on a Tuesday night as I heard the line goes out the door the further into the week you go. 
Sailors will love this place. Be sure to wear your luau dress ;)
author: Laura P.

description: Just stopped 30 minutes for a drink, I loved the atmosphere, the crew, and the environment. Definitely a place I will go back to!
author: Jice E.

description: Best looking Tiki Bar. For drinks stick with the signature drink Love Potion No. 9. Very nice ambiance. I'll be back.
author: Marina H.

description: The drinks are good but not quite what I'd call a fair value given the prices. I was shocked to hear management say they don't care to serve certain kinds of customers. I guess it's good I was close to the Fi-Di yuppie mould in appearances the night I decided to give them a shot. They also seem to like creating a line outside (unnecessarily) to generate attention or create a sense of scarcity/exclusivity about getting inside. Their very large doorman is a class act and fabulous employee. If I ran a bar I'd want someone just like him at the door.
author: Braxton C.

description: Pagan Idol is around the corner from Rickhouse. Both are owned by Future Bars!  I got to Pagan Idol around 7:40pm earlier this evening and it was packed.  I ordered a Banana Life and friends got a drink called The Witch Doctor.  These tiki drinks were great, but the only things I have against Pagan Idol, which are fixable over time are the need for air conditioning (its as if the Tiki bar came with authentic Tiki Lounge weather) and the speed at which drinks are made (we waited 5-8 minutes per drink).
author: Brian L.

description: Super Trendy fun addition to the Tiki bar scene that is sweeping the country
author: Lyndsey G.

description:
Amazing tiki drinks! 

Alexandra was our bartender and watching her was like watching a master artist at work. One of, if not THE best bartenders i've ever seen in action! Im rarely impressed and i was very impressed with her work!

We enjoyed the Daywalker, the Banana life and others, but by far the best drink was the Witch Doctor. So complex and absolutely delicious! 

We got there before the rush, but when we left, there was a line around the corner!
author: Kristopher C.

description: Very interesting spot and well crafted drinks. Don't come here if you're looking to order drinks quickly as they put a lot of effort into these. Good spot if you love rum. For the liquor content and extravagantly crafted drinks the prices are fair in my opinion.
author: William W.

description:
We first went to Pagan Idol on it's maiden Saturday open. It was FABULOUS! We sat at the bar, got to meet a TON of very cool tiki people and had a wonderful evening. We went again a week ago and boy, how a couple weeks changes things. We went on a Friday night, which probably made a huge difference in the crowd. It was CHOCK FULL of twenty something singles trying to make moves on one another, all probably coming straight from their jobs in the financial district. Not at all like the crowd on the first visit. It wasn't a tiki bar atmosphere at all, just another pick up joint. That was disappointing. They removed the stools from the upper bar so it was just standing room only and people were herded through the ordering process and sent on their way. Again, disappointing. 

This is a BIG SPACE on the second level but has minimal seating. Mostly you have to just stand around with your drinks and hold them or most the seating is all along the walls so you are backed up against the wall like you are at a middle school dance. There is all this empty space and... people. People standing in clumps everywhere. Kind of makes you feel like they don't want you to stay. Have your cocktail and move on. 

We have been twice and between the two visits, we've tried probably 8 cocktails total off the menu. The drinks definitely were better our first go round and the second time, they were weak. Our first trip, we each had three drinks a piece. This time, one and done. I would much rather go the Forbidden Island in Alameda for a cocktail that stands up to it's rating on the menu with the atmosphere to back it up. Pagan Idol is a kitschy place to go for novelty but if you want a real tiki drink hit up Longitude, Tonga Room, Trader Vic's (In Emeryville) or Forbidden Island. I can guarantee you will have a more memorable visit.
author: S C.

description: It was a dark stormy night. I was looking for shelter from what had become an unsalvageable evening and alas in the horizon appeared the Pagan Idol. To my surprise it's like being immediately transported into the belly of a pirate ship. Great drinks, volcanic eruptions, and Caribbean tunes created the ultimate escape into another world. Maybe a bit cheesy but let yourself go and have some fun it's a good time
author: Susan J.

description: Such a fun neighborhood hangout! If you like the ambiance of the Tonga room, but are looking for something a little less touristy, this is your spot. Try a volcano drink with friends, or one of their blended cocktails. FYI, the themed cups are for sale! There is not really any music, which is great if you are looking to talk to the person you are with, but not as fun for a rowdy night.
author: Sharon R.

description: OK brand new place.  They make some cool drinks that are quite powerful.   If you wan't a neat place to hang with a totally laid back vibe then this place is right up your alley,  I did go on a week night so a much different experience that probably a weekend night.  I will be back had a good time and bartenders were extremely friendly.
author: Rich L.

description: Went with a group of work colleagues, there were 17 of us. I was 5 min later than the rest of the team, the doorman made me wait 20 min to get in even though it was quite inside. Then he waved his powerful finger at me as it was my turn to go in, and he carded me, I was happy to get carded, so I showed him my passport and he didn't want to accept it. I phoned the team inside and we left to another bar. We spent $1200.00 around the corner.
author: James M.

description: Loved this place!! Bartenders were very patient when I asked about the drinks on the menu. I had the Pineapple express (a few, because they were so tasty) My wife I arrived around 10ish and we found a lovely place to sit by the waterfalls to talk and enjoy the décor. Will visit again!!
author: Henry H.

description: I saw one of the bartenders stop squeezing juice to pick his nose, then return to squeezing juice.  Promptly said my goodbyes and left.  No goblins in my grog thanks.
author: David N.

description: Had the best Mai Tai I've ever had last night. This place is fantastic! From the decor to the quality drinks this place is definitely worth the visit. We'll be back!
author: Debra G.

description: Awesome bar with great decor and tasty drinks!  Almost an escape from the madness of the Financial District.  Definitely recommend sharing the bowls.
author: Christina Z.

description: So much fun! We had no idea what we were walking into but we're glad we did. The decor and styling of this place is impressive and entertaining. We ordered a Mai Tai and a Pineapple Express, both yummy, strong and not too sweet. I can't wait to go back with more friends to enjoy the fun atmosphere and delicious drinks.
author: Katie R.

description: Absolutely awful experience. Sat down in the back area and harassed by the bouncers for "talking too loudly" -- granted this was on a Saturday. Our whole group felt unsafe during this entire experience.
author: Calvi J.

description: awesome looking bar and the drinks are strong and taste great. looks like you are inside of a ship and have lots of tropical fish to look at!
author: Julian F.

description: This place was just ok for me.  Positives first: the attention to detail is stunning - like Walt-Disney level attention to detail.  That being said, my drink (I forget what it was called but it had pineapple in it) was just okay.  Some of the ingredients didn't seem to mesh together.  I'd be willing to give it another try, though.
author: Kelly M.

description: literally the most magical bar have ever been to. drinks are super tasty too.
author: Catie C.

description: Went for Thursday happy hour with some work friends, the drink menu looks good but even with 5 bartenders I was there for 30 minutes and didn't even get close to getting served at either bar so I left. They need to figure out some logistical issues because at ~3 minutes per drink times 5 bartenders they simply can't handle a crowd that size. Like others said the back is a bit stuffy especially when it's crowded. Will return another time, some of the drinks looked pretty promising. Can't rate then on that though since I walked away thirsty.
author: James D.

description: Met up some friends to catch up on a Friday after work for happy hour and there was a line out the door at 5:50PM! Luckily 2 of my friends were already inside so it was just me and my other friend waiting to get in. I was worried that the wait would take a while but the line moved fairly quickly and we were inside within 15 minutes. Right when you walk in, it's almost like instant darkness. But the theme and decorations inside were really cute! And the drink menu had a good amount of tasty looking drinks to choose from! Since I gave up hard alcohol for the year, I got this pineapple cider that was super refreshing and tasty! :) My friends got a few round of the tiki drinks and one of them was the scorpian bowl, which can be shared between 2-3 people. The bar is really nice especially with the aquarium in the background. Overall, this tiki bar is a pretty neat place to grab some yummy drinks with some friends and just hangout. But it does get pretty loud and crowded in here so come early!
author: Mary C.

description: I'd like to think we are Tiki Bar aficionados so we were so excited to stumble onto Pagan Idol in SF. They use quality ingredients for their drinks and know their sh^t when it comes to making a quality cocktail. Got a chance to chat with the bartender which was a pleasure - always nice to connect with someone who loves what they do. They have spent a lot on decorating that place and it looks awesome. Check out Pagan Idol - you won't be disappointed.
author: Dave M.

description: Walked in to an incredibly dark, small bar after work around 5:30. Bamboo on the walls, fake palm fronds, kitschy but kind of charming at the same time. There were a few tables in the front, but I wandered farther back and found that there was a hallway leading to a separate section of the place that was three times as large, as well as having another bar. Ordered a "Witch Doctor" from an exceptionally cheery and friendly bartender. $12 and about 5 full minutes later (a lot of ingredients) but it was indeed delicious and strong. Later on (7ish) the bar got pretty backed up and it took about 20 minutes to get a round. The back was even darker than the front and I literally used my phone flashlight to find people and read the drink menu. There was a lot more tiki themed decorations in the back, even the tables were logs and the stools were bamboo and wicker. Not my first choice for an after work bar because it was a bit expensive, and unnecessarily dark at 5:30 on a Tuesday, but I'd go to another happy hour there.
author: Nick H.

description: Fun decor. Good drinks. Get there early so you can find a place to sit. The place had a good crowd and a friendly vibe. I'll be back.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Was strolling near Belden Alley (had a 6:00 p.m. diner reservation) when I stumbled onto this place. Wow ... what an amazing tiki bar. The mai tai was the real deal. I will definitely be back on my next visit.
author: David J.

description: You feel like you're stepping into another world when you go to this place. The front is wood from top to bottom with portholes in the walls-you really feel like you're on a boat. The back has a starry nights and bamboo huts. The tiki drinks are delicious, perfectly balanced, and sneakily strong. Fun place to take a mini vacation from you're daily life!
author: Serina K.

description: Tasty! Crazy busy, which takes away from the tiki chill vibe. Butchery when you're serving incredible craft tiki drinks, you're going to draw a crowd.,
author: Suzie H.

description: Cool new tiki bar downtown. Definitely has a similar vibe as Tonga Room (though perhaps a younger crowd) and Smugglers Cove (though more spacious and "newer"). On a Thursday around 7, there was a decent size crowd - big enough to make you feel like you were somewhere hip but not so packed that you couldn't find somewhere to sit. Lots of after-work folks. We tried the Mai Tai and the Bird of Paradise - both were tasty and strong. Seems like a cool place for a fun date, or meeting up with friends after work downtown.
author: J L.

description: Having reservations for the VIP Tiki hut was awesome. They were ready for us when we got there. Great waitress made sure we were taken care of. Great addition to the Tiki Bars of SF.
author: Brenda G.

description: Outstanding tiki bar with a great selection of drinks and vibe.  I went there on Monday after work (~5:30pm).  It was beautifully decorated like the inside of a ship with lots of nice touches like oil lamps on the tables.  It was not crowded at all that early on Monday evening.  The drinks were fantastic with some really great riffs on traditional tiki drinks.  The Daywalker was delicious with a strong rum flavor.  The Witchdoctor was also really good with some nice spice and a less rum forward taste.  Highly recommended to check out.
author: Nate B.
